original: des na 'di ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not the case.

original: des na rtogs pa thams cad ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: des na rtogs pa thams cad ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, all cognitions are non-apprehending,

original: rtog pa yin pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi rtogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa yin pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi rtogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: because they are cognitions, like a dream cognition. This is faultless.

original: rtogs pa thams cad dmigs pa med pa des na /
analyzed: rtogs pa thams cad dmigs pa med pa des na /
translated: Since all cognitions are non-apprehending,

original: des na gzhan rig med pa'i phyir //üîΩrang rig 'bras bu yin par 'dod //
analyzed: des na gzhan rig med pa'i phyir // rang rig 'bras bu yin par 'dod //
translated: Therefore, since there is no awareness of other,üîΩSelf-awareness is accepted as the effect.

original: rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Self-awareness itself is the effect.

original: rnam par shes pa rang nyid skye ba ni //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rang nyid skye ba ni //
translated: The arising of consciousness itself

original: rang rig gsal bar byed pa yin gyi don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang rig gsal bar byed pa yin gyi don ni ma yin te /
translated: illuminates self-awareness, not the object,

original: don rtogs par byed pa la de nus pa med pa'i phyir dang / don rtogs pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rtogs par byed pa la de nus pa med pa'i phyir dang / don rtogs pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for it to have the capacity to realize the object, and because the realization of the object is not seen.

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gal te phyi rol myong gyur na //
analyzed: gal te phyi rol myong gyur na //
translated: If there is experience of external objects,

original: nyes pa ci yod ci yang med //
analyzed: nyes pa ci yod ci yang med //
translated: what fault is there? There is no fault at all.

original: phyi rol don de myong gyur pa //
analyzed: phyi rol don de myong gyur pa //
translated: If the external object is experienced,

original: 'di nyid kyis ni cir brjod 'gyur ;
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis ni cir brjod 'gyur ;
translated: what is this that is said?

original: ; rnam par dpyad pa zhib mo 'dis ci bya ste /
analyzed: ; rnam par dpyad pa zhib mo 'dis ci bya ste /
translated: What is the use of this subtle analysis?

original: phyi rol gyi nyams su myong ba nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi nyams su myong ba nyid do //
translated: [The answer is:] external experience.

original: 'bad pa 'di la 'bras bu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'bad pa 'di la 'bras bu ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the point of this effort?

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ji lta ba de lta yin la rag mod /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ji lta ba de lta yin la rag mod /
translated: Let it be as it is in worldly convention.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid du rtogs na ni gzhan du tha snyad byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid du rtogs na ni gzhan du tha snyad byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But when one understands that there is no object, one does not make assertions in any other way.

original: tha snyad las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu yang yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tha snyad las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu yang yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And there is no effect other than the assertion.

original: de yang ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: That is not so.

original: gal te tha snyad bsgrub bya na //
analyzed: gal te tha snyad bsgrub bya na //
translated: If the assertion is what is to be established,

original: tha snyad ji lta de ltar de //
analyzed: tha snyad ji lta de ltar de //
translated: then it is just as it is in worldly convention.

original: rig byed skyes bus ma byas la //
analyzed: rig byed skyes bus ma byas la //
translated: The Vedas are not the work of a person.

original: khyed kyi 'bad pa 'bras ci yod //
analyzed: khyed kyi 'bad pa 'bras ci yod //
translated: What is the point of your effort?

original: gang zhig gang med par med pa gzhan gyi mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni skyes bus byed pa las gzhan gyis ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang med par med pa gzhan gyi mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni skyes bus byed pa las gzhan gyis ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: The assertion of another, such as a sacrifice, which does not exist without that [Veda] is not refuted except by the work of a person.

original: ci ste de nyid la rnam par dpyad par byas pas don dam par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste de nyid la rnam par dpyad par byas pas don dam par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if one analyzes that [Veda], it becomes ultimate.

original: de lta yin na gzhan du yang dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na gzhan du yang dpyad par bya'o //
translated: If that is so, then it should be investigated elsewhere.

original: 'on te skyes bus byas pa nyid la tshad ma nyid yod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te skyes bus byas pa nyid la tshad ma nyid yod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is not valid cognition in regard to the fact of being created by a person,

original: 'di ni gzhan la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan la yang mtshungs te /
translated: then it is the same for the other.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid la @55b yang tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid la @55b yang tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, in regard to the fact of not being created by a person, there is no valid cognition.

original: gzhan yang gang tshe phyi rol 'dzin med pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang tshe phyi rol 'dzin med pa //
translated: Moreover, when there is no apprehension of external things,

original: de tshe chags sogs spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe chags sogs spong bar 'gyur //
translated: then attachment and so on are eliminated.

original: goms pa'i dbang gis 'jug pas na //
analyzed: goms pa'i dbang gis 'jug pas na //
translated: Because of the power of habituation,

original: de med na ni bzlog phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na ni bzlog phyir ro //
translated: when that is absent, they are reversed.

original: de kho na dpyad na 'dod chags la sogs pa zad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de kho na dpyad na 'dod chags la sogs pa zad par 'gyur la /
translated: When one investigates reality, attachment and so on are eliminated.

original: de yang skyes bu'i don gyi mchog yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de yang skyes bu'i don gyi mchog yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: And that is the highest goal of man.

original: des na de kho na nyid nges par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de kho na nyid nges par brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, reality should be ascertained.

original: phyi rol gyi don ni nyams su myong ba med de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ni nyams su myong ba med de /
translated: External objects are not experienced.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol don nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol don nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /
translated: In this regard, what is the meaning of the expression ‚Äúexperience of external objects‚Äù?

original: ci nyams su myong ba la zhugs pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba zhes tha snyad byed dam /
analyzed: ci nyams su myong ba la zhugs pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba zhes tha snyad byed dam /
translated: Is it called experience because it engages in experience?üîΩ

original: 'on te ma zhugs pa nyid du yin ;
analyzed: 'on te ma zhugs pa nyid du yin ;
translated: Is it called experience because it engages in the experience of an object, or does it not engage in the experience of an object?

original: des na 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: des na 'di skad brjod de /
translated: Therefore, this is said:

original: gal te blo ni de rnam can //
analyzed: gal te blo ni de rnam can //
translated: If the mind has that aspect,

original: rnam pa rjes zhugs can de yod //
analyzed: rnam pa rjes zhugs can de yod //
translated: and it exists as engaged with the aspect,

original: de ni phyi'am gzhan las zhes //
analyzed: de ni phyi'am gzhan las zhes //
translated: then it is either external or other.

original: 'di ni dpyad par rigs pa yin //üîΩde yi rnam pa can gyi blo //
analyzed: 'di ni dpyad par rigs pa yin // de yi rnam pa can gyi blo //
translated: This is the proper analysis.

original: zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe mind that has that aspect‚Äù?

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can no //
translated: It has the aspect of blue, etc.üîΩHow do you know that it has that aspect?

original: de'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ga las yin zhes 'di nyid da ltar dpyad par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ga las yin zhes 'di nyid da ltar dpyad par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: This is precisely what is being analyzed now.

original: des na blo de'i rnam pa can yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir yang de nyid blta bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na blo de'i rnam pa can yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir yang de nyid blta bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in order to show that it is the mind that has that aspect, it must be seen.

original: mthong ba de la yang de'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thug pa med do //
analyzed: mthong ba de la yang de'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thug pa med do //
translated: And if that seeing has that aspect, there is an infinite regress.

original: 'on te rnam pa med pas mthong na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa med pas mthong na /
translated: But if it sees without an aspect,

original: de'i tshe de nyid mthong ba yin pas rnam pa brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid mthong ba yin pas rnam pa brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Since it is seeing itself at that time, what is the use of investigating its aspect?

original: 'on te de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni de la nges par rtogs pa'i rnam pa 'am /
analyzed: 'on te de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni de la nges par rtogs pa'i rnam pa 'am /
translated: But if the so-called aspect of that is the aspect of the ascertainment of that,

original: mthong ba'i rnam pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rnam pa yin no zhe na /
translated: or the aspect of seeing that,üîΩthen at that time, what is the meaning of the terms ascertainment and seeing?

original: de'i tshe nges par rtogs pa dang mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhes bya ba 'di nyid brtsad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe nges par rtogs pa dang mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhes bya ba 'di nyid brtsad par bya'o //
translated: This is the very point to be investigated.

original: ci ste gnyi ga yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: ci ste gnyi ga yang mthong ngo //
translated: But if both are seen,

original: zhe na ; de lta na gnyi ga rang gi ngo bos mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: zhe na ; de lta na gnyi ga rang gi ngo bos mthong ba yin te /
translated: then in that case, both are seen by their own natures.

original: des na phan tshun 'dzin par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: des na phan tshun 'dzin par byed pa 'am /
translated: Therefore, since they do not mutually apprehend each other,

original: 'ga' yang ma yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang rang rig pa nyid do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'ga' yang ma yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang rang rig pa nyid do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: or they are not at all, it has been demonstrated that both are reflexive awareness.

original: ci ste phyi rol med na 'di nyid med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste phyi rol med na 'di nyid med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if external objects do not exist, then this consciousness would not exist.

original: de lta na 'o na blo med par lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na blo med par lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, then it would follow that without mind, the non-manifest would not exist.

original: 'on te lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid ni mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid ni mthong ba nyid do //
translated: But if it is not hidden, it is seen.

original: de lta yin na gzhan brtag par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na gzhan brtag par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, it is not to be investigated further.

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi blo yang mthong ba nyid pas gzhan brtags pas ci bya /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi blo yang mthong ba nyid pas gzhan brtags pas ci bya /
translated: But if the cognition that has its aspect is also seen, what is the use of investigating further?üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral ba //üîΩmi 'dzin de 'dzin @56a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral ba // mi 'dzin de 'dzin @56a * //
translated: Without the difference of seeing,üîΩit is not apprehended.

original: na 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: na 'dzin phyir //
translated: If it is apprehended,

original: sngon por snang ba mthong ba yin //
analyzed: sngon por snang ba mthong ba yin //
translated: it is seen as blue.

original: phyi rol yan gar don yod min //
analyzed: phyi rol yan gar don yod min //
translated: The external object alone does not exist.

original: mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Whatever is seen must be accepted.

original: 'di ltar snang ba'i nang du chud pa'i sngon po nyid snang gi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar snang ba'i nang du chud pa'i sngon po nyid snang gi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, only blue that is included in the appearance appears, not anything else.

original: des na snang ba las tha dad par ni tshad ma med do ;
analyzed: des na snang ba las tha dad par ni tshad ma med do ;
translated: Therefore, apart from the appearance, there is no valid cognition.

original: des na khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should not be accepted.

original: 'on te de ni snang ba'i nang du chud par mi snang de /
analyzed: 'on te de ni snang ba'i nang du chud par mi snang de /
translated: But if it is not seen included in the appearance,üîΩthen:

original: snang ba ni nang yin pa'i phyir dang / sngon po la sogs pa ni phyi rol du snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba ni nang yin pa'i phyir dang / sngon po la sogs pa ni phyi rol du snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: are external appearances.

original: tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If they are different,

original: de snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not appear.

original: de ni rang gi ngo bos lkog tu ma gyur pas snang ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ni rang gi ngo bos lkog tu ma gyur pas snang ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is not hidden by its own nature, it appears.

original: /'di ltar / gal te tha dad yin na ni //
analyzed: /'di ltar / gal te tha dad yin na ni //
translated: Thus, if they are different,

original: sngon po lkog gyur min mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sngon po lkog gyur min mi 'gyur //
translated: blue, etc. would not be hidden.

original: ngo bos lkog gyur min pa las //
analyzed: ngo bos lkog gyur min pa las //
translated: From that which is not hidden by nature,

original: de las lkog gyur min gzhan med //
analyzed: de las lkog gyur min gzhan med //
translated: there is no other that is not hidden.

original: dper na 'dzin pa'i rnam pa rang gi rang bzhin gyis lkog tu ma gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na 'dzin pa'i rnam pa rang gi rang bzhin gyis lkog tu ma gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: For example, the aspect of the apprehender is not hidden by its own nature,

original: 'dzin par byed pa gzhan yod pa las ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa gzhan yod pa las ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: but it is not from the existence of another apprehender.

original: de dang dus mtshungs pa can sngon po la sogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de dang dus mtshungs pa can sngon po la sogs pa yang yin no //
translated: In the same way, blue, etc. are simultaneous with it.

original: yang ji ltar 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam pa mig la sogs pa las yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam pa mig la sogs pa las yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Moreover, just as the aspect of the apprehender is from the eye, etc.,

original: de dang dus mtshungs pa gzung ba'i rnam pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de dang dus mtshungs pa gzung ba'i rnam pa yang yin te /
translated: in the same way, the aspect of the apprehended is simultaneous with it.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of cause and effect is characterized by the fact that the effect is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of the cause.

original: don gyi sngon dang phyis yod pa ni tshad mas nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi sngon dang phyis yod pa ni tshad mas nges pa ma yin te /
translated: The existence of an object prior to and subsequent to its perception is not ascertained by a means of valid knowledge.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma la mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma la mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because direct perception does not operate in the past or the future.

original: 'on te sngon nam phyis 'di med do zhes bya ba yang ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'on te sngon nam phyis 'di med do zhes bya ba yang ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: But how is it known that it did not exist previously or that it will not exist later?üîΩWhy is it not assumed that the aspect of the cognition or the feeling of pleasure existed previously?

original: blo dang bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yang ci'i phyir sngon yod par mi brtag /'on te bdag rtag pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: blo dang bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yang ci'i phyir sngon yod par mi brtag /'on te bdag rtag pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the same because the self is permanent,üîΩwhy is it not assumed that the object also existed previously, since it is not hidden?

original: 'o na lkog tu ma gyur pa yang snga nyid yod do zhes ci ste mi brtag /'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na lkog tu ma gyur pa yang snga nyid yod do zhes ci ste mi brtag /'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory.

original: ma rtogs pa ni lkog tu ma gyur par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni lkog tu ma gyur par mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that what is not realized is not hidden.

original: tha dad pa'i don ni rtogs pa med kyang 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i don ni rtogs pa med kyang 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is tenable that a different object is not realized,

original: tha dad do zhes gang gis rtogs /
analyzed: tha dad do zhes gang gis rtogs /
translated: by what means is it known that it is different?

original: de nyid phyir brgya la 'gyur ro zhes the tshom za bar rtsod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid phyir brgya la 'gyur ro zhes the tshom za bar rtsod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is doubtful that it is a hundred.

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid kyang ci'i phyir de lta ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid kyang ci'i phyir de lta ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so that it is not hidden?

original: lkog tu ma gyur par mi 'gyur bar thal ba'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur par mi 'gyur bar thal ba'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: It is not because it would follow that it would not be hidden.

original: gzhan gyi lkog tu ma gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lkog tu ma gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is hidden from others.

original: nga'i lkog tu gyur pa @56b yin zhes rtog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nga'i lkog tu gyur pa @56b yin zhes rtog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not conceived that it is hidden from me.

original: dkar po la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like white, etc.

original: gal te dkar po nyid bum pa la sogs pa gcig gi ma yin yang rdzas gzhan gyi yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te dkar po nyid bum pa la sogs pa gcig gi ma yin yang rdzas gzhan gyi yin pa nyid do //
translated: If whiteness is not of one thing, like a pot, etc., but of another substance,

original: des na lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa nyid las tha dad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: des na lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa nyid las tha dad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni med do //
translated: then blue, etc. are not different from not being hidden.

original: gal te gang gi tshe don gyi dkar po nyid bral ba de'i tshe gzhan la 'gro 'am cig des na lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid kyang bral nas gzhan du 'gro ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang gi tshe don gyi dkar po nyid bral ba de'i tshe gzhan la 'gro 'am cig des na lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid kyang bral nas gzhan du 'gro ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If when whiteness is separated from one thing, it goes to another, then not being hidden would also be separated and go to another.

original: de lta na ni 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na /
translated: If that is so,üîΩthen.

original: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir don yang de med pas med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir don yang de med pas med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and since the object is not different from that, it too would not exist.

original: tha mi dad pa nyid du ma nges so zhe na /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid du ma nges so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not ascertained that they are not different,

original: 'o na ni me yang me'i rang bzhin med kyang med par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: 'o na ni me yang me'i rang bzhin med kyang med par mi 'grub po //
translated: then fire would not be established as nonexistent even if it did not exist by the nature of fire.

original: de las tha dad pa'i me med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i me med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Because there is no fire that is different from that?

original: tha mi dad par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is not established that it is not different.

original: de las tha dad par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad du mtshungs so //
analyzed: de las tha dad par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad du mtshungs so //
translated: Because it is not seen as different from that? This is the same in all cases.

original: de'i phyir lkog tu ma gyur pa las tha dad pa ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lkog tu ma gyur pa las tha dad pa ni med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, that which is different from what is not hidden does not exist.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang lkog tu ma gyur pa las tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang lkog tu ma gyur pa las tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Inference also does not establish that which is different from what is not hidden.

original: ji ltar sgrub par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub par byed pa ma yin na /
translated: How does it not establish that?

original: gang gi tshe lkog tu gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyang sgrub par byed pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lkog tu gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyang sgrub par byed pa de'i phyir /
translated: When it establishes even the state of what is hidden,

original: phyis rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sngon po ni yod pa nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: phyis rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sngon po ni yod pa nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: then blue that is to be understood later would exist.

original: de la sngon gyi rang bzhin rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sngon gyi rang bzhin rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a cognition that follows after the prior nature.

original: de ni nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba can gyi dran pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ni nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba can gyi dran pa nyid yin la /
translated: It is just memory that follows after experience,

original: nyams su myong ba de yang lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba de yang lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: and that experience is not a hidden nature.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin las sngon po la sogs pa logs shig tu ni dran pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin las sngon po la sogs pa logs shig tu ni dran pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: From a hidden nature, something like blue does not become the object of memory.

original: 'di na yin par ji ltar rtogs she na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na yin par ji ltar rtogs she na ma yin te /
translated: How is it understood that it is here? It is not so.

original: 'dir yang de lta bu'i rang bzhin nyid sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang de lta bu'i rang bzhin nyid sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Here, too, it is just a nature like that which is imagined.

original: gal te sngar gyi lkog tu ma gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid spangs na ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir sngon po'i rang bzhin nyid kyang btang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sngar gyi lkog tu ma gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid spangs na ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir sngon po'i rang bzhin nyid kyang btang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the prior hidden nature is abandoned, then because it is not different from that, the nature of blue is also given up.

original: rnam par phye nas ni dran pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par phye nas ni dran pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not memory that distinguishes.

original: rjes su dpag pa dran pa yin la lhag par rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dran pa yin la lhag par rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that inference is memory, then it would not be a special insight.

original: lhag par rtogs pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par rtogs pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there would be no cause for a special insight.

original: ji ltar de lhag par rtogs pa yin zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar de lhag par rtogs pa yin zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: How is it a special insight?

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it does not exist.

original: ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /üîΩdang po nyid du khyab @57a * //
analyzed: ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na / dang po nyid du khyab @57a * //
translated: How is it a valid cognition?

original: pa grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdper na du ba me las 'byung bar mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: pa grub pa'i phyir ro // dper na du ba me las 'byung bar mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: Because it establishes the pervasion at the outset.

original: yul gzhan dang gzhan me dang 'brel pa 'di ltar rtogs te /
analyzed: yul gzhan dang gzhan me dang 'brel pa 'di ltar rtogs te /
translated: For example, when one sees smoke arising from fire, then one understands that another place connected with fire is like that.

original: gang dang gang na me 'di yod pa de dang der du ba skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gang dang gang na me 'di yod pa de dang der du ba skyed par byed de /
translated: Wherever there is fire, there smoke arises.

original: yul gcig po ni yul gzhan dang 'brel pa ma yin no//
analyzed: yul gcig po ni yul gzhan dang 'brel pa ma yin no//
translated: The single place is not connected with another place.

original: des na gal te gzhan na yang me yod na der yang skyed par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na gal te gzhan na yang me yod na der yang skyed par byed pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, if there is fire elsewhere, it also produces smoke.

original: des na du ba'i yul du me rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na du ba'i yul du me rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, one understands that there is fire in the place of smoke.

original: du ba'ang me 'byung ba de yang de'i rang bzhin nyid du sgro 'dogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: du ba'ang me 'byung ba de yang de'i rang bzhin nyid du sgro 'dogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Smoke is also a superimposition of the nature of fire,

original: gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: but not of anything else,

original: mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not possible.

original: des na lhag pa'i du ba mthong ba las lhag pa'i me rtogs so //
analyzed: des na lhag pa'i du ba mthong ba las lhag pa'i me rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, one understands fire that is greater than the smoke that is seen.

original: 'o na gal te snga ma bar 'gyur ba'i yul gyi me la sgro 'dogs pa med pa kho nar du ba mthong ba'i mdo kho na la rtogs pa de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te snga ma bar 'gyur ba'i yul gyi me la sgro 'dogs pa med pa kho nar du ba mthong ba'i mdo kho na la rtogs pa de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But if one does not superimpose the fire that is the object of the former cognition, how does one understand it when one sees smoke alone?

original: de yang spyir 'brel pa med par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang spyir 'brel pa med par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in general, one does not understand something that is not related to it.

original: 'di ltar / gal te mod la rtogs pa de lta na yang gang gi tshe 'di na du ba yod mod /
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te mod la rtogs pa de lta na yang gang gi tshe 'di na du ba yod mod /
translated: In this way, even if one understands it immediately, when one argues and thinks, ‚ÄúHere, smoke exists,

original: me yod pa ci ste zhes rgol zhing rtog pa na /
analyzed: me yod pa ci ste zhes rgol zhing rtog pa na /
translated: but why does fire exist?‚Äù

original: de lta bu nyid du sngon mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du sngon mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod dgos so //
translated: one must say, ‚ÄúBecause I saw it in that way before.‚Äù

original: mthong ba der yang don dam par ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mthong ba der yang don dam par ni ma yin gyi /
translated: That seeing is not ultimately,

original: 'o na yang mthong ba dang lhag par brtags pa dag gcig tu zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na yang mthong ba dang lhag par brtags pa dag gcig tu zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but it is because one is attached to seeing and imagining as the same.

original: mthong ba las tha dad par ni brtag par mi nus so //
analyzed: mthong ba las tha dad par ni brtag par mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be conceived as distinct from seeing.

original: gal te mthong ba las tha dad par rtogs na mthong ba don du gnyer ba 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mthong ba las tha dad par rtogs na mthong ba don du gnyer ba 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were conceived as distinct from seeing, one who seeks to see would not engage in it.

original: mthong ba don du gnyer bar ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba don du gnyer bar ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The teacher would not teach it as something to be seen.

original: mthong ba nyid du rtogs pa med pa ni mthong ba don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid du rtogs pa med pa ni mthong ba don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who does not understand it as seeing would not seek to see it.

original: yod pa gang yin pa'i rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa gang yin pa'i rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If it is understood as existent,

original: gal te de mthong ba dang 'brel par ma bzung na /
analyzed: gal te de mthong ba dang 'brel par ma bzung na /
translated: if it is not grasped as connected with seeing,

original: ji ltar yod pa tsam rtogs pa po 'jug par byed pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa tsam rtogs pa po 'jug par byed pa yin /
translated: how can the mere existent engage the one who understands?

original: de bas na snang ba nyid du rtogs pas de don du gnyer ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na snang ba nyid du rtogs pas de don du gnyer ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is understood as appearance, it is sought as that, not otherwise.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ma rtogs pa ni de don du gnyer bar ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ma rtogs pa ni de don du gnyer bar ma mthong ngo //
translated: One who does not understand blue, etc. is not seen to seek it.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa'am gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa'am gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, whether it is inference or something else,

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyis sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba las tha dad par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyis sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba las tha dad par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the conceptual cognition does not cognize blue, etc. as different from what was seen.

original: 'o na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is inference a cognition of a hidden object?

original: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa snga ma sgro 'dogs @57b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa snga ma sgro 'dogs @57b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a superimposition of what is not hidden.

original: ji ltar des de na me yod par rtogs she na sgro 'dogs pa de lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar des de na me yod par rtogs she na sgro 'dogs pa de lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: How does it cognize the existence of fire there? Because it is a superimposition of that.

original: smig rgyu la sngon mthong ba'i chur sgro 'dogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: smig rgyu la sngon mthong ba'i chur sgro 'dogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the superimposition of water on a mirage, which was previously seen as water.

original: gang la sgro 'dogs pa de lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang la sgro 'dogs pa de lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is a superimposition, then it is a hidden object.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de rang gi ngo bos ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rang gi ngo bos ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not cognized by its own nature.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But its nature is just that.

original: de lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not a hidden object.

original: ji ltar lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin /
analyzed: ji ltar lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin /
translated: How is it a hidden object?

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the cognition of itself is hidden because it is cognized by another,

original: de nyid lkog tu ma gyur pa yin par lan ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid lkog tu ma gyur pa yin par lan ma yin no //
translated: then it is not the case that it is not hidden.

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa zhes bya ba yang 'brel pa'i stobs kyis sgro btags pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa zhes bya ba yang 'brel pa'i stobs kyis sgro btags pa nyid yin te /
translated: And the so-called cognition by another is a mere superimposition by the power of relation.

original: des na phyi rol lkog tu gyur pa rtogs par 'thad kyang gzhan gyis rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni log pa nyid do //üîΩde phyis rang nyid mthong ba las gcig tu sgro btags pa'i phyir 'di ni lkog tu gyur par gyur to zhes phyi rol lkog tu gyur pa rtogs par rigs kyang /
analyzed: des na phyi rol lkog tu gyur pa rtogs par 'thad kyang gzhan gyis rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni log pa nyid do // de phyis rang nyid mthong ba las gcig tu sgro btags pa'i phyir 'di ni lkog tu gyur par gyur to zhes phyi rol lkog tu gyur pa rtogs par rigs kyang /
translated: Therefore, although it is possible to cognize an external object that is hidden, the so-called cognition by another is just wrong.

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa la ni sngar lkog tu gyur pa de ni gzhan gyis rtogs pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba la 'di yang med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa la ni sngar lkog tu gyur pa de ni gzhan gyis rtogs pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba la 'di yang med do //
translated: Because it is later superimposed as one with what is seen by oneself, it becomes hidden. Therefore, although it is reasonable to cognize an external object that is hidden, there is no such thing as the so-called cognition by another.

original: des na lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: des na lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni med do //
translated: Therefore, the so-called hidden does not exist.

original: de'i phyir don gzhan yod na mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral ba mi 'dzin pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gzhan yod na mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral ba mi 'dzin pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, if there were another object, how could it be that it is not apprehended when it is devoid of the difference of being seen?

original: gal te myong ba las ma gtogs pa'i don med na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa snang ba tha dad pa ga las yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te myong ba las ma gtogs pa'i don med na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa snang ba tha dad pa ga las yin zhe na /
translated: If there is no object other than experience, how is it that there is a difference in the appearance of blue, yellow, and so on?

original: mig la sogs pa nyid las te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nyid las te /
translated: It is due to the eye and so on.

original: skra la sogs par snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: skra la sogs par snang ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the appearance of hair and so on.

original: gal te skra la sogs par snang ba nyams pa'i dbang gis ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skra la sogs par snang ba nyams pa'i dbang gis ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is not due to the impairment of the appearance of hair and so on,

original: nyams so zhes bya ba ga las skra la sogs par snang ba las so zhe na /
analyzed: nyams so zhes bya ba ga las skra la sogs par snang ba las so zhe na /
translated: how is it that it is impaired? It is due to the appearance of hair and so on.

original: sngon po la sogs par snang ba las zhes mtshungs so //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par snang ba las zhes mtshungs so //
translated: It is the same to say it is due to the appearance of blue and so on.

original: skra la sogs pa ltar yul tha dad kyang rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: skra la sogs pa ltar yul tha dad kyang rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: Just as hair and so on are different objects, they would have the same nature.

original: sngon po la sogs sna tshogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs sna tshogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: It is not that they would not be various, such as blue and so on.

original: ji ltar mig bsgyur na 'gyur ba de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa 'gyur ram ci /
analyzed: ji ltar mig bsgyur na 'gyur ba de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa 'gyur ram ci /
translated: When the eye is transformed, does blue and so on also transform?

original: gal te mig rnam par shes pa'i rgyur 'dod na phyi rol yin pa des na sngon po la sogs pa ci ste ma yin /
analyzed: gal te mig rnam par shes pa'i rgyur 'dod na phyi rol yin pa des na sngon po la sogs pa ci ste ma yin /
translated: If you assert that the eye is the cause of the eye consciousness, then since it is external, why is it not blue and so on?

original: ji ltar gzugs 'dzin pa la mig rgyu ba yin pa de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa nang gi khyad par 'dzin pa de las gzhan yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs 'dzin pa la mig rgyu ba yin pa de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa nang gi khyad par 'dzin pa de las gzhan yin no //
translated: Just as the eye is the cause of apprehending form, in the same way, apprehending internal differences such as blue is different from that.

original: des na myong ba nges pa'i phyir @58a * //
analyzed: des na myong ba nges pa'i phyir @58a * //
translated: Therefore, because experience is ascertained,

original: phyi'i don grub po zhe na /
analyzed: phyi'i don grub po zhe na /
translated: external objects are established.

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'dir 'ga' zhig ni 'ga' zhig gis //
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig ni 'ga' zhig gis //
translated: Here, some is activated by some

original: bag chags rab tu sad byed pa //
analyzed: bag chags rab tu sad byed pa //
translated: through the power of latent propensities.

original: de phyir blo ni rnam nges kyi //
analyzed: de phyir blo ni rnam nges kyi //
translated: Therefore the mind is ascertained,

original: phyi rol don ltos ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol don ltos ma yin no //
translated: but it is not dependent on external objects.

original: 'di ni bshad zin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bshad zin te /
translated: This has already been explained.

original: mngon sum las ni phyi'i don mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: mngon sum las ni phyi'i don mi 'grub ste /
translated: External objects are not established from direct perception.

original: 'bras bu ldog pa las brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa las brtags pa yin no //
translated: They are imputed from the cessation of the effect.

original: 'bras bu ldog pa las kyang mig nyid brtag par bla'i /
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa las kyang mig nyid brtag par bla'i /
translated: From the cessation of the effect, it is better to impute the eye.

original: don gzhan rtogs pas ni mthong ba'i mig la sogs pa nyid kyis de khyad par can du gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs pa bla'o //
analyzed: don gzhan rtogs pas ni mthong ba'i mig la sogs pa nyid kyis de khyad par can du gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs pa bla'o //
translated: It is better to understand that the eye, etc. are distinguished by the realization of another object.

original: de yang gzhan gyi ngor brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi ngor brjod pa yin te /
translated: And that is stated from the perspective of another.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid khyad par du rtogs pa bla'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid khyad par du rtogs pa bla'o //
translated: It is better to understand that the immediately preceding condition is distinguished by the realization of another.

original: lus kyang rgyu yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyang rgyu yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the body is also the cause, no.

original: lus su snang ba las ma gtogs par de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus su snang ba las ma gtogs par de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no body apart from the appearance as a body.

original: der snang ba yod na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: der snang ba yod na yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is so when there is the appearance as that,

original: de lta na yang rnam par shes pa nyid las rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rnam par shes pa nyid las rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: then in that case, consciousness is from consciousness itself.

original: lus su snang ba dang rtsig pa la sogs par snang ba dus mtshungs pa'i phyir rgyu nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: lus su snang ba dang rtsig pa la sogs par snang ba dus mtshungs pa'i phyir rgyu nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because the appearance as a body and the appearance as a wall, etc. are simultaneous, it is not the cause.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / sad byed nges pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sad byed nges pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the awakener is ascertained,

original: sad byed de ni yod min yang //üîΩji ltar chags sogs rtog pa la //
analyzed: sad byed de ni yod min yang // ji ltar chags sogs rtog pa la //
translated: even though that awakener does not exist,üîΩjust as the clarity of the ascertainment of time, etc.

original: dus sogs nges pa gsal ba ltar //
analyzed: dus sogs nges pa gsal ba ltar //
translated: in the conception of attachment, etc.

original: de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa snang ba nges pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa snang ba nges pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, the appearance of blue, etc. is definitely present.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yul dang dus dang gnas skabs nges par 'gyur ba ni sad par byed pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yul dang dus dang gnas skabs nges par 'gyur ba ni sad par byed pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis yin gyi /
translated: Attachment, etc. are definitely present in terms of object, time, and situation, due to the power of the conditions that awaken them.

original: de dag dmigs pa nges pa la mi 'khrul ba las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag dmigs pa nges pa la mi 'khrul ba las ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not definitely present in terms of the object.

original: ka n+ya kun dza ba la sogs pa sems pa snang ba rnams la sad par byed pa yod na gzhan du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ka n+ya kun dza ba la sogs pa sems pa snang ba rnams la sad par byed pa yod na gzhan du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the appearances of thoughts such as ka·πá·π≠haka, etc., if there is an awakening of the latent impressions, they occur in other places as well.

original: phyi rol nyid ni sad par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol nyid ni sad par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The external object is not the awakener,

original: rang gi nus pa las sems pa las snang bas kyang sems pa gzhan gyi bag chags sad par byed pa'i phyir dper na mngon du gtod pa las 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi nus pa las sems pa las snang bas kyang sems pa gzhan gyi bag chags sad par byed pa'i phyir dper na mngon du gtod pa las 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: because the appearance of the thought arises from its own potency, and because the latent impressions of another thought are awakened by the appearance of a thought, just as a change occurs due to the directing of the mind.

original: mngon du gtod pa ni gar yang phyogs su lhung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon du gtod pa ni gar yang phyogs su lhung ba ma yin no //
translated: The directing of the mind does not fall into any direction.

original: mngon du phyogs pa mtshungs kyang rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gsal bar snang ba'i phyir goms pa la sogs pa las kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs pa mtshungs kyang rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gsal bar snang ba'i phyir goms pa la sogs pa las kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though they are similar in being directed toward the object, some natures appear clearly, and some do not.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang so sor nges pa'i rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang so sor nges pa'i rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the specific cause of the consciousnesses in dreams and so on?

original: skye ba gzhan du mthong ba'i phyi rol nyid /
analyzed: skye ba gzhan du mthong ba'i phyi rol nyid /
translated: The external object that was seen in another life

original: de'i tshe nges pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe nges pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: is the cause of the ascertainment at that time.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: thams cad mthong ba'i phyi rol @58b de'i tshe med pa nyid /
analyzed: thams cad mthong ba'i phyi rol @58b de'i tshe med pa nyid /
translated: The external object that was seen in another life does not exist at that time.üîΩWhat is the cause of the ascertainment at that time?

original: de'i tshe nges pa'i rgyu gang yin gal te yul sogs nges pa'i phyi rol snang ba nges byed yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe nges pa'i rgyu gang yin gal te yul sogs nges pa'i phyi rol snang ba nges byed yin /
translated: If you say that the appearance of the external object that is ascertained by the object and so on is the ascertainer,

original: de'i yul can phyi rol gyi nges pa med pa de ga las /
analyzed: de'i yul can phyi rol gyi nges pa med pa de ga las /
translated: then how could the subject of that be ascertained as external?

original: gal te der ram de'i tshe nyid phyi rol na med na yul dang dus des nges par snang ba ga las yin /
analyzed: gal te der ram de'i tshe nyid phyi rol na med na yul dang dus des nges par snang ba ga las yin /
translated: If at that time or at that very time the external object does not exist, how could the object and time be ascertained?

original: 'on te de'i dus la sogs ba can med kyang de ltar nges pa ni sngar gyi don mthong ba las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i dus la sogs ba can med kyang de ltar nges pa ni sngar gyi don mthong ba las yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that even though the object and so on do not exist at that time, the ascertainment is like that because of seeing the object in the past,üîΩthen how could the object and so on that existed in the past be ascertained as existing at that time?

original: don gyis ci bya ste /
analyzed: don gyis ci bya ste /
translated: What is the point of the object?

original: sngon gyi snang ba nyid las nges pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi snang ba nyid las nges pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that the appearance itself is determined from the past.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / snang ba don gyis stong par ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / snang ba don gyis stong par ni //
translated: The appearance is not empty of the object,

original: mi 'gyur phyir na don brtags yin //
analyzed: mi 'gyur phyir na don brtags yin //
translated: because the object is imagined.

original: sngon gyi don nyid las nges na /
analyzed: sngon gyi don nyid las nges na /
translated: If it is determined from the past object itself,

original: snang ba yin ni ci zhig byas ;
analyzed: snang ba yin ni ci zhig byas ;
translated: what is the appearance?

original: ; da ni don med par mi snang bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: ; da ni don med par mi snang bar mi rigs so //
translated: Now, it is not reasonable that the appearance does not appear without an object.

original: snang ba ni sngar 'gags pa'i phyir de snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba ni sngar 'gags pa'i phyir de snang ba ma yin no //
translated: The appearance is not the appearance because it has already ceased.

original: de ltar med pa snang ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi don nyid du brtag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar med pa snang ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi don nyid du brtag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because the non-existent appears, it is not imagined as an external object.

original: gal te don med kyang sngon gyi yul dang dus su mthong ba 'di la snang ba yin na sngon gyi dus la sogs pa'i snang ba nyid snang ba rag mod /
analyzed: gal te don med kyang sngon gyi yul dang dus su mthong ba 'di la snang ba yin na sngon gyi dus la sogs pa'i snang ba nyid snang ba rag mod /
translated: If the appearance is this appearance of the past object and time, even though the object does not exist, then the appearance of the past time, etc., is indeed the appearance.

original: don brtags pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: don brtags pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the point of imagining the object?

original: phyi'i don smra ba rnams kyis kyang snang ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i don smra ba rnams kyis kyang snang ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the proponents of external objects also accept the appearance.

original: ci ste der phyi'i don nyid snang ba yin la /
analyzed: ci ste der phyi'i don nyid snang ba yin la /
translated: But if the external object itself appears there,

original: 'dir ni mi ldan pa'i phyir mi snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ni mi ldan pa'i phyir mi snang ngo zhe na /
translated: But here it does not appear, because it is not associated with the mind.

original: der ldan no zhes bya ba gang las mi slu ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: der ldan no zhes bya ba gang las mi slu ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But it is associated with the mind, because it is not deceptive.

original: mi slu ba yang mi slu ba gzhan las mi 'thad pa ci yod /
analyzed: mi slu ba yang mi slu ba gzhan las mi 'thad pa ci yod /
translated: But why is it not acceptable that nondeception is due to another nondeception?

original: des na mi slu ba gzhan yin pa'i phyir mi slu bar snang ba brgyud pa nyid rigs so //
analyzed: des na mi slu ba gzhan yin pa'i phyir mi slu bar snang ba brgyud pa nyid rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the appearance of nondeception is due to a series of nondeceptions, because each member of the series is nondeceptive.

original: gal te gang zhig skyes nas 'jig pa de ni log pa'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te gang zhig skyes nas 'jig pa de ni log pa'i shes pa yin te /
translated: If something arises and then ceases, it is a false cognition,

original: dper na da ni rdul med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na da ni rdul med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: just as when one says, ‚ÄúNow there is no dust.‚Äù

original: ka ba la sogs pa 'di ni shin tu nges pa yin pas ji ltar phyin ci log yin zhe na /
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa 'di ni shin tu nges pa yin pas ji ltar phyin ci log yin zhe na /
translated: But this pillar, etc., is quite certain. How can it be false?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not so.

original: bag chags brtan pa nyid kyis na //
analyzed: bag chags brtan pa nyid kyis na //
translated: Because of the stability of the latent impressions,

original: mod la 'jig par 'gyur min te //üîΩdper na bag chags las byung ba //
analyzed: mod la 'jig par 'gyur min te // dper na bag chags las byung ba //
translated: it does not perish immediately.üîΩFor example,

original: 'dod chags la sogs rtogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs rtogs pa bzhin //
translated: like the conception of desire, etc., which arises from latent impressions.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bag chags kyi stobs la brten pa dang / de bzhin du phyi'i don dang bral ba yin mod kyi de lta na yang 'di rnam par brtags su zin kyang /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bag chags kyi stobs la brten pa dang / de bzhin du phyi'i don dang bral ba yin mod kyi de lta na yang 'di rnam par brtags su zin kyang /
translated: Conceptual thoughts such as desire, etc., are based on the power of latent impressions, and likewise, even though they are devoid of external objects, still, even though they are imagined,

original: de ma thag nyid du mi ldog go //
analyzed: de ma thag nyid du mi ldog go //
translated: they do not cease immediately.

original: de bzhin du bag chags brtan pas na rmi lam du bshad pa'i rgyun ji ltar yang mi ldog go /'di ltar brtan pa de nyid yang langs @59a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du bag chags brtan pas na rmi lam du bshad pa'i rgyun ji ltar yang mi ldog go /'di ltar brtan pa de nyid yang langs @59a * //
translated: Likewise, because of the stability of latent impressions, the stream of consciousness explained in dreams does not cease. Thus, that stability is again

original: yang gnyid log cing 'chad pa byed do //
analyzed: yang gnyid log cing 'chad pa byed do //
translated: arisen and again falls asleep and is interrupted.

original: de'i phyir phyi'i don la ltos pas nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi'i don la ltos pas nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not certain that it depends on external objects.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / rmi lam cung zad gang mthong ba //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rmi lam cung zad gang mthong ba //
translated: Whatever one sees in a dream

original: sad par rjes su 'jug pa med //
analyzed: sad par rjes su 'jug pa med //
translated: is not continued upon awakening.

original: de yi gnas skabs da 'dra ste //
analyzed: de yi gnas skabs da 'dra ste //
translated: That state is just like this

original: byis pa'i gci ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: byis pa'i gci ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the urine of a child.

original: byis pa'i gci ba'i gnas skabs rmi lam du mthong ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su yang rjes su 'jug gi / gzhon nu la sogs pa'i gnas su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa'i gci ba'i gnas skabs rmi lam du mthong ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su yang rjes su 'jug gi / gzhon nu la sogs pa'i gnas su ni ma yin no //
translated: The state of a child‚Äôs urine is experienced in a dream and is also experienced in the waking state, but not in the state of a youth, etc.

original: don byed pa la mi 'khrul pa yang sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir yang mi spro'o //
analyzed: don byed pa la mi 'khrul pa yang sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir yang mi spro'o //
translated: And since it has already been demonstrated that the function of consciousness is not erroneous, I will not elaborate further.

original: de phyir gcig la tshul gnyis yod //
analyzed: de phyir gcig la tshul gnyis yod //
translated: Therefore, one thing has two modes.

original: gang phyir de ltar myong ba dang // dran pas 'di ni rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: gang phyir de ltar myong ba dang // dran pas 'di ni rnam pa gnyis //
translated: Because of the experience and memory of that, it is twofold.

original: myong ba nyid ni 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: myong ba nyid ni 'bras bu yin //
translated: Experience is the effect.

original: tshul gnyis zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i rnam pa dang sngon po'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: tshul gnyis zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i rnam pa dang sngon po'i rnam pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTwo modes‚Äù refers to the mode of the cognition and the mode of the blue.

original: tha dad par rig pa med pa'i phyir ni gcig yin la /
analyzed: tha dad par rig pa med pa'i phyir ni gcig yin la /
translated: It is one because there is no awareness of difference.

original: ldog pa nye bar brtags pas ni tshul gnyis yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa nye bar brtags pas ni tshul gnyis yin no //
translated: It is twofold because of the postulation of the exclusion.

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir de ltar nyams su myong ba dang dran pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar nyams su myong ba dang dran pas so //
translated: Because of the experience and memory of that.

original: des na rnam pa gnyis las gzhan rig pa med pa'i phyir don rig pa ni 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: des na rnam pa gnyis las gzhan rig pa med pa'i phyir don rig pa ni 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since there is no awareness other than the two modes, the awareness of the object is not the effect.

original: rnam pa gnyis myong ba 'bras bu yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis myong ba 'bras bu yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is that the two aspects are the result, the experience.

original: don rig par rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: don rig par rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the understanding of the object consciousness?

original: ji ltar rang rig pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rang rig pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it reflexive awareness?

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: gang tshe rnam rig rgyu yin la ;
analyzed: gang tshe rnam rig rgyu yin la ;
translated: When the cause of consciousness is

original: ; gzhan 'dod pa 'am mi 'dod pa'ang //
analyzed: ; gzhan 'dod pa 'am mi 'dod pa'ang //
translated: Not accepted or not accepted by others,

original: de yi dngos por ma grub pa //
analyzed: de yi dngos por ma grub pa //
translated: It is not established as a thing,

original: de ni de ltar myong ba yin //
analyzed: de ni de ltar myong ba yin //
translated: But it is experienced as such.

original: de'i tshe de'i dngos pos grub pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba nyid rig pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dngos pos grub pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba nyid rig pa yin te /
translated: At that time, since the cause of consciousness is not established as a thing, the experience itself is reflexive awareness,

original: sngon po'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of blue.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar sngon po la sogs pa nyid du myong ba yin te de'i phyir de ni don dam par rang rig pa nyid yin gyi don du nyid nyams su myong ba yang don rig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar sngon po la sogs pa nyid du myong ba yin te de'i phyir de ni don dam par rang rig pa nyid yin gyi don du nyid nyams su myong ba yang don rig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Since it is experienced as blue and so on, therefore it is reflexive awareness in the ultimate sense. The experience of consciousness itself is not the understanding of an object,

original: rmi lam du rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam du rig pa bzhin no //
translated: like the experience in a dream.

original: yang na don rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: yang na don rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Alternatively, the understanding of an object is the result.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gang che shes bya don du ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang che shes bya don du ni //
translated: The object of knowledge is the cause,

original: gnas phyir shes pa yul bcas yin //
analyzed: gnas phyir shes pa yul bcas yin //
translated: Because it is the basis, it is consciousness together with its object.

original: de tshe bdag nyid nyams myong gang //
analyzed: de tshe bdag nyid nyams myong gang //
translated: At that time, whatever is experienced is itself

original: de nyid don du rnam par nges //
analyzed: de nyid don du rnam par nges //
translated: determined to be the object.

original: yang gang gi tshe don gzhan rtogs par byed pa med par shes pa'i cha nyid la des don du nges par byed pa'i de'i tshe shes pa rnam pa'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de nyid la bag chags las nges pa'i phyir don ces pa
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe don gzhan rtogs par byed pa med par shes pa'i cha nyid la des don du nges par byed pa'i de'i tshe shes pa rnam pa'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de nyid la bag chags las nges pa'i phyir don ces pa
translated: When the aspect of consciousness itself determines the object without the existence of another object, at that time, whatever is experienced as the nature of the aspect of consciousness is itself determined to be the object because of the latent impression of that.

original: yin no // de'i tshe @59b nges ba'i stobs kyis don rig pa 'bras bu yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yin no // de'i tshe @59b nges ba'i stobs kyis don rig pa 'bras bu yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: At that time, the result is the consciousness of the object by the power of determination.

original: de'i tshe ni rnam par shes par smra ba la yang don rig pa 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni rnam par shes par smra ba la yang don rig pa 'bras bu yin no //
translated: At that time, even for the proponents of consciousness, the result is the consciousness of the object.

original: de'i tshe gzung ba'i rnam pa ni gzhal bya 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni tshad ma de'i rig pa ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzung ba'i rnam pa ni gzhal bya 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni tshad ma de'i rig pa ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: At that time, the aspect of the object is the object of comprehension, the aspect of the apprehender is the valid knowledge, and the consciousness of that is the result.

original: yang na de nyid don ces rtogs la /
analyzed: yang na de nyid don ces rtogs la /
translated: Or that itself is understood to be the object.

original: de yang rig pa yin pa'i phyir rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de yang rig pa yin pa'i phyir rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no //
translated: And because that is also consciousness, consciousness itself is the result.

original: gzhan yang phyi'i don khas blangs kyang rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi'i don khas blangs kyang rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Moreover, even if one accepts external objects, self-awareness is the effect.üîΩThus, if this is the desired form,

original: 'di ltar / gal te 'di bdag 'dod rnams dang // rnam pa gzhan du myong gyur na /üîΩ'dod pa'ang mi 'dod pa des kyang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te 'di bdag 'dod rnams dang // rnam pa gzhan du myong gyur na / 'dod pa'ang mi 'dod pa des kyang //
translated: and the object is experienced in another form,üîΩthen the object is cognized,

original: don rig par ni 'gyur ba yin ;
analyzed: don rig par ni 'gyur ba yin ;
translated: but not as desired.

original: / rig pa gzhan nyid yin la don gzhan yin no zhes ni mi nus so //
analyzed: / rig pa gzhan nyid yin la don gzhan yin no zhes ni mi nus so //
translated: One cannot say that the cognition is one thing and the object another.

original: de bas na rig pa'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyis don rnam par 'jog pas de dang grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir phyi rol rig pa ni rang rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na rig pa'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyis don rnam par 'jog pas de dang grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir phyi rol rig pa ni rang rig pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since the object is determined by following the cognition, external cognition is self-awareness, because the object is established and experienced by the cognition itself.

original: des na nye bar btags nas phyi rol rig par brjod do //
analyzed: des na nye bar btags nas phyi rol rig par brjod do //
translated: Thus, external cognition is expressed metaphorically.üîΩIf this cognition is the desired form,üîΩand the object is experienced in another form,

original: gang gi phyir gal te shes pa 'di bdag nyid 'dod pa rnam pa yin pa dang / don yang rnam pa gzhan du myong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te shes pa 'di bdag nyid 'dod pa rnam pa yin pa dang / don yang rnam pa gzhan du myong bar 'gyur na /
translated: then the object is cognized,

original: 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa ste /üîΩ'dod pa mi 'dod pa'i rnam pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa ste /üîΩ'dod pa mi 'dod pa'i rnam pa yin na /
translated: but not as desired.

original: de'i tshe des dngos kyi 'jug pas don rig par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe des dngos kyi 'jug pas don rig par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: At that time, it is the object of awareness that is cognized by the direct engagement of consciousness.

original: de lta ma yin na ni nye bar btags pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni nye bar btags pa nyid do //
translated: If it were not so, it would be a mere imputation.

original: des na phyi'i don la yang rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: des na phyi'i don la yang rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, even in the case of external objects, reflexive awareness is the effect.

original: gal te don yod pa la ni don rig pa nyid 'thad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te don yod pa la ni don rig pa nyid 'thad pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the object exists, is it not the case that the object is cognized?

original: de yod pa'i phyir rten med pas rang rig par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir rten med pas rang rig par rigs so zhe na /
translated: Since it exists, it is reasonable that reflexive awareness is without a basis.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: This is also unreasonable.

original: phyi rol don ni yod na yang //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni yod na yang //
translated: Even if external objects exist,

original: ji ltar nyams su myong nyid de //
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong nyid de //
translated: how is it experienced?

original: nges pa'i bdag nyid rang ngo bos //
analyzed: nges pa'i bdag nyid rang ngo bos //
translated: It is not by the nature of a determinate self,

original: ma yin du ma'i bdag skyon phyir //üîΩrnam par shes pa'i smra ba la yang rang rig pa nyid rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin du ma'i bdag skyon phyir // rnam par shes pa'i smra ba la yang rang rig pa nyid rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir /
translated: because the fault of being multiple is incurred.

original: rang rig pa khas len pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang rig pa khas len pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: In the theory of consciousness, reflexive awareness is not accepted because there is no other aspect.

original: 'on kyang de nyid du rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid du rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, it is accepted because it is known in reality.

original: rten med pas khas len na ni phyi'i don nyid ci ste khas mi len /
analyzed: rten med pas khas len na ni phyi'i don nyid ci ste khas mi len /
translated: If it is accepted because it is without a basis, then why not accept external objects?

original: 'di ltar / gal te phyi rol don med pas //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te phyi rol don med pas //
translated: Thus:üîΩIf external objects do not exist,

original: gang rig gal te rten med pas //
analyzed: gang rig gal te rten med pas //
translated: then, since there is no support,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid rig na //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid rig na //
translated: if you see that consciousness is self-aware,

original: phyi nyid rig par cis mi 'dod //
analyzed: phyi nyid rig par cis mi 'dod //
translated: why not accept that it is aware of external objects?

original: rten med pa ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: rten med pa ni mtshungs so //
translated: The lack of support is the same.

original: des na rang gi ngo bos rig pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir zhes brjod par bya'o //üîΩrten gzhan med pa'i phyir @60a * //
analyzed: des na rang gi ngo bos rig pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir zhes brjod par bya'o // rten gzhan med pa'i phyir @60a * //
translated: Therefore, it should be said that it is seen to be self-aware by nature,

original: ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ni ma yin no //
translated: but not because there is no other support.

original: de la gal te phyi'i don la yang rang rig pa nyid mthong bas de nyid yin mod /
analyzed: de la gal te phyi'i don la yang rang rig pa nyid mthong bas de nyid yin mod /
translated: If you see that self-awareness exists even in external objects, then that is fine.

original: don rig pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir gtang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don rig pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir gtang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: But it is unacceptable that consciousness is aware of objects, so that must be rejected.

original: rig pa rnams rang gi ngo bos tha dad pa'i phyir skyes bu so so la rnam pa du mar rig pa 'thad kyi /
analyzed: rig pa rnams rang gi ngo bos tha dad pa'i phyir skyes bu so so la rnam pa du mar rig pa 'thad kyi /
translated: Because the cognitions are different by nature, it is possible for many cognitions to occur in different individuals.

original: don ni rang gi ngo bos rnam pa du mar rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don ni rang gi ngo bos rnam pa du mar rig pa ma yin te /
translated: But objects are not cognized in many forms by nature,

original: bdag nyid du mar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid du mar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that they would be multiple by nature.

original: rtogs par byed pas rnam pa du mar rig kyang don ni gcig nyid do zhes phyi rol gyi lta ba 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pas rnam pa du mar rig kyang don ni gcig nyid do zhes phyi rol gyi lta ba 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The externalists claim that although it is cognized in many ways, the object is only one.

original: des na gcig la rang bzhin du mar rig pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des na gcig la rang bzhin du mar rig pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that one is cognized as having many natures.

original: don du ma'i rang bzhin nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: don du ma'i rang bzhin nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it has the nature of many objects, that is not so.

original: khas blangs na yang gnyis po dag / tha dad par ni myong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: khas blangs na yang gnyis po dag / tha dad par ni myong mi 'gyur //
translated: Even if you accept that, the two would not be experienced as different.

original: don gcig nyid la gnyis nyams su myong ngo zhes mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gcig nyid la gnyis nyams su myong ngo zhes mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not be said that one object is experienced as two,

original: rang gi rnam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its aspect would be completely perfect.

original: gal te rnam pa gzhan yang de nyid du /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gzhan yang de nyid du /
translated: If another aspect were to appear as that,

original: rjes su zhugs par snang na de'i tshe gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rjes su zhugs par snang na de'i tshe gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur ro ;
translated: then it would be cognized as one.

original: ; yang na gnyis po dag tha dad par myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dngos po'i don to //
analyzed: ; yang na gnyis po dag tha dad par myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dngos po'i don to //
translated: Or else, the two would not be experienced as different. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: yang na gcig gi mthar thug pas tha dad par myong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gcig gi mthar thug pas tha dad par myong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, because of being one, they would not be experienced as different,

original: thams cad la rnam pa du mar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la rnam pa du mar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that everything would have many aspects.

original: ma mthong bsgribs phyir 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: ma mthong bsgribs phyir 'gyur zhe na //
translated: If you say that the two are not seen because they are obscured by the unseen,

original: don gyi dbang gis rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: don gyi dbang gis rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: then you will not understand the meaning of the power of the object.

original: gal te ma mthong bas bsgribs pa'i phyir gnyis mthong ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong bas bsgribs pa'i phyir gnyis mthong ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the two are not seen because they are obscured by the unseen,

original: 'o na ma mthong bas gcig tu rtogs pa la bsgribs pa'i phyir gcig tu rtogs pa la tshad ma ga la yod /
analyzed: 'o na ma mthong bas gcig tu rtogs pa la bsgribs pa'i phyir gcig tu rtogs pa la tshad ma ga la yod /
translated: then how can there be a valid cognition of the one that is understood by the unseen, since it is obscured by the unseen?

original: ma mthong ba ni rab rib lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni rab rib lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: The unseen would be like a cataract.

original: zla ba ni gnyis nyid de gcig ni mthong ba yin la ;
analyzed: zla ba ni gnyis nyid de gcig ni mthong ba yin la ;
translated: The moon is twofold: one is seen,üîΩand the other is not seen because it is obscured by the unseen.

original: gnyis pa ni ma mthong bas bsgribs pa'i phyir ma mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'dir yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ma mthong bas bsgribs pa'i phyir ma mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'dir yang 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the way you would imagine it.

original: de bas na ma mthong ba'i rab rib dang 'dra ba'i phyir don gyi dbang gis rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ma mthong ba'i rab rib dang 'dra ba'i phyir don gyi dbang gis rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the unseen is like a cataract, it does not understand the meaning of the power of the object.

original: ma mthong ba nyid kyis phyi'i don gyis stong pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed do zhes ci ste khas mi len /
analyzed: ma mthong ba nyid kyis phyi'i don gyis stong pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed do zhes ci ste khas mi len /
translated: Why do you not accept that the unseen itself generates consciousness empty of external objects?

original: 'on te ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi nus na /
analyzed: 'on te ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi nus na /
translated: But if you say that the mere unseen is not able to do that,üîΩthen what else is there?

original: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i don rtogs pa'i sgrib par ji ltar nus pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i don rtogs pa'i sgrib par ji ltar nus pa brjod dgos so //
translated: How can you say that it is an obscuration to the realization of the meaning that exists in a suitable object?

original: du ma'i bdag nyid dngos de la //
analyzed: du ma'i bdag nyid dngos de la //
translated: You must explain how it is possible for it to be an obscuration to the realization of the object that exists in a suitable place.üîΩThe thing that has a manifold nature

original: gcig gi bdag nyid mthong byed pa //
analyzed: gcig gi bdag nyid mthong byed pa //
translated: is seen to have the nature of one.

original: ma mthong ba de ji ltar na //
analyzed: ma mthong ba de ji ltar na //
translated: How can that which is not seen

original: don mthong byed par @60b 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: don mthong byed par @60b 'gyur ba yin //
translated: be a seer of objects?

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the summary.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / 'dod pa'i mi 'dod don rigs ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'dod pa'i mi 'dod don rigs ni //
translated: it is seen that the nature of the object, whether desired or not,

original: goms pa'i dbang gis 'byung bar mthong //üîΩ'di la ma mthong ba yi ni //
analyzed: goms pa'i dbang gis 'byung bar mthong // 'di la ma mthong ba yi ni //
translated: arises through the power of habit.üîΩHow can that which is not seen

original: bsgrub bya nyid du ji ltar rtogs //
analyzed: bsgrub bya nyid du ji ltar rtogs //
translated: be established as the object to be seen?

original: de nyid ma mthong yin zhe na //
analyzed: de nyid ma mthong yin zhe na //
translated: If it is said that it is not seen because it is that,

original: mthong bar 'dod pa grub pa nyid //üîΩthams cad bag chags stobs las ni //
analyzed: mthong bar 'dod pa grub pa nyid // thams cad bag chags stobs las ni //
translated: then the desire to see is established.üîΩBecause it is established that everything

original: 'byung ba yin par grub phyir ro //üîΩgal te don ni 'dod pa 'am /
analyzed: 'byung ba yin par grub phyir ro // gal te don ni 'dod pa 'am /
translated: arises from the power of habitual tendencies.üîΩIf the object is not an appearance of what is desired

original: mi 'dod par snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'dod par snang ba ma yin te /
translated: or of what is not desired,

original: don gyi rnam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa nyid yin no //
translated: then it is the aspect of the object itself.

original: de ltar gyur pa ni rtogs pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ni rtogs pa nyid do zhe na /
