original: spu ldang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir gzung ba'i rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: spu ldang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir gzung ba'i rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan yin no //
translated: and the effect, such as the raising of the hairs, is different.

original: gzhan yang spu ldang ba la sogs pa ni myong ba las yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang spu ldang ba la sogs pa ni myong ba las yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the raising of the hairs, etc. is due to experience,

original: don las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not due to the object.

original: mthong ba gnyis kyang mthong bas 'dres par 'gyur ba ni mi rtogs te /
analyzed: mthong ba gnyis kyang mthong bas 'dres par 'gyur ba ni mi rtogs te /
translated: And the two perceptions are not understood to be mixed, because of perception.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: rjes su dpag pa la ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not depend on inference.

original: mngon sum la ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: mngon sum la ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa med do //
translated: Inference does not operate in perception.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid mngon sum yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid mngon sum yin gyi /
translated: If it is said that the nature itself is perception,

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid ni de la mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid ni de la mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: but the seeing of another is not perception for it,

original: des na rjes su dpog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is inference.

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid de la yod do zhes bya ba 'di la yang tshad ma med pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid de la yod do zhes bya ba 'di la yang tshad ma med pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that there is no valid cognition at all for the statement ‚ÄúThat exists for another‚Äù?

original: de nyid kyi phyir the tshom za'o zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir the tshom za'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there is doubt.

original: de lta na ni 'o na sngon po'i rang bzhin du mthong ba la yang ser po'i rang bzhin nyid du the tshom za ba'i yul du ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na sngon po'i rang bzhin du mthong ba la yang ser po'i rang bzhin nyid du the tshom za ba'i yul du ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: If that were so, then why would the object of a doubt, ‚ÄúIs the nature of blue seen as the nature of yellow?‚Äù not be the nature of blue?

original: phyis dmigs par 'gyur ba'i me la me'i rang bzhin nyid yod do zhes bya ba las phyis dmigs pa nyid las so //
analyzed: phyis dmigs par 'gyur ba'i me la me'i rang bzhin nyid yod do zhes bya ba las phyis dmigs pa nyid las so //
translated: The nature of fire is present in that which is later observed as fire.

original: 'dir ni gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid la phyis kyang dmigs pa 'jug pa ma @64b yin no ;
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid la phyis kyang dmigs pa 'jug pa ma @64b yin no ;
translated: But here, even later, the object of the doubt, ‚ÄúIs the nature of fire present in that which is not seen as fire?‚Äù is not the object of observation.

original: ; gal te gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid du ma rtogs na tha snyad nyid med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: ; gal te gzhan gyis mthong ba nyid du ma rtogs na tha snyad nyid med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If one does not understand that the object of doubt is seen by another, then would not the conventional itself be nonexistent?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it would not.

original: 'dra ba tsam gyis tha snyad rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgcig nyid med par tha snyad mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba tsam gyis tha snyad rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro // gcig nyid med par tha snyad mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the conventional is well established by mere similarity.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
translated: How do you know that the conventional would not occur if there were no single nature?

original: gal te lkog tu gyur pa rjes su dpag pa 'jug na ni gcig nyid la yang 'jug go //
analyzed: gal te lkog tu gyur pa rjes su dpag pa 'jug na ni gcig nyid la yang 'jug go //
translated: If inference operates with regard to the hidden, then it operates with regard to a single nature.

original: ma yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: ma yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that it does not,

original: 'dra ba la yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'dra ba la yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: then how does it operate with regard to similarity?

original: 'di ni bden te 'dra bar yang ga las rjes su dpog /'di ni mthong ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don gcig tu byas pa tsam gyis tha snyad tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'di ni bden te 'dra bar yang ga las rjes su dpog /'di ni mthong ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don gcig tu byas pa tsam gyis tha snyad tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: This is true, but how can you infer that it is similar? It is merely a matter of conventional expression, a mere designation, by taking the object of seeing and the object of imagining to be the same.

original: don dam par ni rjes su dpag pa rang gi ngo bo tsam la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni rjes su dpag pa rang gi ngo bo tsam la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: But in the ultimate sense, inference has as its object a mere entity.

original: ji ltar yul lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yul lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is the object of inference hidden?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not hidden.

original: shes yul lkog tu gyur par ji ltar rig //
analyzed: shes yul lkog tu gyur par ji ltar rig //
translated: How do you know that the object of consciousness is hidden?

original: gal te der snang 'dir ni lkog gyur ci //
analyzed: gal te der snang 'dir ni lkog gyur ci //
translated: If it is hidden here, but appears there,

original: ci ste snang ba spangs bas lkog don na //
analyzed: ci ste snang ba spangs bas lkog don na //
translated: and if the hidden object is known by abandoning the appearance,

original: des rtogs zhes 'di dag tshul rkyang pa nyid //üîΩde las mi slu ba yi phyir na de //
analyzed: des rtogs zhes 'di dag tshul rkyang pa nyid // de las mi slu ba yi phyir na de //
translated: then this is merely a matter of method.

original: gal te rtogs zhes 'dod na ni //
analyzed: gal te rtogs zhes 'dod na ni //
translated: If it is said that it is known because it is nondeceptive,

original: thob pa yod pa'i phyir de der //
analyzed: thob pa yod pa'i phyir de der //
translated: then it is known because it is obtained.

original: thob pa'i dus su yod par brjod //
analyzed: thob pa'i dus su yod par brjod //
translated: It is said to exist at the time of its obtainment.

original: sngar go de ni dngos yod par //
analyzed: sngar go de ni dngos yod par //
translated: How can one know that the object of the past exists?

original: tshad mar gang gis rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshad mar gang gis rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: By what means does one know that it is valid?

original: de tshe rtogs pa de nyid ni //
analyzed: de tshe rtogs pa de nyid ni //
translated: At that time, that very knowledge

original: dngos yod min par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: dngos yod min par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: Would be non-existent.

original: rjes su dpag med na 'byung ba yis //
analyzed: rjes su dpag med na 'byung ba yis //
translated: If there is no inference,

original: dngos po yod par ji ltar rtogs //üîΩthams cad du ni 'byung ba yi //
analyzed: dngos po yod par ji ltar rtogs // thams cad du ni 'byung ba yi //
translated: How can you know that things exist?üîΩI do not say that the nature

original: rang bzhin rtogs zhes ngas pa min //
analyzed: rang bzhin rtogs zhes ngas pa min //
translated: Of all things is known through existence.

original: gal te de ltar 'byung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'byung 'gyur ba //
translated: If it were so,

original: gnyi ga'ang rtogs pa yin zhe na /üîΩrang bzhin gcig nyid du rtogs pa //
analyzed: gnyi ga'ang rtogs pa yin zhe na / rang bzhin gcig nyid du rtogs pa //
translated: Both would be known.üîΩHow could there be a single nature

original: ji ltar byung dang 'byung 'gyur yin //üîΩdes na rjes su dpag pa las ;
analyzed: ji ltar byung dang 'byung 'gyur yin // des na rjes su dpag pa las ;
translated: That is both known and unknown?üîΩTherefore, ultimately,

original: ; don dam du ni rtogs pa med //
analyzed: ; don dam du ni rtogs pa med //
translated: There is no knowledge through inference.

original: lkog gyur bum pa med ce na //
analyzed: lkog gyur bum pa med ce na //
translated: If it is hidden, and the pot does not exist,

original: ji ltar phyi nas rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi nas rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: How will it be known later?

original: gal te de tshe nyid skyes na //
analyzed: gal te de tshe nyid skyes na //
translated: If it arises at that time,

original: rgyu med par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu med par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be causeless?

original: de lta nyid du mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de lta nyid du mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is seen in that way,

original: 'di la dri ba ci zhig yod //üîΩmthong phyir de ni sngar yod pa'i //
analyzed: 'di la dri ba ci zhig yod // mthong phyir de ni sngar yod pa'i //
translated: What question is there here?üîΩBecause it is seen, why is it notüîΩRegarded as a previously existent thing?

original: dngos por ci yi phyir mi brtag / de ltar mthong ba min des na //
analyzed: dngos por ci yi phyir mi brtag / de ltar mthong ba min des na //
translated: Because it is not seen in that way,

original: de ltar brtag par bya ba min //
analyzed: de ltar brtag par bya ba min //
translated: It is not to be regarded in that way.

original: ci ste gzhan gyis mthong bar ni //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gyis mthong bar ni //
translated: But if it is seen by another,

original: rjes dpog med na de bzhin te //
analyzed: rjes dpog med na de bzhin te //
translated: then it is the same without inference.

original: yod ces gzhan gyis ji ltar shes //
analyzed: yod ces gzhan gyis ji ltar shes //
translated: How does another know that it exists?

original: zhes bya ba'ang lan du rung ma yin //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'ang lan du rung ma yin //
translated: This is also not a suitable response.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩgzhan yang gzhan gyis shes so zhes //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / gzhan yang gzhan gyis shes so zhes //
translated: Because:üîΩMoreover, it is not the case that

original: de ltar rtogs @65a * //üîΩpar 'gyur ba min //üîΩde yang rjes su dpag pa yis //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs @65a * // par 'gyur ba min // de yang rjes su dpag pa yis //
translated: one understands in this way that it is known by another.üîΩIf that is known by inference,

original: shes na phan tshun rten par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes na phan tshun rten par 'gyur //
translated: then there is mutual dependence.

original: gzhan dang thun mong par shes na //
analyzed: gzhan dang thun mong par shes na //
translated: If it is known in common with another,

original: de'i ni yod ces brjod pa yin //
analyzed: de'i ni yod ces brjod pa yin //
translated: then it is said to exist.

original: de yod nyid na 'brel pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yod nyid na 'brel pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it exists, there is a connection,

original: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid //üîΩdes na yod nyid mngon sum gyis //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid // des na yod nyid mngon sum gyis //
translated: and inference is valid cognition.üîΩTherefore, if existence is known by perception,

original: shes na de la rjes dpog 'gyur //üîΩrjes su dpag pas yod pa nyid //
analyzed: shes na de la rjes dpog 'gyur // rjes su dpag pas yod pa nyid //
translated: then it is inferred.üîΩIf existence is known by inference,

original: shes na 'ang mngon sum gyis de 'dzin //
analyzed: shes na 'ang mngon sum gyis de 'dzin //
translated: then it is apprehended by perception.

original: de ltar phan tshun brten pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar phan tshun brten pa'i phyir //
translated: In this way, because they are mutually dependent,

original: gcig kyang srid par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig kyang srid par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: not even one is possible.

original: gzhan du 'ang phan tshun rten pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan du 'ang phan tshun rten pa ni //
translated: Moreover, mutual dependence

original: 'ga' yang yod par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'ga' yang yod par ma mthong ngo //
translated: I do not see any.

original: de'i phyir thog ma med pa can gyi de lta bu'i rjes su dpag pa brgyud pa 'jug pa'i rjes su dpag pa brten nas phyi'i don rtogs pa na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang myong ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyir gzung ba la sogs par rtogsüîΩpa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir thog ma med pa can gyi de lta bu'i rjes su dpag pa brgyud pa 'jug pa'i rjes su dpag pa brten nas phyi'i don rtogs pa na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang myong ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyir gzung ba la sogs par rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, when one realizes external objects on the basis of inference that is grounded in the inference that is the transmission of such an infinite regress, one conceives of objects, etc., because the conceptualization of subject, object, and experience occurs.

original: don dam par ni rnam par dbye ba med pa'i myong ba nyid do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: don dam par ni rnam par dbye ba med pa'i myong ba nyid do zhes gnas so //
translated: But in reality, there is only the nondual experience.

original: khyed kyi rtogs pa 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: khyed kyi rtogs pa 'di ga las she na /
translated: How do you know this?

original: sngags dang rgyud la sogs pas nye bar bsgrubs pa'i mig can rnams la /
analyzed: sngags dang rgyud la sogs pas nye bar bsgrubs pa'i mig can rnams la /
translated: Because those who have eyes that are affected by spells, mantras, etc.,

original: 'dzin du ma la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin dang bral ba rnams kyang sbrul la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin du ma la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin dang bral ba rnams kyang sbrul la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: see many things that are devoid of the nature of snakes, etc., as having the nature of snakes, etc.

original: de dag ni ji srid du de dag ma rtogs kyi bar du gzhan gyis ma mthong ba yang mthong ba nyid du tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni ji srid du de dag ma rtogs kyi bar du gzhan gyis ma mthong ba yang mthong ba nyid du tha snyad byed do //
translated: And as long as they do not understand that, they say that others also see what they see.

original: gal te rang gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de de kho na bzhin mngon sum du rig na ni bstan pa la ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de de kho na bzhin mngon sum du rig na ni bstan pa la ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one directly perceives just what is one‚Äôs own nature, then one would not rely on a teaching.

original: mngon sum yang bstan pa la ltos nas de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum yang bstan pa la ltos nas de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so, because direct perception occurs in dependence on a teaching.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the capacity of inference is seen.

original: mngon sum nyid nus pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid nus pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If direct perception itself is the capacity,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then it is not so,

original: rjes su dpag pa tshad mar thal bas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshad mar thal bas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that inference is a valid means of knowledge.

original: de mngon sum nyid yin la rag mod ce na /
analyzed: de mngon sum nyid yin la rag mod ce na /
translated: If it is direct perception itself, then it is so.

original: 'o na ni mngon sum yin yang de nyid bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba yin pa'i phyir don dam pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni mngon sum yin yang de nyid bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba yin pa'i phyir don dam pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But it is not ultimate because it arises from the power of habitual tendencies, even though it is direct perception.

original: gzhan yang bzlog pa la yang rjes su dpag pa yod pa nyid pas de ji ltar gnyi ga rjes su dpag pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bzlog pa la yang rjes su dpag pa yod pa nyid pas de ji ltar gnyi ga rjes su dpag pa yin /
translated: Moreover, because there is also inference that contradicts that, how can both be inference?

original: phyogs gnyi gar 'gyur mod ce na /
analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar 'gyur mod ce na /
translated: If you say that both positions are possible,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then it is not so,üîΩbecause it is not tenable that both are established.

original: skyes bu so sor dngos por rnam par gnas par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu so sor dngos por rnam par gnas par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the individual person would be the entity that is the object.

original: 'gyur mod ci skyon zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur mod ci skyon zhe na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: de nyid rang rig pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid rang rig pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: It would be self-awareness,

original: phan tshun ma 'dres pas na thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: phan tshun ma 'dres pas na thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because it is not shared, since it is not mixed with another.

original: @65b de'i phyir gzhan gyis de ltar ma rtogs pa de lta na yang thun mong ba nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: @65b de'i phyir gzhan gyis de ltar ma rtogs pa de lta na yang thun mong ba nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though it is not realized in that way by another, it is realized as shared.

original: 'on te gzhan gyis ma rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di nyid ga las /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis ma rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di nyid ga las /
translated: But if you say that it is not realized by another, then how is that known?

original: rjes su dpag pas so zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas so zhe na /
translated: By inference.

original: 'o na ni bzlog pa la yang rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni bzlog pa la yang rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, inference would also engage in the opposite.

original: bzlog pa la yang rjes su dpag pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: bzlog pa la yang rjes su dpag pa med do zhe na /
translated: Inference does not engage in the opposite.

original: ji ltar / gcig nyid dang 'brel pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar / gcig nyid dang 'brel pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How so? Because it is not related to the opposite.

original: 'dra ba rjes su dpog pas kyang don byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dra ba rjes su dpog pas kyang don byas pa nyid do //
translated: The inference of similarity also establishes that it has a function.

original: 'dir ni ma mthong ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba mthong bas na /
analyzed: 'dir ni ma mthong ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba mthong bas na /
translated: Here, because the activity that is consistent with what is not seen is seen,

original: nges par ma mthong bas rjes su dpog par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: nges par ma mthong bas rjes su dpog par byed pa nyid do //
translated: But since they do not see it, they infer it.

original: 'di yang pha rol po nyid kyis khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang pha rol po nyid kyis khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: And this is accepted by the opponent himself.

original: de dag ma bslad mig can gyis //
analyzed: de dag ma bslad mig can gyis //
translated: For those who have unclouded vision

original: de ltar mthong ba med phyir ro //üîΩdper na thag ring mya ngam na //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba med phyir ro // dper na thag ring mya ngam na //
translated: do not see it that way.üîΩJust as in a desert

original: chung ngu 'ang chen por snang ba bzhin //
analyzed: chung ngu 'ang chen por snang ba bzhin //
translated: a small thing may appear large from a distance,üîΩso too, it is understood that this is a large thing.

original: de bzhin du 'di ni chen po nyid do zhes rtogs pas de don du gnyer ba nyid kyis nye bar 'gro ba thun mong ba nyid do zhes bya bas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ni chen po nyid do zhes rtogs pas de don du gnyer ba nyid kyis nye bar 'gro ba thun mong ba nyid do zhes bya bas /
translated: And because they seek it, they go to it.

original: gal te don de gzhan gyis kyang mthong ngo zhes bya ba yin na de lta na gzhan gyis khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te don de gzhan gyis kyang mthong ngo zhes bya ba yin na de lta na gzhan gyis khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: If it is said that another also sees that object, then it is accepted by another.

original: de'i phyir gzhan du rjes su dpog pas mthong ba de dor bar bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du rjes su dpog pas mthong ba de dor bar bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the seeing by inference is to be rejected elsewhere.

original: de ltar rjes su dpog pa ni skye bo mtha' dag la grags pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpog pa ni skye bo mtha' dag la grags pa yin no //
translated: For such inference is well known to all people.

original: de kho na mthong ba rnams ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba rnams ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pas so //
translated: But those who see reality do not accept it.

original: yang na gang zhig ji ltar rtogs pa de 'dra ba nyid las gzhan rtogs pa la skabs ci zhig yod /
analyzed: yang na gang zhig ji ltar rtogs pa de 'dra ba nyid las gzhan rtogs pa la skabs ci zhig yod /
translated: Or else, how could one understand anything other than what is understood in that way?

original: rjes su dpog pa yang rang gi rnam pa tsam gyis mthar thug pa yin pas na mngon sum nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa yang rang gi rnam pa tsam gyis mthar thug pa yin pas na mngon sum nyid do //
translated: Inference also terminates in the mere appearance of its own aspect, and so it is also perception.

original: gal te 'dir mthong ngam mthong yang bla ste phyi rol yang yod pa nyid do zhes tha snyad pa rnams kyis rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir mthong ngam mthong yang bla ste phyi rol yang yod pa nyid do zhes tha snyad pa rnams kyis rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But don‚Äôt the people of the world understand that external objects exist, whether they see them or not?

original: de yang rang gi bdag nyid la zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang rang gi bdag nyid la zhugs pa yin te /
translated: They understand only their own ideas.

original: ji srid mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa'i bar du rang gi bdag nyid la zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ji srid mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa'i bar du rang gi bdag nyid la zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: As long as they desire to perceive, they remain in their own ideas.

original: phyi rol du gyur pa'i dngos po gzhan ni rtogs pa med do zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: phyi rol du gyur pa'i dngos po gzhan ni rtogs pa med do zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: They do not understand any external object.

original: gzhan yang thun mong du rtogs pa yang goms pa'i stobs nyid las yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang thun mong du rtogs pa yang goms pa'i stobs nyid las yin te /
translated: Moreover, the understanding of the common world is due to the power of habit.

original: dper na rmi lam bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a dream.

original: 'o na ji ltar gzhal bya dang tshad ma dang 'bras bu rnam bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gzhal bya dang tshad ma dang 'bras bu rnam bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How then are the object of apprehension, the means of valid cognition, and the result of valid cognition established?

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here it is said:üîΩAlthough the object of apprehension, the apprehender, and the awareness exist,

original: gzung ba 'dzin pa rig pa dag / yod pa yin yang gzhal bya dang // 'jal byed 'bras bu gnas @66a * //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pa rig pa dag / yod pa yin yang gzhal bya dang // 'jal byed 'bras bu gnas @66a * //
translated: the object of valid cognition, the means of valid cognition, and the result of valid cognition

original: pa 'di ; / ji ltar rjes su snang bzhin byas //
analyzed: pa 'di ; / ji ltar rjes su snang bzhin byas //
translated: are posited in accordance with how they appear.

original: rtogs pa'i dngos po de nyid de la yod pa yin no zhes rtogs pas na gzung ba dang rang gi rang bzhin gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dngos po de nyid de la yod pa yin no zhes rtogs pas na gzung ba dang rang gi rang bzhin gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The object of realization exists in that very thing. Since it is realized, it is the object of apprehension. Since it is the nature of itself and does not depend on another, it is the apprehender.

original: rang nyid de ltar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid de ltar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is itself like that.

original: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni rig pa yin no zhes nyams su myong ba las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pas tha snyad du rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni rig pa yin no zhes nyams su myong ba las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pas tha snyad du rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: The nature of realization is awareness. Thus, it is conventionally posited by the conceptual thought that arises from experience.

original: rjes su snang ba ni mthong ba dang mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su snang ba ni mthong ba dang mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Appearance is the conceptual thought that accords with what is seen.

original: yod pa yin yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod pa yin yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Although it exists.

original: gzung ba 'dzin pa dang / rig pa rnams yod pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yul la yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pa dang / rig pa rnams yod pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yul la yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The object of the apprehension of the grasped, the grasper, and awareness does not exist.

original: yang na gzung ba la sogs pa thun mong ba la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa la yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gzung ba la sogs pa thun mong ba la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa la yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Or, the object of the apprehension of the commonality of the grasped and so on does not exist.

original: lhag ma ni gzhan dag gis bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gzhan dag gis bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The rest is explained by others.

original: de'i phyir don dam par myong ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par myong ba 'ba' zhig yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, there is only experience.

original: gsum ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum ni ma yin no //
translated: There is not a third.

original: gal te mtha' dag bdag gi rnam par 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ci ste yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: gal te mtha' dag bdag gi rnam par 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ci ste yod pa ma yin /
translated: If all are transformations of the self, why do they not exist?

original: gal te de nyid las ma nyams na yang rnam par 'gyur ba de dag tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid las ma nyams na yang rnam par 'gyur ba de dag tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If they do not deviate from that, those transformations are different.

original: de dag bshad par ni /üîΩde lta min na sna tshogs kyi //
analyzed: de dag bshad par ni / de lta min na sna tshogs kyi //
translated: To explain that, it is said:üîΩOtherwise, in a single entity

original: ngo bor snang can dngos gcig la //
analyzed: ngo bor snang can dngos gcig la //
translated: that appears as a variety of entities,

original: rnam pa ji ltar bden 'gyur te //
analyzed: rnam pa ji ltar bden 'gyur te //
translated: how could the aspects be real?

original: gcig pa nyid do nyams phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid do nyams phyir ro //
translated: Because their oneness would be undermined.

original: gal te gcig yin na ji ltar sna tshogs su snang /
analyzed: gal te gcig yin na ji ltar sna tshogs su snang /
translated: If they are one, how do they appear as a variety?

original: gal te sna tshogs su snang na ni gcig pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs su snang na ni gcig pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it appears as various, then its oneness is lost.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gzhan la gzhan nyid nyams phyir dang // rang bzhin mthong med phyir gcig min //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzhan la gzhan nyid nyams phyir dang // rang bzhin mthong med phyir gcig min //
translated: Because difference in another is lost, and because the nature is not seen, it is not one.

original: blo dngos tha dad med mthong phyir //
analyzed: blo dngos tha dad med mthong phyir //
translated: Because the cognition and the entity are seen as not different,

original: tha dad med par nges par 'gyur //
analyzed: tha dad med par nges par 'gyur //
translated: it is ascertained as not different.

original: gzhan gyi de nyid kyang 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi de nyid kyang 'di kho na yin te /
translated: The reality of the other is just this.

original: tha dad par snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad par snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which appears as different.

original: gzhan du ni gzhan la yang de nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni gzhan la yang de nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the reality of the other would not exist.

original: mi 'dod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that is not accepted,

original: de lta na ni 'o na rang bzhin tha dad par snang ba na ji ltar tha mi dad par khas len /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na rang bzhin tha dad par snang ba na ji ltar tha mi dad par khas len /
translated: then how can you accept that it is not different when its nature appears as different?

original: gal te khyed tha dad pa mi 'dod du zad mod /
analyzed: gal te khyed tha dad pa mi 'dod du zad mod /
translated: If you say that you do not accept difference,

original: de mi snang yang khas blangs par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de mi snang yang khas blangs par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how can you accept that it does not appear?

original: rang bzhin tha mi dad pa mthong na ni khas len pa legs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha mi dad pa mthong na ni khas len pa legs pa nyid do //
translated: If you see that the nature is not different, then it is good to accept that.

original: gal te tha dad pa de dag thams cad rang gsal pa'i rang bzhin yin na thams cad bden pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa de dag thams cad rang gsal pa'i rang bzhin yin na thams cad bden pa nyid do //
translated: If all those differences have a nature that is self-illuminating, then all are real.

original: 'on te mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: 'on te mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: But if they have a nature that is not self-illuminating,

original: ji ltar mi gsal ba gsal ba dang tha @66b mi dad pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar mi gsal ba gsal ba dang tha @66b mi dad pa yin /
translated: how can what is not self-illuminating be different from what is self-illuminating?

original: bdag bzhin du gsal ba nyid yin na ni bden pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag bzhin du gsal ba nyid yin na ni bden pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If it is self-illuminating like the self, then it is real.

original: bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is like the self itself.

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid ni bdag gi rang bzhin yin pas des na mtha' dag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid ni bdag gi rang bzhin yin pas des na mtha' dag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the nature of self-illumination is the nature of the self, therefore it is all.

original: de'i phyir yongs su gyur pa nyams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su gyur pa nyams so //
translated: Therefore, the transformation is lost.

original: 'on te mang po nyid 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mang po nyid 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if multiplicity itself is error,

original: de lta yin na cung zad kyang ma yin par gyur pas mtha' dag stong pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na cung zad kyang ma yin par gyur pas mtha' dag stong pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then since it would not be anything at all, everything would be empty.

original: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba yang bdag las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba yang bdag las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And what is called ‚Äúerror‚Äù does not exist as different from the self.

original: 'khrul pa zhes ming du btags pas kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes ming du btags pas kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to designate what is called ‚Äúerror‚Äù?

original: 'khrul pa med na ni 'di mtha' dag med par 'gyur ba'i phyir tha dad pa ni de nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med na ni 'di mtha' dag med par 'gyur ba'i phyir tha dad pa ni de nyid ma yin no //
translated: If there were no error, then all of this would not exist. Therefore, difference is not reality.

original: des na de kho na ma yin pa snang ba'i rgyu mtshan 'khrul par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de kho na ma yin pa snang ba'i rgyu mtshan 'khrul par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause of the appearance of what is not reality is established as error.

original: 'di ni 'khrul pa nyid min na //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khrul pa nyid min na //
translated: If this were not error,

original: bzlog bya nyid du 'grub ma yin //
analyzed: bzlog bya nyid du 'grub ma yin //
translated: it would not be established as what is to be eliminated.

original: bzlog bya nyid du shes pas kyang //
analyzed: bzlog bya nyid du shes pas kyang //
translated: Also, by knowing it as what is to be eliminated,

original: 'khrul pa nyid ces rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid ces rtogs pa yin //
translated: one realizes it as error.

original: 'khrul pa nges pa la brten nas //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nges pa la brten nas //
translated: In dependence on ascertaining error,

original: bzlog pa la ni 'jug par 'gyur //üîΩde las bzlog phyir 'khor lor ni //
analyzed: bzlog pa la ni 'jug par 'gyur // de las bzlog phyir 'khor lor ni //
translated: one engages in the elimination of it.üîΩSince it is the opposite of that,

original: 'gyur ba 'di ni gang gis 'jil //
analyzed: 'gyur ba 'di ni gang gis 'jil //
translated: how can this wheel of existence be stopped?üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / gang gis dngos po rnam dpyad na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang gis dngos po rnam dpyad na //
translated: when one analyzes things,

original: de nyid du na de dngos med //
analyzed: de nyid du na de dngos med //
translated: they do not exist in reality.

original: gang gi phyir na de dag la //üîΩgcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin med //
analyzed: gang gi phyir na de dag la // gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin med //
translated: Because theyüîΩdo not have the nature of being one or many.

original: gcig ni yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gcig ni yod pa ma yin te //
translated: One does not exist

original: du ma nyid du snang phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma nyid du snang phyir ro //
translated: because of the appearance of many.

original: myong ba ma yin pa ni snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir de ni myong ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: myong ba ma yin pa ni snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir de ni myong ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And what is not an experience is not an appearance, so it would be the nature of an experience.

original: rang rig pa nyid la yang du ma mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te rtogs pa de'i nang du chud pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid la yang du ma mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro // 'on te rtogs pa de'i nang du chud pa'i phyir na /
translated: And in self-awareness, too, many things are not cognized.üîΩBut if you say that because the object is included in the cognition,

original: de'i nang du chud pa nyid mi rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i nang du chud pa nyid mi rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: the object is included in the cognition but is not cognized,

original: de yang brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: that also cannot be said.

original: yang na sna tshogs kyi rnam pa gcig gam du ma ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na sna tshogs kyi rnam pa gcig gam du ma ni med pa nyid do //
translated: Or else, the aspect of the variety is either one or many, but it does not exist.

original: 'o na tha dad par ji ltar snang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na tha dad par ji ltar snang zhe na /
translated: But if it does not exist, how can it appear as different?

original: tha dad pa ni snang ba ma yin no zhes bstan zin cing ston par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni snang ba ma yin no zhes bstan zin cing ston par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It has been shown and will be shown that it does not appear as different.

original: yang na tha dad pa'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: yang na tha dad pa'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: Or else, the nature of the different

original: de lta ma yin pa mtha' dag ni goms pa'i stobs nyid las snang ba yin pa'i phyir na mi bden pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa mtha' dag ni goms pa'i stobs nyid las snang ba yin pa'i phyir na mi bden pa nyid do //
translated: or the nature of the non-different is all appearance due to the power of habituation, and therefore it is not real.

original: sgom par byed pas phyin ci log tu bsgoms pas bzlog par nus pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: sgom par byed pas phyin ci log tu bsgoms pas bzlog par nus pa'i phyir na /
translated: And because it can be averted by meditation, it is averted by the meditator through meditating on the opposite of the error.

original: bzlog par nus pa nyid yin par nges pas na mi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: bzlog par nus pa nyid yin par nges pas na mi bden pa yin no //
translated: If it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?

original: gal te / chos mthun pa nyid mthong ba las //
analyzed: gal te / chos mthun pa nyid mthong ba las //
translated: If it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,

original: de bdag min la de bdag tu //
analyzed: de bdag min la de bdag tu //
translated: then how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,

original: zhes @67a * //
analyzed: zhes @67a * //
translated: then how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?

original: pas 'jig rten pa dag gi /'khrul skyed de la de med de //
analyzed: pas 'jig rten pa dag gi /'khrul skyed de la de med de //
translated: If it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?

original: 'gro ba 'di la de bdag nyid //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di la de bdag nyid //
translated: If it were real,

original: gcig kyang mthong ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig kyang mthong ba med phyir ro //
translated: then how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: then how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?

original: chos mthun pa mthong ba nyid las ni 'khrul pa ma yin te /üîΩnang gi bslad pa las byung gang //
analyzed: chos mthun pa mthong ba nyid las ni 'khrul pa ma yin te / nang gi bslad pa las byung gang //
translated: If it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,

original: de ni nyes pa las byung bas //
analyzed: de ni nyes pa las byung bas //
translated: then how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,

original: rang bzhin gyis ni phyin log tu //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni phyin log tu //
translated: then how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?

original: snang ba can 'di 'ang yod pa yin //
analyzed: snang ba can 'di 'ang yod pa yin //
translated: If it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?

original: chos mthun mthong stsogs can nyid la //
analyzed: chos mthun mthong stsogs can nyid la //
translated: If it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,

analyzed: ltos med rab rib la sogs bzhin //üîΩrab rib kyis mig bsgribs pa rnams la sbrang bu dang sha sbrang la sogs pa mthong ba gzhan gyi stobs las skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: then how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,üîΩthen how could it be reversed?üîΩIf it were real,

original: 'on kyang nang gi rab rib kyi rgyu nyid las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang nang gi rab rib kyi rgyu nyid las yin no //
translated: But it is due to the cause of internal cataracts.

original: gal te rab rib la sogs pa las skye ba yang dngos po'i stobs nyid las yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te rab rib la sogs pa las skye ba yang dngos po'i stobs nyid las yin gyi /
translated: If it arises from cataracts, etc., it is due to the power of the thing itself,

original: goms pa'i stobs las ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: goms pa'i stobs las ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and not due to the power of habit.

original: nang gi rgyu tsam zhig brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: nang gi rgyu tsam zhig brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: We only wish to state the internal cause.

original: thams cad la khyab pa'i nang gi rgyu ni bag chags nyid yin te /
analyzed: thams cad la khyab pa'i nang gi rgyu ni bag chags nyid yin te /
translated: The internal cause that pervades all is habit energy.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the understanding in dreams, etc.

original: bag chags de ni rnam pa ci zhig ltar sad pa na rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rtogs pa skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bag chags de ni rnam pa ci zhig ltar sad pa na rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rtogs pa skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That habit energy is the cause of the arising of understanding that is in conformity with it when one is awake.

original: de la chos mthun pa mthong ba'i ni mthong ba snga ma snga ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la chos mthun pa mthong ba'i ni mthong ba snga ma snga ma nyid yin no //
translated: That which sees similarity is the prior seeing.

original: gang gis 'di 'khrul par 'gyur ba dang po ci zhig mthong /
analyzed: gang gis 'di 'khrul par 'gyur ba dang po ci zhig mthong /
translated: What was seen at the beginning from which it becomes deluded?

original: mthong na de ji ltar mthong zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: mthong na de ji ltar mthong zhes brjod par bya /
translated: If it is seen, how is it seen?

original: des na de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir thams cad ma 'khrul pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir thams cad ma 'khrul pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, because it is like that, all is undeluded.

original: 'on te de lta ma yin par mthong na ji ltar 'khrul pa thams cad chos mthun pas mthong ba las yin zhes bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de lta ma yin par mthong na ji ltar 'khrul pa thams cad chos mthun pas mthong ba las yin zhes bya ba ma yin te /
translated: But if it is not so, then how can all errors be the same in that they are based on perception?

original: 'di ni 'khrul pa brgyud pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni 'khrul pa brgyud pa nyid de /
translated: This is a mere succession of errors.

original: 'di la dang po ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la dang po ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the first is not real.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba 'di ni thog ma med pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bag chags kyis btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba 'di ni thog ma med pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bag chags kyis btags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this cyclic existence is a false imputation due to beginningless error.

original: ji ltar rang gi bdag nyid la tshad ma la sogs pa rnam par gzhag ce na /üîΩde la blo ni yongs gcod pa//
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi bdag nyid la tshad ma la sogs pa rnam par gzhag ce na / de la blo ni yongs gcod pa//
translated: How can one posit valid cognitions, etc. in regard to one‚Äôs own nature?üîΩThe mind is a determinative

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'dod pa de //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'dod pa de //
translated: apprehension, it is held.üîΩIt is self-knowing because it is of the nature of that,

original: de yi bdag nyid phyir bdag rig / de phyir de de'i sgrub byed yin //
analyzed: de yi bdag nyid phyir bdag rig / de phyir de de'i sgrub byed yin //
translated: and therefore it establishes that.

original: de nyid bsgrub bya de nyid sgrub byed de nyid grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub bya de nyid sgrub byed de nyid grub pa yin no //
translated: The object to be established is that very thing, and the means of establishing it is that very thing, and that very thing is established.

original: de la 'dod chags sogs rig bzhin //üîΩrang bdag yul can tshad ma la //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags sogs rig bzhin // rang bdag yul can tshad ma la //
translated: In that regard, it is like the knowledge of desire, etc.üîΩThe valid cognition that has the self as its object

original: gzhal bya 'jal byed 'bras gnas pa //
analyzed: gzhal bya 'jal byed 'bras gnas pa //
translated: is the basis of the object to be evaluated and the means of evaluation.

original: 'di ni kun @67b la sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: 'di ni kun @67b la sbyar bar bya //
translated: This should be applied to all.

original: bde ba la sogs pa goms pa'i stobs las skyes pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa goms pa'i stobs las skyes pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has been shown that the power of habituation to pleasure, etc. is born of the nature of self-awareness.

original: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba ni mngon sum tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba ni mngon sum tshad ma yin la /
translated: The experience of pleasure, etc. is direct perception, a valid cognition.

original: de la tshad ma dang gzhal bya rang rtogs pa ni tha dad pa med pa nyid du rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: de la tshad ma dang gzhal bya rang rtogs pa ni tha dad pa med pa nyid du rnam par gnas so //
translated: And in that, the valid cognition and the cognized object are established as not different.

original: de kho na nyid 'di ni rnam pa bzhir yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid 'di ni rnam pa bzhir yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: This reality is completely perfect in four aspects.

original: 'jal bar byed pa po dang / gzhal bya dang tshad ma dang rtogs pa'o zhes gang brjod pa de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jal bar byed pa po dang / gzhal bya dang tshad ma dang rtogs pa'o zhes gang brjod pa de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not true that what is said to be the cognizer, the cognized object, the valid cognition, and the realization are different,

original: gcig nyid du thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid du thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because everything is completely perfect in oneness.

original: gal te bden pa la sogs pa tha dad pa ma yin du chug mod /
analyzed: gal te bden pa la sogs pa tha dad pa ma yin du chug mod /
translated: If it is granted that pleasure, etc. are not different,

original: ser po la sogs pa ni tha dad pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: ser po la sogs pa ni tha dad pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: yellow, etc. are certainly different.

original: ma yin te gzhal bya dang tshad ma dang / 'bras bu gnas pa 'di nyid thams cad la sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te gzhal bya dang tshad ma dang / 'bras bu gnas pa 'di nyid thams cad la sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: No, for this very same point‚Äîthat the object of apprehension, the valid cognition, and the result are all present‚Äîapplies to all cases.

original: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa myong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa myong ba yang yin no //
translated: is the experience of blue, etc.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa zhe 'am bde ba'i rnam pa zhes bya bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa zhe 'am bde ba'i rnam pa zhes bya bar 'gyur mod /
translated: It may be said that the experience of blue is the experience of the aspect of blue or the experience of the aspect of pleasure.

original: 'di la khyad par ci yod gnyi ga yang rang gi ngo bos rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la khyad par ci yod gnyi ga yang rang gi ngo bos rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is the difference between these two? Both are known by their own nature.

original: des na sngon po dang / bde ba dang / lus kyi rig pa mtha' dag ni rang gi ngo bos yin gyi /
analyzed: des na sngon po dang / bde ba dang / lus kyi rig pa mtha' dag ni rang gi ngo bos yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, all experiences of blue, pleasure, and the body are by their own nature.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not by the nature of something else.

original: gal te thams cad rang gi ngo bos yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te thams cad rang gi ngo bos yin na ni /
translated: If everything is by its own nature,

original: rang rig pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa kho na'o //
translated: it is only self-awareness.

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa rig pa la bde ba la sogs pa ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa rig pa la bde ba la sogs pa ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the awareness of blue, etc. is not by nature the apprehending aspect, like pleasure, etc.,

original: de ji ltar dpe yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar dpe yin zhe na /
translated: how can it be an example?

original: bde ba la sogs pa la ji ltar /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa la ji ltar /
translated: How is it like pleasure, etc.?

original: rang nyid gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang nyid gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag bzhin no zhe na /
translated: because it is the nature of self-illumination, like the self.

original: gsal ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba 'di ci zhig lkog tu ma gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba 'di ci zhig lkog tu ma gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: What is this so-called nature of self-illumination? It is the nature that is not hidden.

original: gal te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na /
translated: If that is so,

original: de la'ang nyams myong bdag nyid phyir //
analyzed: de la'ang nyams myong bdag nyid phyir //
translated: then, because of the nature of experience,

original: de dag rang bdag myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag rang bdag myong bar 'gyur //
translated: they would experience themselves.

original: de lta rung nyid de tshad bdag / gzhal bya rang rig 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: de lta rung nyid de tshad bdag / gzhal bya rang rig 'bras bu yin //
translated: Even if that were so, the self that is the measure would be the result of the self-awareness of the object of cognition.

original: sngon po la sogs pa de dag kyang lkog tu ma gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid yin no ;
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa de dag kyang lkog tu ma gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid yin no ;
translated: Those blue things, etc., are also of the nature of experience because their nature is not hidden.

original: ; des na bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du rang rig par rung ba yin no //
analyzed: ; des na bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du rang rig par rung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, like pleasure, etc., they are suitable to be self-aware.

original: sngon po la sogs pa de dag kyang gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyis ni lkog tu ma gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa de dag kyang gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyis ni lkog tu ma gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: And those blue things, etc., are not not hidden by the nature of another.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa'i dbang gis sngon po la sogs pa lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa'i dbang gis sngon po la sogs pa lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether blue, etc., are not not hidden by the power of the eye, etc.,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: no, they are not.

original: rang gi ngo bo kho @68a * //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho @68a * //
translated: Its essence isüîΩ

original: nas lkog tu ma gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi phyir mig 'jug pa de'i phyir sngon po lkog tu ma gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nas lkog tu ma gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir mig 'jug pa de'i phyir sngon po lkog tu ma gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: because it is not hidden from its own nature.

original: mig 'jug kyang res 'ga' lkog tu ma gyur par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mig 'jug kyang res 'ga' lkog tu ma gyur par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: It is not the case that blue is not hidden from the eye that engages it, because even when the eye engages it, sometimes it is not seen,

original: ma zhugs kyang lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma zhugs kyang lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and even when it does not engage it, it is possible that it is not hidden.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / chags sogs gyur na mi 'jug kyang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / chags sogs gyur na mi 'jug kyang //
translated: Even when the eye is impaired, it is not hidden,

original: rang gi rang bzhin mi snang phyir //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin mi snang phyir //
translated: because its own nature is not seen.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa ni //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa ni //
translated: The aspects of form, etc.

original: gzhan nyid du ni snang ba yin //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du ni snang ba yin //
translated: are seen as different.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa las byung ba mngon du phyogs par byed kyang yul rang gi ngo bos mi snang na 'di ji ltar lkog tu ma gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa las byung ba mngon du phyogs par byed kyang yul rang gi ngo bos mi snang na 'di ji ltar lkog tu ma gyur pa yin te /
translated: If the eye, etc. are directed toward the arising of an object, but the object does not appear by its own nature, how is it not hidden?

original: rang gi ngo bos snang ba nyid lkog tu ma gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos snang ba nyid lkog tu ma gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is not hidden if it appears by its own nature.

original: 'on te mig gi nyes pa 'di ni goms pa'i dbang gis yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mig gi nyes pa 'di ni goms pa'i dbang gis yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that this fault of the eye is due to the power of habit,

original: gal te mig sogs las byung ba //
analyzed: gal te mig sogs las byung ba //
translated: If it is argued that the arising of the eye, etc.

original: goms las gzhan du rtogs na ni //
analyzed: goms las gzhan du rtogs na ni //
translated: is from the habit-energy,

original: sngon po la sogs snang ba kun //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs snang ba kun //
translated: then all the appearances of blue, etc.

original: goms pa yi ni stobs las yin //
analyzed: goms pa yi ni stobs las yin //
translated: are from the power of habit-energy.

original: bag chags kyi myong ba rnam grangs can goms pa nyid mig la sogs pa las byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bag chags kyi myong ba rnam grangs can goms pa nyid mig la sogs pa las byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of the arising of the eye, etc. is the habit-energy of the various experiences.

original: de'i tshe sngon po la sogs par snang ba mtha' dag bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe sngon po la sogs par snang ba mtha' dag bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba nyid do //
translated: At that time, all the appearances of blue, etc. arise from the power of habit-energy.

original: gal te rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i bag chags yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i bag chags yin gyi /
translated: If it is argued that the habit-energy is the appearance in another aspect,

original: rang gi ngo bor snang ba ni bag chags yin par 'byung ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor snang ba ni bag chags yin par 'byung ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yin no zhe na /
translated: but the appearance of its own nature is the cause of the eye, etc.,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: phan tshun ltos nas thams cad rnam pa gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos nas thams cad rnam pa gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because everything is another aspect in mutual dependence.

original: des na du ma snang ba na gang gi rang bzhin yin pa mi shes so //
analyzed: des na du ma snang ba na gang gi rang bzhin yin pa mi shes so //
translated: Therefore, when many appear, it is not known what its nature is.

original: snang ba tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba tshad ma yin te /
translated: The appearance is valid knowledge.

original: gal te de 'khrul na yid brtan pa ga las yin des na /
analyzed: gal te de 'khrul na yid brtan pa ga las yin des na /
translated: If it is mistaken, how can it be reliable?

original: snang ba dag ni mtha' dag kyang //üîΩbag chags dngos pos sprul pa yin //
analyzed: snang ba dag ni mtha' dag kyang // bag chags dngos pos sprul pa yin //
translated: All these appearancesüîΩare emanations of the things of habitual tendencies.

original: rang bzhin du ni mngon 'dod las //
analyzed: rang bzhin du ni mngon 'dod las //
translated: The nature of the mind is asserted to be

original: gzhan snang ba yi rang bzhin bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan snang ba yi rang bzhin bzhin //
translated: like the nature of appearances to others.

original: gnod bya gnod byed kyi dngos po ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: gnod bya gnod byed kyi dngos po ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The entities of the object of refutation and the means of refutation have been presented above.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la yang rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin la de'i rnam pa ni tshad ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la yang rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin la de'i rnam pa ni tshad ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, even in the case of external objects, reflexive awareness is the effect, and its aspect is the valid knowledge.

original: / gal te shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / gal te shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúconsciousness has an aspect‚Äù is not tenable,üîΩthen,

original: 'di ltar / gal te me long ltar gsal ba //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te me long ltar gsal ba //
translated: if it is clear like a mirror,

original: nye bar gzhag pas bsgyur phyir na //
analyzed: nye bar gzhag pas bsgyur phyir na //
translated: because it is transformed by the object placed before it,

original: de tshe mig sogs snang 'gyur na //
analyzed: de tshe mig sogs snang 'gyur na //
translated: then at that time, the eye and so on would appear,

original: de ltar yang ni mthong ba med //üîΩme long la ni ji srid pa //
analyzed: de ltar yang ni mthong ba med // me long la ni ji srid pa //
translated: but it is not seen in that way.üîΩAs long as it is in the mirror,

original: nye bar de kun snang 'gyur @68b ba ;
analyzed: nye bar de kun snang 'gyur @68b ba ;
translated: all that is placed before it appears.

original: / de phyir gzugs sogs thams cad ni //
analyzed: / de phyir gzugs sogs thams cad ni //
translated: Therefore it follows that all forms and so on

original: snang ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: snang ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: are just appearances.

original: 'on te mig ni me long bzhin //
analyzed: 'on te mig ni me long bzhin //
translated: If the eye is like a mirror,

original: snang ba yi ni rgyu yin na //
analyzed: snang ba yi ni rgyu yin na //
translated: If it is the cause of appearances,

original: me long sogs bzhin der shar ba //
analyzed: me long sogs bzhin der shar ba //
translated: Then it would be seen in the mirror,

original: chen po min par mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: chen po min par mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: And it would not be great.üîΩSo you would not know its nature

original: des na rang bzhin ci 'dra dang // tshad ci yin pa shes mi 'gyur //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin ci 'dra dang // tshad ci yin pa shes mi 'gyur //
translated: Or its size.

original: ling tog la sogs mig nad kyis //
analyzed: ling tog la sogs mig nad kyis //
translated: When the eyes are afflicted with myodesopsia,

original: mdog kyang gzhan du snang ba nyid //
analyzed: mdog kyang gzhan du snang ba nyid //
translated: Colors appear differently.

original: 'on te mig 'bras na thon te //üîΩgzugs sogs la ni zhugs pa yis //
analyzed: 'on te mig 'bras na thon te // gzugs sogs la ni zhugs pa yis //
translated: But if the eyes are healthy,üîΩAnd the forms and so on are present,

original: che sogs rang gi rang bzhin la //
analyzed: che sogs rang gi rang bzhin la //
translated: The perception of their size

original: 'dzin par byed pa skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa skye 'gyur na //
translated: And so on arises.üîΩIf the nature of the lamp is known

original: gal te mar me snang ba dang // 'brel las ngo bo khyad par can //üîΩskyes pas rang bzhin rig 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te mar me snang ba dang // 'brel las ngo bo khyad par can // skyes pas rang bzhin rig 'gyur na //
translated: Through its connection with light,

original: mar me snang ba dang 'brel bzhin //
analyzed: mar me snang ba dang 'brel bzhin //
translated: Then just as the lamp is connected with light,üîΩIt would not be different from the light.

original: 'gyur min de na gzhan gyi ni //
analyzed: 'gyur min de na gzhan gyi ni //
translated: But if it is not different,

original: byed yod pas na thug med 'gyur //
analyzed: byed yod pas na thug med 'gyur //
translated: Then there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'on te rang rig de yi tshe //
analyzed: 'on te rang rig de yi tshe //
translated: But if it is self-aware at that time,

original: de dag ji ltar 'od zer yin //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar 'od zer yin //
translated: How can it be light?

original: des na shes pa don gnas pas //
analyzed: des na shes pa don gnas pas //
translated: Therefore, since consciousness is based on objects,

original: de yi rnam par 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: de yi rnam par 'jug pa yin //
translated: Its mode of engagement is in terms of objects.

original: de las skyes tsam las shes na //
analyzed: de las skyes tsam las shes na //
translated: If consciousness were produced from that,

original: kun gyis rnam par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: kun gyis rnam par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: then it would follow that everyone would have all of them.

original: gal te gang las de skyes pa //
analyzed: gal te gang las de skyes pa //
translated: If that from which it arises

original: de nyid rnam pa can 'gyur na //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa can 'gyur na //
translated: were to have the aspect of that,

original: mig rnam yang 'gyur de las kyang //
analyzed: mig rnam yang 'gyur de las kyang //
translated: then the eye would also have the aspect of form,

original: gang phyir rig pa skyes phyir ro //
analyzed: gang phyir rig pa skyes phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness arises from that.

original: 'di la bshad pa /üîΩyul rnams las ni byung ba yis //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa / yul rnams las ni byung ba yis //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:üîΩSince all consciousnesses arise from objects,

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad dag / de las gzhan rgyu yin na yang //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad dag / de las gzhan rgyu yin na yang //
translated: even if there were another cause,

original: rnam 'gas yul gyi rnam par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam 'gas yul gyi rnam par 'gyur //
translated: in what way would it have the aspect of the object?

original: gang las skye ba de nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / dper na zas dang dus la sogs //
analyzed: gang las skye ba de nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te / 'di ltar / dper na zas dang dus la sogs //
translated: That from which consciousness arises does not have the aspect of that.üîΩFor example,

original: bu skye ba yi rgyu yin yang //
analyzed: bu skye ba yi rgyu yin yang //
translated: food, time, and so on are the causes of a child‚Äôs birth,

original: de ni pha ma gcig gi gzugs //
analyzed: de ni pha ma gcig gi gzugs //
translated: but the child does not take on the form of both parents,

original: 'dzin 'gyur gzhan 'ga'i ma yin bzhin //
analyzed: 'dzin 'gyur gzhan 'ga'i ma yin bzhin //
translated: but rather the form of one or the other.

original: de las byung ba'i bu ni pha ma gnyi ga dang yang mtshungs pa'i rnam pa ni 'dzin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i bu ni pha ma gnyi ga dang yang mtshungs pa'i rnam pa ni 'dzin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The child born from them does not take on the aspect of both parents,

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig nyid kyi'o //
translated: but rather the aspect of one or the other.

original: de'i phyir don nyid las don gyi rnam pa yin no //üîΩ'di ltar / thag ring yul rnams shing las ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir don nyid las don gyi rnam pa yin no // 'di ltar / thag ring yul rnams shing las ni //
translated: Therefore, the object itself is the form of the object.üîΩThus,

original: rnam shes de yi rnam par ni //
analyzed: rnam shes de yi rnam par ni //
translated: The consciousness of distant objects arises in the form of trees, etc.

original: skyes 'gyur dbang po'i rnam par ni //
analyzed: skyes 'gyur dbang po'i rnam par ni //
translated: But not in the form of the sense faculty.

original: min zhes bya ba kun tshe mthong //üîΩde las gzhan dang yul dag ni //
analyzed: min zhes bya ba kun tshe mthong // de las gzhan dang yul dag ni //
translated: This is seen in all cases.

original: de rgyu nyid du mtshungs na yang //
analyzed: de rgyu nyid du mtshungs na yang //
translated: Even though the object and something else are equal in being causes,

original: de chas yul ni yin 'dod des //
analyzed: de chas yul ni yin 'dod des //
translated: The object is asserted to be that which,

original: de med par ni der mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de med par ni der mi 'gyur //
translated: when absent, it does not occur.

original: rgyu nyid kyis ni yul ma yin gyi //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyis ni yul ma yin gyi //
translated: It is not the object by being a cause,

original: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa de'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyu @69a * //üîΩnyid kyis so //üîΩrgyu nyid kyi yul yin pa ni mig la sogs pa yang yul nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa de'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyu @69a * // nyid kyis so // rgyu nyid kyi yul yin pa ni mig la sogs pa yang yul nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: but rather by being the cause of the form of that consciousness.

original: de'i rnam pa nyid kyis yin na ni smig rgyu la sogs pa la chur shes pa'i yul du yul gzhan na gnas pa'i chur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa nyid kyis yin na ni smig rgyu la sogs pa la chur shes pa'i yul du yul gzhan na gnas pa'i chur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the object by being the form of that, then water existing elsewhere would be the object of the consciousness of water with respect to a mirage, etc.

original: des na gnyi ga la brten to //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga la brten to //
translated: Therefore, it is based on both.

original: de med na ni yul du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na ni yul du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were absent, it would not be the object.

original: rnam pa med par mi rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa myong ba nyid dang / de lta ma yin yang bla ste /
analyzed: rnam pa med par mi rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa myong ba nyid dang / de lta ma yin yang bla ste /
translated: The nature of consciousness is not to be cognized without aspects, and it is not experienced.

original: de'i rnam pa'i yul rnam par 'jog par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa'i yul rnam par 'jog par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if it were, it would not be able to posit the object as having those aspects,

original: rtogs pa dang gzhan pa'i gnas skabs dag mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang gzhan pa'i gnas skabs dag mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because it is not tenable that it is in a different state from the state of cognizing it.

original: gal te de rtogs na gzhan gyis ci bya ste don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de rtogs na gzhan gyis ci bya ste don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it cognizes it, what is the use of the other, because it is purposeless?

original: 'on te ma rtogs na de'i tshe yang mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te ma rtogs na de'i tshe yang mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it does not cognize it, then it is not able to cognize it,

original: ma rtogs pa ni rtogs pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni rtogs pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: because that which is not cognized is not the object of cognition.

original: gal te rtogs so zhen ni /
analyzed: gal te rtogs so zhen ni /
translated: If you say that it cognizes it,

original: de nyid de'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs pa yin no //
translated: then it is the nature of that which is cognized.

original: bya ba gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes lan brgyar bstan to //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes lan brgyar bstan to //
translated: It is not endowed with another action.

original: gal te rnam pa grub na rnam pa tshad ma yin la rang rig pa ni 'bras bu yin na zhes 'grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa grub na rnam pa tshad ma yin la rang rig pa ni 'bras bu yin na zhes 'grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the aspect is established, is the aspect a valid knowledge and is reflexive awareness the effect?

original: de nyid ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: de nyid ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: How is that established?

original: 'di la bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / yul shes de yi shes pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yul shes de yi shes pa yi //
translated: The cognition of the object and the cognition of that cognition

original: bye brag las ni tshul gnyis nyid //
analyzed: bye brag las ni tshul gnyis nyid //
translated: Are different in terms of the two modes.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi shes pa gang yin pa ni don dang rang snang ba yin la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi shes pa gang yin pa ni don dang rang snang ba yin la /
translated: The cognition of the object such as form is the appearance of the object and itself.

original: yul shes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni don dang 'dra ba'i shes pa snang ba dang / rang snang ba yin no //
analyzed: yul shes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni don dang 'dra ba'i shes pa snang ba dang / rang snang ba yin no //
translated: The cognition of the cognition of the object is the appearance of the cognition resembling the object and itself.

original: de lta ma yin no //üîΩgal te yul gyi shes pa don gyi rnam pa 'ba' zhig gam /
analyzed: de lta ma yin no // gal te yul gyi shes pa don gyi rnam pa 'ba' zhig gam /
translated: Otherwise,üîΩIf the cognition of the object were only the aspect of the object

original: rang gi rnam pa 'ba' zhig yin na yul shes pa'i shes pa yang de dang khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa 'ba' zhig yin na yul shes pa'i shes pa yang de dang khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or only its own aspect, the cognition of the cognition of the object would be no different from that.

original: yul gyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni don dang rang snang ba'i yin la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: yul gyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni don dang rang snang ba'i yin la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The statement The cognition of the object is the appearance of the object and itself is the proposition.

original: de'i 'og ma dag ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma dag ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The following statements are the reasons.

original: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: The statement Otherwise, etc. is the authoritative refutation.

original: bdag la shes pa ci 'dra ba zhig byung bar gyur zhes gang gi tshe yongs su rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe don snang ba nyid dran pas tha snyad byed pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag la shes pa ci 'dra ba zhig byung bar gyur zhes gang gi tshe yongs su rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe don snang ba nyid dran pas tha snyad byed pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: When one asks, ‚ÄúWhat kind of cognition has arisen in me?‚Äù then one uses the expression ‚Äúan appearance of an object‚Äù due to memory, but not otherwise.

original: gang zhig mos pas yul du byas pas de ni de lta bu nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig mos pas yul du byas pas de ni de lta bu nyid yin te /
translated: That which is taken as an object by the imagination is just that.

original: dper na ba lang zhes mos pas yul du byas pa'i khra bo la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang zhes mos pas yul du byas pa'i khra bo la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a multicolored cow, etc. that is taken as an object by the imagination of a cow.üîΩThus, it is said:

original: 'di ltar / 'di ni de lta @69b bu snang na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'di ni de lta @69b bu snang na //
translated: ‚ÄúThis appears thus,

original: don ni ji 'dra mi shes zhes //
analyzed: don ni ji 'dra mi shes zhes //
translated: but I do not know what the object is like.‚Äù

original: de ni don nyid yongs dor te //
analyzed: de ni don nyid yongs dor te //
translated: That is, one should completely abandon the notion that it is an object.

original: shes pa rnam par nges pa nyid //
analyzed: shes pa rnam par nges pa nyid //
translated: One should be certain that it is cognition.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig 'di don yin no zhes khyed kyis ji ltar shes zhes 'dri ba de'i tshe don du snang ba 'di 'dra bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig 'di don yin no zhes khyed kyis ji ltar shes zhes 'dri ba de'i tshe don du snang ba 'di 'dra bar gyur na /
translated: If someone asks, ‚ÄúHow do you know that this is the object?‚Äù then one should reply, ‚ÄúWhen this appears as an object,

original: don ni de na yod dam med dam /
analyzed: don ni de na yod dam med dam /
translated: I do not know whether the object exists or not,

original: de 'dra ba yin nam /
analyzed: de 'dra ba yin nam /
translated: whether it is like this

original: 'on te gzhan du gyur pa yin zhes mi shes zhes lan ldon par byed do //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du gyur pa yin zhes mi shes zhes lan ldon par byed do //
translated: or whether it is otherwise.‚Äù

original: des na don yongs su spangs pas shes pa nyid snang ba yin no //
analyzed: des na don yongs su spangs pas shes pa nyid snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the object is completely abandoned, consciousness itself appears.

original: don dang gcig pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: don dang gcig pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it were identical with the object,

original: de nyid la nges pa dang de nyid ma nges par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid la nges pa dang de nyid ma nges par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: how could it be ascertained as that and not ascertained as that?

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ascertainment and non-ascertainment are contradictory.

original: 'on te rags pa'i snang ba tsam nges pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te rags pa'i snang ba tsam nges pa yin la /
translated: But if the mere appearance of the gross object is ascertained,

original: nang gi khyad par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nang gi khyad par ni ma yin no //
translated: not the internal distinctions,

original: des na 'di la 'dra bar snang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na 'di la 'dra bar snang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then it is said that it appears similar to this.

original: 'di tsam zhig snang gi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes don nyid nges pa dang ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di tsam zhig snang gi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes don nyid nges pa dang ma nges pa yin te /
translated: The object itself is ascertained and not ascertained, in that it appears to this extent and not otherwise.

original: cha gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: cha gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it has two aspects.

original: 'di ni phyis bshad par bya'o //üîΩgzhan yang ; don dang ldan pa'i sems la ni //
analyzed: 'di ni phyis bshad par bya'o // gzhan yang ; don dang ldan pa'i sems la ni //
translated: This will be explained later.üîΩMoreover,

original: don rnams med par dogs na yang //
analyzed: don rnams med par dogs na yang //
translated: when there is doubt that the object exists in the mind that possesses the object,

original: 'das pa'i don ni 'dzin pa la //
analyzed: 'das pa'i don ni 'dzin pa la //
translated: in the apprehension of the past object,

original: tshul gnyis rang rig grub pa nyid //
analyzed: tshul gnyis rang rig grub pa nyid //
translated: the two modes are established as self-awareness.

original: gang dag shes pa ni snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag shes pa ni snang ba ma yin te /
