translated: Those who say consciousness is not appearance,

original: rang rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because self-awareness does not exist.

original: dran pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it memory,

original: thams cad du don nyid dran pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: thams cad du don nyid dran pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because memory is of an object.

original: de la ji ltar don shes pa'i don gyis go bas na shes pa yong su brtags pa de bzhin du dran pa mi 'thad pas kyang yin no //
analyzed: de la ji ltar don shes pa'i don gyis go bas na shes pa yong su brtags pa de bzhin du dran pa mi 'thad pas kyang yin no //
translated: Just as the designation of consciousness is not tenable because of the understanding of an object, so also memory is not tenable.

original: shes ni myong ba ma yin la //
analyzed: shes ni myong ba ma yin la //
translated: Consciousness is not experience,

original: de don gyi rnam pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de don gyi rnam pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it the aspect of an object.

original: des na shes pa tshul gnyis yin no zhes bya bar dam 'cha' ba ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin no ;
analyzed: des na shes pa tshul gnyis yin no zhes bya bar dam 'cha' ba ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the assertion that consciousness has a twofold mode is contradicted by perception.

original: / gtan tshigs the tshom la brjod phyir //
analyzed: / gtan tshigs the tshom la brjod phyir //
translated: Because the reason is stated in regard to doubt,

original: bsam pa gtan tshigs rten ma yin //üîΩgtan tshigs 'jug pa'ang dpe la ni //
analyzed: bsam pa gtan tshigs rten ma yin // gtan tshigs 'jug pa'ang dpe la ni //
translated: intention is not the basis of the reason.üîΩThe engagement of the reason is also

original: 'brel pa bzung ba las yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa bzung ba las yin no //
translated: in regard to the relation grasped in the example.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And that does not exist,

original: thams cad la don gyi rnam pa rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad la don gyi rnam pa rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the aspect of the object is the basis of dispute in regard to everything.

original: gang la don yod pa de la 'di ni shes pa'i rnam pa ma yin no zhe na dogs par 'gyur yang skra shad la sogs pa dang / ser po la sogs pa snang ba don dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i sems pa ni rnam pa gnyis dang myong ba nyid grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang la don yod pa de la 'di ni shes pa'i rnam pa ma yin no zhe na dogs par 'gyur yang skra shad la sogs pa dang / ser po la sogs pa snang ba don dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i sems pa ni rnam pa gnyis dang myong ba nyid grub pa kho na'o //
translated: If you think that where there is an object, there is no form of consciousness, then the consciousness of a nonexistent object, such as a double moon or a falling hair, or the consciousness of a real object, such as yellow as a real object, is established as having two aspects and as experience.

original: de la rnam par shes pa ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid mngon sum @70a * //üîΩgyis gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid mngon sum @70a * // gyis gnod pa yin no //
translated: The fact that consciousness is hidden is established by perception.

original: des na dpe mthong bas na 'brel pa 'dzin to //
analyzed: des na dpe mthong bas na 'brel pa 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, the example is seen and the connection is grasped.

original: des na de lta bur snang ngo zhes de'i sgo nas byung ba'i nges pa ji ltar don gyi yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na de lta bur snang ngo zhes de'i sgo nas byung ba'i nges pa ji ltar don gyi yin par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, it appears in that way. How can that be the object?

original: thams cad du rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar nges pa yin pa'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid grub po //
analyzed: thams cad du rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar nges pa yin pa'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid grub po //
translated: Because consciousness itself is ascertained in that way in all cases, the existence of aspects is established.

original: yul shes pa la snang ba tsam du nges pa'i rang bzhin de nyid de'i shes pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yul shes pa la snang ba tsam du nges pa'i rang bzhin de nyid de'i shes pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the object is ascertained as mere appearance in consciousness. That itself is the nature of that consciousness.

original: 'on te brgya la der yang don nyid yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te brgya la der yang don nyid yod pa yin te /
translated: But if it is the case that the universal exists even when there is no manifestation,

original: gal te gsal ba med kyang rigs nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba med kyang rigs nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then even when there is no manifestation, the universal itself would exist.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: sngo sogs tha dad can snang phyir//
analyzed: sngo sogs tha dad can snang phyir//
translated: Because blue, etc., appear as different,

original: de ldan min rig don ma yin //
analyzed: de ldan min rig don ma yin //
translated: the universal is not the object of non-conceptual cognition.

original: rigs de 'ang mi rtag mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: rigs de 'ang mi rtag mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: Moreover, the universal would not be impermanent or changing,

original: rtag na 'ang ji ltar skyed byed yin //
analyzed: rtag na 'ang ji ltar skyed byed yin //
translated: and even if it were permanent, how could it be a producer?

original: rigs ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The universal is not the nature of blue, etc.,

original: kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is empty of the aspects of color, etc.

original: rgyu nyid kyi phyir dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir yang rigs ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyi phyir dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir yang rigs ma yin no //
translated: It is not a universal because it is a cause and because it is impermanent.

original: 'on te rtag pa yin na skyed par byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te rtag pa yin na skyed par byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is permanent, it cannot be a producer,

original: rtag pa ni skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: rtag pa ni skyed par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because a permanent thing is not a producer.

original: ming sogs sngar ni bkag zin to //
analyzed: ming sogs sngar ni bkag zin to //
translated: The name, etc., have already been refuted earlier.

original: tshul 'di don ldan ma yin te //
analyzed: tshul 'di don ldan ma yin te //
translated: This method is not meaningful,

original: 'dod pa tsam dang rjes 'brel phyir //
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam dang rjes 'brel phyir //
translated: because it is connected only with what is desired.

original: don gyi nus pa grub ma yin //
analyzed: don gyi nus pa grub ma yin //
translated: The potency of the object does not exist.

original: 'di thams cad ni sngar bstan zin pas yang mi spro'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni sngar bstan zin pas yang mi spro'o //
translated: Since all of this has already been explained, I will not elaborate further.

original: rnam pa 'di 'dra'i shes pa ni //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di 'dra'i shes pa ni //
translated: A cognition with such an aspect

original: dran yin de yang myong las 'byung //
analyzed: dran yin de yang myong las 'byung //
translated: Is memory, and that arises from experience.

original: de yang don rnams stong na de //
analyzed: de yang don rnams stong na de //
translated: If the object is empty,

original: de na ji ltar de ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de na ji ltar de ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be like that?

original: nyams su myong ba las skye ba'i dran pa don med par 'gyur ba ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang lhan cig par 'gyur /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba las skye ba'i dran pa don med par 'gyur ba ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang lhan cig par 'gyur /
translated: How could memory, which arises from experience, be concomitant with the aspect of blue, etc., since it would be meaningless?

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi dran pa ni don nyid las 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi dran pa ni don nyid las 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that memory, which has that aspect, arises from the object itself,

original: de la bshad pa /
analyzed: de la bshad pa /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: de tshe med phyir don las min //
analyzed: de tshe med phyir don las min //
translated: It is not from the object, because it does not exist at that time.

original: de ltar myong la'ang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar myong la'ang der 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be like that even with respect to experience.

original: gal te don las dngos su dran pa 'byung na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te don las dngos su dran pa 'byung na de'i tshe /
translated: If memory actually arises from the object, then at that time

original: don de de nyid kyi tshe yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: don de de nyid kyi tshe yod par 'gyur na /
translated: the object would exist.

original: de'i tshe yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But at that time it does not exist.

original: 'on te don chod pa las kyang de'i rnam pa can gyi dran pa 'byung na nyams su myong yang de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te don chod pa las kyang de'i rnam pa can gyi dran pa 'byung na nyams su myong yang de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if memory of the aspect of that object arises from the object that is apprehended, then even though it is experienced, it would be just as it was before.

original: de ltar ji ltar 'gyur ba yang bstan zin pa nyid la /
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar 'gyur ba yang bstan zin pa nyid la /
translated: And how that is so has already been explained,

original: 'dir yang ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang ston pa yin no //
translated: and it will be explained again here.

original: rnam pa de ni don gyi min //
analyzed: rnam pa de ni don gyi min //
translated: That aspect is not of the object,

original: gsal ba'i rnam pas dben phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rnam pas dben phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of the aspect of the object.

original: don @70b de ni gsal ba'i rnam par nyams su myong bas bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: don @70b de ni gsal ba'i rnam par nyams su myong bas bzung ba yin no //
translated: The object is apprehended by the experience of the aspect of the object.

original: gal te de yang don gyi rnam pa yin na ni de de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de yang don gyi rnam pa yin na ni de de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is also the aspect of the object, then it would be just as it was before.

original: 'on te dran pas rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dran pas rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar snang ngo zhe na /
translated: But if it is present as it appears because it is understood by memory,

original: de lta na 'o na nyams su myong bas rtogs pa'i phyir gsal ba yin pas rnam pa de don gyi yin pa na nam yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na nyams su myong bas rtogs pa'i phyir gsal ba yin pas rnam pa de don gyi yin pa na nam yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then in that case, since it is understood by experience, it is clear, and therefore that aspect is not of the object.

original: rnam pa de ni tha dad na //
analyzed: rnam pa de ni tha dad na //
translated: If that aspect is different,

original: gzhan gyis de bzhin rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de bzhin rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: then another would understand it in the same way.

original: gal te 'di don yin na gzhan gyis kyang shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di don yin na gzhan gyis kyang shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is an object, then others would also know it.

original: 'on te de ni bdag la 'brel pa nyid las gzhan la mi snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni bdag la 'brel pa nyid las gzhan la mi snang ngo zhe na /
translated: But if it is related to the self, it does not appear to others.

original: bdag la 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /
analyzed: bdag la 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúrelated to the self‚Äù?

original: ci bdag gi 'bras bu 'am 'on te de'i bdag nyid /
analyzed: ci bdag gi 'bras bu 'am 'on te de'i bdag nyid /
translated: Is it the effect of the self, or is it the self of that?

original: gal te 'bras bu yin na de'i tshe gzhan la snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu yin na de'i tshe gzhan la snang ba nyid do //
translated: If it is the effect, then it appears to others.

original: 'bras bu nyid kyis ni thun mong ba nyid dang 'bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid kyis ni thun mong ba nyid dang 'bral ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is not common because it is an effect.

original: 'on te de'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: But if it is the self of that,

original: de lta yin na ni myong ba'i bdag nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni myong ba'i bdag nyid kho na'o //
translated: then it is the self of experience.

original: bdag la rtag tu 'brel yin na ;
analyzed: bdag la rtag tu 'brel yin na ;
translated: If it is always related to the self,

original: ; brjod kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ; brjod kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be known even if it were expressed.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin na ni rtag tu bdag la 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin na ni rtag tu bdag la 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is the self of that, it is always related to the self, not to others.

original: de lta yin dang brjod kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang brjod kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would not be known even if it were expressed.

original: 'on te rtogs na ni de'i tshe de lta ma yin par yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te rtogs na ni de'i tshe de lta ma yin par yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is understood, then at that time it is not understood as it is.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa ni gzhan gyis brjod kyang rtogs la ma brjod kyang rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa ni gzhan gyis brjod kyang rtogs la ma brjod kyang rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, external form, etc. is understood when it is described by another, and is understood when it is not described by another.

original: 'on te brjod pas rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te brjod pas rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if that which is understood through description is different,

original: de lta na 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na /
translated: then in that case,

original: re re dag dang 'brel na ni mtshams sbyor ba rjes su sbyor bar byed pa ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: re re dag dang 'brel na ni mtshams sbyor ba rjes su sbyor bar byed pa ni mi rung ngo //
translated: if it is related to each, it is not proper that it is the connector and the one that connects.

original: mtshams sbyor ba ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the connector?üîΩIt is said:

original: bshad pa ; don gcig mngon zhe na bdag nyid can //
analyzed: bshad pa ; don gcig mngon zhe na bdag nyid can //
translated: It has the nature of the same object.

original: 'di ni gcig go zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni gcig go zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not understood that this is one,

original: de so so nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de so so nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is individual.

original: gang dag gi mtshams sbyor ba zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gi mtshams sbyor ba zhe na /
translated: What is the connector?üîΩOf the hearer and the mind that is cut off,

original: chad po nyan po sems dag gi / sems de gnyis ni don tha dad par 'gyur ba 'dzin pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chad po nyan po sems dag gi / sems de gnyis ni don tha dad par 'gyur ba 'dzin pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those two minds engage in apprehending as different objects.

original: gal te 'dra bas de gcig par //
analyzed: gal te 'dra bas de gcig par //
translated: If it is one through similarity,

original: tha snyad yin na der snang min //
analyzed: tha snyad yin na der snang min //
translated: If it is a convention, then it does not appear as that.

original: tha dad bdag nyid ji ltar bzung //
analyzed: tha dad bdag nyid ji ltar bzung //
translated: How can one apprehend a different nature?

original: de tshe blo don med can 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe blo don med can 'gyur //
translated: At that time, the cognition would be meaningless.

original: 'dra bas gcig tu tha snyad byed pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba dag nyid las yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra bas gcig tu tha snyad byed pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba dag nyid las yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: That which is conventionally designated as one on the basis of similarity is due to the mere seeing of those, not otherwise.

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba ni nam yang ma mthong bar /üîΩde @71a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba ni nam yang ma mthong bar / de @71a * //
translated: The seeing of others is never seen.üîΩHow can that

original: ji ltar gcig tha snyad byed /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig tha snyad byed /
translated: be designated as one?

original: 'dir phan tshun dben pa'i don snang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir phan tshun dben pa'i don snang ba nyid yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of mutual exclusion appears.

original: 'on te 'bras bu dngos por 'gyur ba yin pa des na /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu dngos por 'gyur ba yin pa des na /
translated: But if the effect becomes an entity,

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs pa nyid kyis 'di ni gcig go zhes bya ba rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs pa nyid kyis 'di ni gcig go zhes bya ba rtogs so zhe na /
translated: then by following that, one understands that this is one.

original: de lta na 'o na ma brjod par yang rang gis rtogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ma brjod par yang rang gis rtogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs te /
translated: If that is so, then even without being stated, one would understand by oneself,

original: gzhan la gnas pa yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la gnas pa yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and one would understand what is based on others.

original: gal te bdag gis kyang 'di ltar rtogs so zhes mi brjod par yang ngo //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis kyang 'di ltar rtogs so zhes mi brjod par yang ngo //
translated: Even if one does not say I also understand in this way,üîΩone would understand by oneself.

original: gang gi tshe mi bden brjod pa de'i tshe don med par ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi bden brjod pa de'i tshe don med par ji ltar rtogs /
translated: When it is not true, how is it understood to be meaningless?

original: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is seen to be just like that.

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe blo don med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe blo don med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: But in that case, the mind would be meaningless.

original: ji ltar gzhan la snang ba med par gzhan la snang bar nges pa'i blor 'gyur ba de bzhin du don snang ba med par don gyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir shes pa rnam pa dang ldan par grub po //üîΩgal te yongs su brtags pas sam /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan la snang ba med par gzhan la snang bar nges pa'i blor 'gyur ba de bzhin du don snang ba med par don gyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir shes pa rnam pa dang ldan par grub po // gal te yongs su brtags pas sam /
translated: Just as it is ascertained that one thing appears to another without the appearance of the other, so it is established that consciousness has an aspect because the appearance of the object is the transformation of the object.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis dran pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'ga' zhig rnam pa dang bcas pa yin yang thams cad yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis dran pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'ga' zhig rnam pa dang bcas pa yin yang thams cad yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is ascertained that some consciousnesses such as memory have aspects because they are investigated or because they are powerful valid knowledges that invalidate them, how can it be said that all consciousnesses have aspects?üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / nyams myong rnam shes de yang ni //
analyzed: bshad pa / nyams myong rnam shes de yang ni //
translated: That consciousness which has an experience

original: cha gnyis la ni brten gyur pa //
analyzed: cha gnyis la ni brten gyur pa //
translated: depends on two parts.

original: rnam pa gcig gis khyad par can //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis khyad par can //
translated: The object is the special part

original: de shes pa yi dmigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de shes pa yi dmigs par 'gyur //
translated: that is the object of that consciousness.

original: dran pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa sngon po la sogs pa'i yul can gyi nyams su myong ba'i rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: dran pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa sngon po la sogs pa'i yul can gyi nyams su myong ba'i rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The experience of the object blue, which is not of the nature of memory, is the object of the second cognition, which is of the nature of memory.

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa gnyis pa dran pa'i rang bzhin gyis dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa gnyis pa dran pa'i rang bzhin gyis dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: The second cognition, which is of the nature of memory, is the object of the first cognition, which is not of the nature of memory.

original: rjes su 'brang bar byed cing nges par 'dzin par byed do ;
analyzed: rjes su 'brang bar byed cing nges par 'dzin par byed do ;
translated: It follows and ascertains the first cognition.

original: / ji lta bur gyur pa zhig gis she na /
analyzed: / ji lta bur gyur pa zhig gis she na /
translated: In what way?

original: cha gnyis pa brten par 'gyur pas de sngon por snang ba'i shes pa byung bar gyur to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cha gnyis pa brten par 'gyur pas de sngon por snang ba'i shes pa byung bar gyur to zhes bya'o //
translated: The second part is supported by the first part, and so it is said that the cognition that appears as blue has arisen.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de gzhan dag gis don gyis go ba'i sgo nas nges pa ni ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang de lta bur gyur pa 'ga' zhig rjes su 'brangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de gzhan dag gis don gyis go ba'i sgo nas nges pa ni ma yin gyi / 'on kyang de lta bur gyur pa 'ga' zhig rjes su 'brangs pa yin no //
translated: That which is of that nature is not ascertained by way of inference, but rather by way of memory.

original: don gyis go bar ni 'jig rten pa 'ga' la yang skye ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyis go bar ni 'jig rten pa 'ga' la yang skye ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the ascertainment of the object of the first cognition arises for anyone by way of inference, but rather it is ascertained by way of memory.

original: 'jig rten na gang gis na don mthong ba des na nga la blo gzhan yod do zhes 'di ltar rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na gang gis na don mthong ba des na nga la blo gzhan yod do zhes 'di ltar rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: In the world, when one sees an object, one does not think, ‚ÄúI see the mind of another.‚Äù

original: don gyis go ba de ni blo'o //üîΩrang bzhin rtogs par byed min te //
analyzed: don gyis go ba de ni blo'o // rang bzhin rtogs par byed min te //
translated: The mind is understood through the object.üîΩThe nature of the mind is not understood.üîΩThe nature of the mind is not understood through the object.

original: de yi rang bzhin ma rtogs @71b par ;
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin ma rtogs @71b par ;
translated: The nature of the object is not understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.

original: / rtogs par byed par nus ma yin //üîΩgzugs la sogs par snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i blo'i rnam pa gzhan ni 'ga' yang don gyis go 'am /
analyzed: / rtogs par byed par nus ma yin // gzugs la sogs par snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i blo'i rnam pa gzhan ni 'ga' yang don gyis go 'am /
translated: The mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.

original: gzhan gyis nges par nus pa ma yin no //üîΩrtogs pa'i rang bzhin du nges so zhe na /üîΩrtogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid mi shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis nges par nus pa ma yin no // rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du nges so zhe na / rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid mi shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: The mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.üîΩThe mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.

original: rkyen tha dad pas ni khams kyi don tha dad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen tha dad pas ni khams kyi don tha dad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The mind is not understood through the object, nor is the object understood through the mind.

original: rkyen gyi don yang tha dad pa ma yin te /üîΩkte na dang gha nya'i don tha dad pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen gyi don yang tha dad pa ma yin te /üîΩkte na dang gha nya'i don tha dad pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is not understood through

original: don tha dad pa ci ltar nges de 'chad pa la 'jug / de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa ma gtogs pa dang blo zhes bya ba rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: don tha dad pa ci ltar nges de 'chad pa la 'jug / de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa ma gtogs pa dang blo zhes bya ba rtogs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, apart from blue and so on, there is no so-called cognition.

original: sngon po la sogs pa de nyid rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis de skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa de nyid rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis de skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: It is just that blue and so on are called that by virtue of their specific attributes.

original: sngon po'i blo 'am sngon po'i yul can gyi blo zhe'o //
analyzed: sngon po'i blo 'am sngon po'i yul can gyi blo zhe'o //
translated: It is a cognition of blue or a cognition that has blue as its object.

original: des na sngon po'i yul can gyi blo nga la 'byung ngo zhes rtogs pa yang de'i rnam pa nyid rjes su rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sngon po'i yul can gyi blo nga la 'byung ngo zhes rtogs pa yang de'i rnam pa nyid rjes su rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when it is understood that the cognition of blue arises in me, that is the understanding of its aspect.

original: 'di ltar / sngon po las ni tha dad du //üîΩsngon po'i yul can shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sngon po las ni tha dad du // sngon po'i yul can shes pa ni //
translated: Thus:üîΩThe cognition of blue is not seen

original: phyi ma'i shes pa'i mthong med de //
analyzed: phyi ma'i shes pa'i mthong med de //
translated: by a subsequent cognition of blue,üîΩbecause they are different.

original: tha dad rtogs pa'i blos sprul yin //
analyzed: tha dad rtogs pa'i blos sprul yin //
translated: The cognition that apprehends difference is imagined.

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid blo zhes tha dad par bsnyad pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid blo zhes tha dad par bsnyad pa yin na /
translated: If the nature of blue and so on is called cognition, it is designated as different.

original: 'o na ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'o na ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: In that case, it is just blue and so on alone.

original: blo zhes bya ba ni med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo zhes bya ba ni med par 'gyur te /
translated: The so-called cognition would not exist,

original: dper na snam bu las tha dad pa'i dkar po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na snam bu las tha dad pa'i dkar po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just like the whiteness, etc., that are different from the cloth.

original: des na blo nyid don dam pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na blo nyid don dam pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that cognition itself is not ultimate.

original: 'dod pa ni phyi rol gyi don dam pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni phyi rol gyi don dam pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you accept that, then the external object is not ultimate.üîΩThat is not tenable,

original: de ni de ltar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni de ltar mi rung ste /
translated: because it is said:

original: 'de ltar / la lar 'ga' zhig la brten nas //
analyzed: 'de ltar / la lar 'ga' zhig la brten nas //
translated: In some cases, based on some,

original: 'ga' zhig nyid ni 'gog par byed //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig nyid ni 'gog par byed //
translated: some are refuted.

original: tshad mas grub 'gyur gang yin pa //
analyzed: tshad mas grub 'gyur gang yin pa //
translated: Based on what is established by valid cognition,

original: de la brten nas gzhan 'gog 'gyur //
analyzed: de la brten nas gzhan 'gog 'gyur //
translated: the other is refuted.

original: gal te don tshad mas grub ni de'i tshe de las ma gtogs pa'i blo gzhan med do zhes blo yongs su dor bar bya'o //üîΩde ste blo tshad mas grub pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te don tshad mas grub ni de'i tshe de las ma gtogs pa'i blo gzhan med do zhes blo yongs su dor bar bya'o // de ste blo tshad mas grub pa yin na /
translated: If the object is established by valid cognition, then, based on that, the cognition that is different from it does not exist.

original: de'i tshe ni dor bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni dor bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But if the cognition is established by valid cognition, then it is not to be rejected.

original: de la re zhig don ni blos rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de la re zhig don ni blos rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir na /
translated: In that regard, first, the object is posited by the cognition.

original: don dang ldan pas ni blo dor bar mi nus so //
analyzed: don dang ldan pas ni blo dor bar mi nus so //
translated: But since it is meaningful, it cannot be rejected.

original: blo dang ldan pas ni don gyi thabs kyis blo bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas ni don gyi thabs kyis blo bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The wise do not establish the existence of cognition by means of the object.

original: rang rig pas grub pa'i @72a * //
analyzed: rang rig pas grub pa'i @72a * //
translated: Because it is established by reflexive awareness.

original: phyir ro ; / des na don med kyang khas blangs par nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyir ro ; / des na don med kyang khas blangs par nus pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, even though the object does not exist, it can be accepted.

original: de'i phyir blo khas blangs nas de las gzhan pa'i don yongs su dor ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo khas blangs nas de las gzhan pa'i don yongs su dor ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, having accepted cognition, one should reject the object that is different from it.

original: 'on te don yang rang rig pas bsgrub pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te don yang rang rig pas bsgrub pa yin na /
translated: But if the object is also established by reflexive awareness,

original: de lta na de myong ba nyid yin gyi don tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na de myong ba nyid yin gyi don tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then it is just the experience of that, not a separate object.

original: don ni ma mthong yang yod pa yin pa'i phyir ma dmigs pas de don dor bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: don ni ma mthong yang yod pa yin pa'i phyir ma dmigs pas de don dor bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Even though the object is not seen, it exists, so it is not to be rejected because it is not observed.

original: blo ni de lta ma yin pas dor bar bya ba ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang dkar po las ni tha dad pa'i //
analyzed: blo ni de lta ma yin pas dor bar bya ba ma yin no // gzhan yang dkar po las ni tha dad pa'i //
translated: But cognition is not like that, so it is not to be rejected.üîΩMoreover, it is said:üîΩThe substance that is different from white

original: rdzas ni med par rab brjod pa'i //üîΩde bzhin blo las ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: rdzas ni med par rab brjod pa'i // de bzhin blo las ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: Does not exist.üîΩIn the same way, it is said:

original: don med par ni rab tu brjod /
analyzed: don med par ni rab tu brjod /
translated: The object that is different from cognition does not exist.

original: 'di ltar / skad cig nyid sogs ji ltar yang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / skad cig nyid sogs ji ltar yang //
translated: Thus:

original: sngo sogs las ni gzhan yod min //
analyzed: sngo sogs las ni gzhan yod min //
translated: The momentariness, etc. of blue, etc. is not different from blue, etc.

original: de ltar na yang skad cig nyid //
analyzed: de ltar na yang skad cig nyid //
translated: And in that case, momentariness

original: dngos med par ni gsal ma yin //
analyzed: dngos med par ni gsal ma yin //
translated: is not clearly manifest without a thing.

original: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid blo yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid blo yin te /
translated: Therefore, the aspect of blue, etc. is itself cognition,

original: blo gzhan gyis de ltar nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gzhan gyis de ltar nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because another cognition ascertains it in that way.

original: des na cha gnyis ka spangs nas ni blo dmigs pa med pa nyid pas na /
analyzed: des na cha gnyis ka spangs nas ni blo dmigs pa med pa nyid pas na /
translated: Thus, having abandoned both parts, cognition itself is without an object.

original: de ji ltar rnam pa gnyis ma yin //
analyzed: de ji ltar rnam pa gnyis ma yin //
translated: So how can it be twofold?

original: yang na blo ni rnam pa gcig gis khyad par can shes pa gnyis pas dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na blo ni rnam pa gcig gis khyad par can shes pa gnyis pas dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Or, cognition, qualified by a single aspect, is observed by a second cognition,

original: rnam pa gcig gis dmigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis dmigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which has the meaning of ‚Äúit is observed by a single aspect.‚Äù

original: ji lta bur gyur pa'i rnam pa gcig gang gis she na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa'i rnam pa gcig gang gis she na /
translated: What kind of single aspect? By what?

original: de smras pa ni cha gnyis po la ni rten gyur pa ste cha gnyi ga khyab pas so //
analyzed: de smras pa ni cha gnyis po la ni rten gyur pa ste cha gnyi ga khyab pas so //
translated: That is said: it is the basis of the two parts, pervading both parts.

original: de nyid kyi phyir cha gnyis su rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir cha gnyis su rtogs pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is cognized as two parts.

original: don dam par ni rnam pa gnyis po de dang / rnam pa gcig po de rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir na des khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni rnam pa gnyis po de dang / rnam pa gcig po de rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir na des khyab pa yin no //
translated: In the ultimate sense, it is pervaded by the two aspects and the one aspect because they are included in it.

original: rnam pa gnyis po de dag kyang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dang sngon po'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis po de dag kyang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dang sngon po'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The two aspects are the nature of realization and the aspect of blue.

original: bshad pa snga ma ni rnam pa gcig gis khyad par can rnam pa gcig gis lhag pa zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa snga ma ni rnam pa gcig gis khyad par can rnam pa gcig gis lhag pa zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The former explanation should be understood as one aspect being distinguished by the other aspect.

original: gal te rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa de lta bu yang rnam pa gnyis nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa de lta bu yang rnam pa gnyis nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If that kind of twofold classification is twofold, how can it be one?

original: 'di la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: gzhan du de rnams can min na //
analyzed: gzhan du de rnams can min na //
translated: If it is not the nature of those,

original: ji ltar shes la gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar shes la gnas par 'gyur //
translated: how can it be known to exist?

original: gal te bdag nyid de'i rnam par rang rig pas ma myong na ni de'i tshe shes pa la de'i rnam pa can du dran pas gnas par byed /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid de'i rnam par rang rig pas ma myong na ni de'i tshe shes pa la de'i rnam pa can du dran pas gnas par byed /
translated: If it is not experienced by reflexive awareness in the aspect of that, then at that time memory of the aspect of that in consciousness would not exist.

original: gnas par byed pa ni de'i rnam pa nyid du shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa ni de'i rnam pa nyid du shes par byed pa'o //
translated: To exist is to be known as that aspect.

original: der rnam par byed do zhes bya ba ga las she na /
analyzed: der rnam par byed do zhes bya ba ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that it is analyzed there?

original: de bzhin @72b nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar phyi ma phyi ma yi //
analyzed: de bzhin @72b nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar phyi ma phyi ma yi //
translated: Because it is realized as suchness.üîΩThe latter consciousnesses

original: shes pa rnam gcig lhag pa nyid //
analyzed: shes pa rnam gcig lhag pa nyid //
translated: are distinguished by having one more aspect.

original: gdon mi za bar 'di ltar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'di ltar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: This must be understood.

original: 'di ltar phyi ma phyi ma dag rnam pa re res lhag pa lhag par 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi ma phyi ma dag rnam pa re res lhag pa lhag par 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The latter consciousnesses are distinguished by having one more aspect, but not by anything else.

original: 'di ltar / snga mas ni sngon po 'dzin no //üîΩde'i phyi mas ni sngon po shes pa'o //üîΩde'i phyi mas ni sngon po shes pa shes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar / snga mas ni sngon po 'dzin no // de'i phyi mas ni sngon po shes pa'o // de'i phyi mas ni sngon po shes pa shes pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the first consciousness apprehends blue.üîΩThe second consciousness is the consciousness of blue.üîΩThe third consciousness is the consciousness of the consciousness of blue.

original: de'i phyi mas kyang de la lhag pa'o zhes nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyi mas kyang de la lhag pa'o zhes nges pa yin te /
translated: The fourth consciousness is the consciousness of that.

original: des na 'dis gzhan du ni 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dis gzhan du ni 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is definite that it is not otherwise.

original: 'di nyid dpes ston par byed pa ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid dpes ston par byed pa ni //
translated: This is also taught by an example:üîΩThe two are distinguished by the nature of the object,

original: don gyi ngo bos rnam gnyis dang // bdag gi rnam pa 'ga' zhig tu //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bos rnam gnyis dang // bdag gi rnam pa 'ga' zhig tu //
translated: and by a certain aspect of the self.

original: gnyis pa de ni gsum pa yi //
analyzed: gnyis pa de ni gsum pa yi //
translated: The second is realized by the third

original: shes pa yis ni rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes pa yis ni rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: consciousness.

original: shes pa gnyis pa ni rnam par shes pa snga ma'i rnam pa gnyis dang / rang gi rnam pa gsum pas rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: shes pa gnyis pa ni rnam par shes pa snga ma'i rnam pa gnyis dang / rang gi rnam pa gsum pas rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: The second cognition is cognized by the aspect of the prior cognition, by its own three aspects, and by the third aspect.

original: bzhi bas ni gsum po de nyid rnam pa gcig gis lhag pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi bas ni gsum po de nyid rnam pa gcig gis lhag pa ste /
translated: The fourth cognition cognizes the three cognitions by means of one aspect.

original: ji ltar brtsi ba dang / dran par nus kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar brtsi ba dang / dran par nus kyi bar du'o //
translated: This is how it is possible to count and remember.

original: 'on te gnyis pas shes pa 'ba' zhig shes pa yin no //üîΩde la shes pa ni don la byed pa yin pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gnyis pas shes pa 'ba' zhig shes pa yin no // de la shes pa ni don la byed pa yin pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: But if the second cognition cognizes only the cognition,üîΩthen the cognition is the object of the second cognition because it is related to it.

original: des na de dran pa na med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir don de yang dran pa yin te /
analyzed: des na de dran pa na med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir don de yang dran pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, when the second cognition remembers the first, it remembers the object because the object is invariably related to the cognition.

original: des na gzhan du shes pa dran par mi nus pas na de ltar dran pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhan du shes pa dran par mi nus pas na de ltar dran pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the second cognition remembers the object because it cannot remember the cognition as something other than the object.

original: des na de la byed pa nyid kyis na 'khrul pas de'i rnam pa'o zhes bsdoms pas /
analyzed: des na de la byed pa nyid kyis na 'khrul pas de'i rnam pa'o zhes bsdoms pas /
translated: Therefore, the second cognition is said to have the aspect of the object because it is related to the object.üîΩBut if the second cognition has the aspect of the object, then it is a conceptual cognition because it has an aspect.

original: de'i rnam par rtog pa yin no zhe na 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i rnam par rtog pa yin no zhe na 'di la bshad pa /
translated: To explain this, the text says:

original: don 'bras nyid kyis shes dran na //
analyzed: don 'bras nyid kyis shes dran na //
translated: If the object is remembered by the result of the cognition,

original: don bral phyir na 'khrul pa yis //üîΩgal te sre na snang ba dang // yid byed la yang de 'gyur ro ;üîΩ;'khrul pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //üîΩgal te shes pa don gyi 'bras bu nyid dam /
analyzed: don bral phyir na 'khrul pa yis // gal te sre na snang ba dang // yid byed la yang de 'gyur ro ; ;'khrul pa zhes bya bar 'brel to // gal te shes pa don gyi 'bras bu nyid dam /
translated: Because of the absence of an object, there is error.üîΩIf you think that the object is the effect of consciousness,

original: yang na don la bya ba byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na don la bya ba byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: or that it is the cause of consciousness,

original: de'i phyir shes pa dran pa na gdon mi za bar don dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa dran pa na gdon mi za bar don dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, when consciousness remembers, it must also remember the object.

original: des na des blo rmongs pa'i rgyud can dag de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na des blo rmongs pa'i rgyud can dag de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, those whose minds are confused by this think that it is so.

original: de lta na ni 'o na snang ba dang yid la byed pa dag la yang de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na snang ba dang yid la byed pa dag la yang de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then you would also have to think that the object and mental activity are the cause of consciousness.

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa la yul gyi 'bras bu yin pa de bzhin du snang ba dang yid la byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa la yul gyi 'bras bu yin pa de bzhin du snang ba dang yid la byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
translated: Just as consciousness is the effect of the object, so the object is the effect of consciousness.

original: des na gnyis la yang bsdoms nas rtogs par 'gyur te /üîΩ'bras bu nyid du ni khyad @73a * //
analyzed: des na gnyis la yang bsdoms nas rtogs par 'gyur te / 'bras bu nyid du ni khyad @73a * //
translated: Therefore, you would have to think that both are the cause of consciousness.

original: par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no difference at all in their being the effect of consciousness.

original: 'on te yul la byed pa yin pa'i phyir de sdom pa yin gyi yid la byed pa ni ma yin te /üîΩde la byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yul la byed pa yin pa'i phyir de sdom pa yin gyi yid la byed pa ni ma yin te / de la byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then the mind would not be a restraint because it does not act on the object.

original: 'o na de'i tshe snang ba la yang byed par mtshungs pa yin te snang ba med par ni gzugs la byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe snang ba la yang byed par mtshungs pa yin te snang ba med par ni gzugs la byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But at that time, the mind is similar to the eye sense faculty in acting on the object, because form is not acted on in the absence of light.

original: des na de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore that is illogical.

original: des na ji ltar snang ba snang ngo zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzugs snang ngo zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ji ltar snang ba snang ngo zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzugs snang ngo zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as it is said that light is seen, so it is said that form is seen.

original: 'on te snang ba ni yul gyi khongs su 'du ba'i phyir gzugs snang bar nges pa nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snang ba ni yul gyi khongs su 'du ba'i phyir gzugs snang bar nges pa nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that light is definitely understood because it is included in the object,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: snang ba ni gsal byed yin pa nyid kyis na yul ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar de la byed pa yin /
analyzed: snang ba ni gsal byed yin pa nyid kyis na yul ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar de la byed pa yin /
translated: Since light is a revealing agent, how can it act on the object?

original: 'on te snang ba gsal byed yin yang gzugs la nges pa'i phyir gzugs nyid du gyur pa des na yul yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snang ba gsal byed yin yang gzugs la nges pa'i phyir gzugs nyid du gyur pa des na yul yin no zhe na /
translated: But even if the appearance is the illuminator, it is form because it is ascertained as form. Therefore, it is the object.

original: de lta yin na gsal bar byed pa'i shes pa yang gzugs la 'jug pa'i phyir gzugs nyid yin pas snang ba rnam pa dang bcas pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang rnam pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na gsal bar byed pa'i shes pa yang gzugs la 'jug pa'i phyir gzugs nyid yin pas snang ba rnam pa dang bcas pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang rnam pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then consciousness, which is the illuminator, would also be form because it engages form. Therefore, just as the appearance has an aspect, consciousness would also have an aspect.

original: ji ltar gzugs med par snang ba gzung bar mi nus pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs med par snang ba gzung bar mi nus pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang yin no //
translated: Just as the appearance of form cannot be apprehended without form, so it is with consciousness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i gsal bya med par ni 'gas kyang rnam par shes pa'i zhes bya ba yod par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i gsal bya med par ni 'gas kyang rnam par shes pa'i zhes bya ba yod par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: No one understands the existence of consciousness without the existence of the object of consciousness, such as form.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the aspect of form, etc., is consciousness.

original: 'bras bu nyid kyis de ltar rtogs na yang //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid kyis de ltar rtogs na yang //
translated: Even if one understands it in that way by means of the effect,

original: de bzhin 'bras bu thams cad kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin 'bras bu thams cad kyang //
translated: then in the same way, all effects

original: rgyu dang lhan cig 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu dang lhan cig 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: would be apprehended together with the cause.

original: de'i phyir rdza mkhan la sogs pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdza mkhan la sogs pa //
translated: Therefore, the memory of a pot, etc.

original: med par bum pa dran mi 'gyur //
analyzed: med par bum pa dran mi 'gyur //
translated: is not without the potter, etc.

original: rang gi rgyus dben par dran par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyus dben par dran par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not the memory of something devoid of its cause.

original: 'on te gang gis shes pa dran pa na don dran par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: 'on te gang gis shes pa dran pa na don dran par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: But if it is the case that when the cognition is remembered, the object is remembered,

original: shes pa 'dzin pa na don 'dzin par 'gyur ba shes pa don gyis byas pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yod pa yin pas na shes pa 'ga' zhig dran pa 'am 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa 'dzin pa na don 'dzin par 'gyur ba shes pa don gyis byas pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yod pa yin pas na shes pa 'ga' zhig dran pa 'am 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: or when the cognition is apprehended, the object is apprehended, because the cognition has some distinction produced by the object, then not every cognition is remembered or apprehended.üîΩBut it is apprehended as a mere pot, etc., and a mere potter, etc.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dang / rdza mkhan la sogs pa ni 'ba' zhig par yang 'dzin pa yin no zhe na de yang rang gi phyogs la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dang / rdza mkhan la sogs pa ni 'ba' zhig par yang 'dzin pa yin no zhe na de yang rang gi phyogs la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is also a fault for your own position.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / khyad par gang las shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / khyad par gang las shes pa ni //
translated: The cognition that is distinguished

original: don dang 'dre ba brten pa ste //
analyzed: don dang 'dre ba brten pa ste //
translated: is based on the contact with the object.

original: 'dra ba las gzhan cir 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'dra ba las gzhan cir 'gyur te //
translated: What else is there besides the similarity?

original: @73b mtshe ma la sogs mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: @73b mtshe ma la sogs mthong phyir ro //
translated: Because a twin, etc. is seen.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa de don gyi rnam pa can nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa don 'dzin pa dang / lhan cig tu 'dzin pa dang / dran pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di ci zhig yod /üîΩdon de nang du chud pa yin na ni nges par da 'dzin pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa de don gyi rnam pa can nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa don 'dzin pa dang / lhan cig tu 'dzin pa dang / dran pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di ci zhig yod / don de nang du chud pa yin na ni nges par da 'dzin pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa /
translated: If consciousness does not have the aspect of the object, then what is the certainty that consciousness apprehends the object, that it apprehends together with it, and that it remembers it?

original: yin pa'i phyir nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object is included in consciousness, then there is certainty because it is apprehended by the apprehension of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir don dang 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid don 'dzin pa med par mi 'dzin pa dang / de dran pa med par mi dran pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dang 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid don 'dzin pa med par mi 'dzin pa dang / de dran pa med par mi dran pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, consciousness that is like the object apprehends the object, and without that apprehension there is no memory.

original: mtshe ma dag las gcig bzung na //
analyzed: mtshe ma dag las gcig bzung na //
translated: When one twin is apprehended,

original: de las gzhan snang ba dang / de nyid 'di'o zhes dran par mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: de las gzhan snang ba dang / de nyid 'di'o zhes dran par mthong ba yin la /
translated: the other is seen to be the one that is not apprehended and is remembered as ‚Äúthat one.‚Äù

original: sngon po'i shing gi rnam pa nyid kyis shing bzung bar mngon par rlom pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po'i shing gi rnam pa nyid kyis shing bzung bar mngon par rlom pa yin no //
translated: One infers the tree from the aspect of the tree that is blue.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa dang po gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa dang po gnyi ga'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: If the first consciousness does not have the nature of both,

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig du zad na de gnyis pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig du zad na de gnyis pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were only the form of the apprehending subject, then the second moment would be the same.üîΩAt that time,

original: de'i tshe / dang po rang bzhin gnyis yin na //
analyzed: de'i tshe / dang po rang bzhin gnyis yin na //
translated: the first is of two natures,

original: gnyis pa rang bzhin gcig la ni //üîΩrnam gnas nges par 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: gnyis pa rang bzhin gcig la ni // rnam gnas nges par 'dzin pa yi //
translated: but the second is of one nature.üîΩThe mind that definitely apprehends

original: sems kyis 'byed par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: sems kyis 'byed par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: does not distinguish them.

original: nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis te //
analyzed: nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis te //
translated: The mind that definitely apprehends

original: gnyis pa nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis gnyis pa dang po las tha dad par rnam par 'jog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis gnyis pa dang po las tha dad par rnam par 'jog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the second moment does not establish the second as different from the first.

original: gang gi phyir de yang de'i tshe nyams su myong ba dang po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de yang de'i tshe nyams su myong ba dang po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba na /
translated: Because at that time, the second would be of the nature of the first experience.

original: rang bzhin gcig nyid las rnam par gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig nyid las rnam par gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: It would be distinguished only by the form of the apprehending subject.üîΩTherefore, from what would it be definitely distinguished?

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig go zhes bya ba'i don te des na gang las tha dad par nges des na rnam par shes pa ni yul gyi rnam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig go zhes bya ba'i don te des na gang las tha dad par nges des na rnam par shes pa ni yul gyi rnam pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, consciousness is only the form of the object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: For that very reason,

original: de phyir sngo sogs ngo bo ru //
analyzed: de phyir sngo sogs ngo bo ru //
translated: Therefore, the nature of blue, etc.

original: mdun na gnas par gyur ba'i blo //
analyzed: mdun na gnas par gyur ba'i blo //
translated: The cognition that is present before it

original: don sre ba dang 'brel pa can //
analyzed: don sre ba dang 'brel pa can //
translated: is related to the designation of the object.

original: blo gnyis pas ni dmigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: blo gnyis pas ni dmigs par 'gyur //
translated: The second cognition is the one that perceives it.üîΩThe first cognition is related to the second cognition, because it has the aspect of the object.

original: don gyi rnam pa can yin pa de'i phyir blo snga ma blo gnyis pas mdun du dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa can yin pa de'i phyir blo snga ma blo gnyis pas mdun du dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is related to the designation of the object, because it is related to the designation of the object.

original: don sre ba dang 'brel pas na don sre ba dang 'brel pa can te ;üîΩ'brel pas na 'brel pa 'am /
analyzed: don sre ba dang 'brel pas na don sre ba dang 'brel pa can te ; 'brel pas na 'brel pa 'am /
translated: It is related to the designation of the object, because it is related to the designation of the object.

original: 'di don sre bas 'brel par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: 'di don sre bas 'brel par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'brel ba'o //
translated: It is related to the designation of the object, because it is related to the designation of the object.

original: blo de blo gnyis pas dmigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blo de blo gnyis pas dmigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The second cognition perceives the first cognition.

original: gal te de'i rnam par gyur na ni 'ba' zhig kyang dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de'i rnam par gyur na ni 'ba' zhig kyang dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the second cognition has the aspect of the first cognition, then the first cognition would be perceived even if the second cognition did not perceive an object.

original: gal te 'ba' zhig kyang dmigs pa ma yin nam /üîΩ@74a * // 'di ltar /
analyzed: gal te 'ba' zhig kyang dmigs pa ma yin nam / @74a * // 'di ltar /
translated: But is it not the case that the first cognition is not perceived?

original: de'i tshe bdag gis ci zhig mthong ba mi shes so zhes 'dzin par byed pa nyid dran no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag gis ci zhig mthong ba mi shes so zhes 'dzin par byed pa nyid dran no zhe na /
translated: In that case, the second cognition would not remember the first cognition, because it would not have the aspect of the first cognition.

original: de yang ma yin te /üîΩgzung la the tshom za phyir der //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /üîΩgzung la the tshom za phyir der //
translated: But it is not so, because it is not the case that the second cognition does not have the aspect of the first cognition.üîΩIt is not so, because it is not the case that the second cognition does not have the aspect of the first cognition.üîΩIt is not so, because it is not the case that the second cognition does not have the aspect of the first cognition.üîΩIt is not so, because it is not the case that the second cognition does not have the aspect of the first cognition.üîΩIt is not so, because it is not the case that the second cognition does not have the aspect of the first cognition.üîΩIt is not so, because it is not the case that the second cognition does not have the aspect of the first cognition.üîΩIt is not so, because it is not the case that the second cognition does not have the aspect of the first cognition.üîΩIt is not so, because it is not the case that the second cognition does not have the aspect of the first cognition.üîΩIt is not so, because it is not the case that the second cognition does not have the aspect of the first cognition.üîΩIt is not so, because it is not the case that the second cognition does not have the aspect of the first cognition.üîΩIt is not so, because it is not the case that the second cognition does not have the aspect of the first cognition.üîΩIt is not so, because it is not the case that the second cognition does not have the aspect of the first cognition.üîΩIt is

original: 'dzin pa la yang the tshom za //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la yang the tshom za //
translated: And there is doubt about the grasping.

original: 'dzin pa der ni spyir nges na //
analyzed: 'dzin pa der ni spyir nges na //
translated: If it is ascertained in general that it is the grasping,

original: tshul 'di gzung ba la yang mtshungs //
analyzed: tshul 'di gzung ba la yang mtshungs //
translated: then this method is the same for the apprehended.

original: 'dzin pa spyir dran na tshul 'di ni gzung ba la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa spyir dran na tshul 'di ni gzung ba la yang mtshungs so //
translated: If it is remembered in general that it is the grasping, then this method is the same for the apprehended.

original: 'di ltar / bdag gis ci zhig mthong ngo zhes mthong ba spyi'i rnam par dran pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdag gis ci zhig mthong ngo zhes mthong ba spyi'i rnam par dran pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is remembered in the form of a general recollection of seeing, ‚ÄúI saw something.‚Äù

original: gal te gzung ba'i bya ba dang bral pa 'dzin par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid dran pa yin na ni de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin ni de nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba'i bya ba dang bral pa 'dzin par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid dran pa yin na ni de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin ni de nyid yin pas na /
translated: If it is remembered as the nature of the grasping that is devoid of the action of the apprehended, then at that time, since that is its nature,

original: gzung ba nye bar mi gnas na gzhan nyid du gyur pa yin no //üîΩdes na de 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gzhan gyis phyis dran pa de lta bu nyid 'dzin par byed pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: gzung ba nye bar mi gnas na gzhan nyid du gyur pa yin no // des na de 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gzhan gyis phyis dran pa de lta bu nyid 'dzin par byed pa ji ltar yin /
translated: it is different from the non-present apprehended.üîΩTherefore, how could it be the grasping that is remembered later as something else, which is not the nature of the grasping?

original: ci ste de kho na ltar dran na gzung ba dang ldan pa nyid rang bzhin yin pas de'i tshe ji ltar 'ba' zhig dran /
analyzed: ci ste de kho na ltar dran na gzung ba dang ldan pa nyid rang bzhin yin pas de'i tshe ji ltar 'ba' zhig dran /
translated: But if it is remembered just as it was, then since it is the nature of the grasping that possesses the apprehended, how could it be remembered alone at that time?

original: de'i phyir de snang ba nyid 'di ni rang bzhin yin pas rnam par dbye bas mi nus pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gcig nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de snang ba nyid 'di ni rang bzhin yin pas rnam par dbye bas mi nus pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gcig nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since this appearance is the nature of consciousness, it is not possible to divide it. Therefore, the nature of consciousness is the same as the nature of form.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa rang bzhin gnyis pa ma yin na de'i tshe dang po nyid sngon po'i rnam par 'gyur gyi phyi ma phyi ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa rang bzhin gnyis pa ma yin na de'i tshe dang po nyid sngon po'i rnam par 'gyur gyi phyi ma phyi ma ni ma yin no //
translated: If consciousness does not have a dual nature, then it would be blue in the first moment, but not in the second moment.

original: de skad du yang slob dpon gyi shes pa phyi ma phyi ma la yang snga ma snga ma'i yul snang bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon gyi shes pa phyi ma phyi ma la yang snga ma snga ma'i yul snang bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: The master says, ‚ÄúThe object of the prior moment does not appear to the subsequent consciousnesses,

original: de ni de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: because that is not their object.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because of that,

original: gzhan du dang po gcig pu nyid //
analyzed: gzhan du dang po gcig pu nyid //
translated: The first is only one.

original: don las byung phyir 'brel 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: don las byung phyir 'brel 'gyur gyi //
translated: It is related to the object,

original: snga ma'i don dang 'brel mthong med //
analyzed: snga ma'i don dang 'brel mthong med //
translated: but not related to the prior object.

original: shes pa phyi ma phyi ma min //
analyzed: shes pa phyi ma phyi ma min //
translated: It is not the subsequent consciousness.

original: phyi ma phyi ma'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa ni /
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa ni /
translated: The subsequent consciousnesses

original: shes pa snga ma yul gyi yul can nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa snga ma yul gyi yul can nyid ma yin no //
translated: are not the subjects of the prior object.

original: yul ma yin pa yang ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: yul ma yin pa yang ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be the object of perception?

original: gal te dang po'i don gyi rnam par gyur pa nyid yin pas de'i tshe ni de las gyur pa gnyis pa yang de'i don gyi rnam pa myong ba'i rnam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te dang po'i don gyi rnam par gyur pa nyid yin pas de'i tshe ni de las gyur pa gnyis pa yang de'i don gyi rnam pa myong ba'i rnam pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it is the transformation of the first object, then the second transformation is also the form of the experience of the object.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / de'i tshe rnam can shes pa las //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de'i tshe rnam can shes pa las //
translated: From the consciousness that has the form of the object,

original: shes pa'i shes pa skyes pa na //
analyzed: shes pa'i shes pa skyes pa na //
translated: a consciousness of that consciousness arises.

original: de yi rnam par ldan gyur te //
analyzed: de yi rnam par ldan gyur te //
translated: It is endowed with the form of that object,

original: thag ring shing las 'byung ji ltar //
analyzed: thag ring shing las 'byung ji ltar //
translated: just as a distant sound arises from a tree.

original: 'on te shes pa 'ba' zhig dran par mi nus pas don dang lhan cig pa nyid dran pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa 'ba' zhig dran par mi nus pas don dang lhan cig pa nyid dran pa yin te /
translated: But if it is not possible to remember a consciousness alone, then the object is remembered together with the consciousness.

original: de la byed pa'i @74b mtshan nyid de gnas pa nyid de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la byed pa'i @74b mtshan nyid de gnas pa nyid de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of the agent is the state of being the nature of that.

original: des na don dang bcas pa dran pa yin no //
analyzed: des na don dang bcas pa dran pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object is remembered together with the consciousness.

original: bum pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig pa yang rang bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig pa yang rang bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: Only a pot, etc. is the nature of the object,

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: but not together with the potter, etc.

original: yul ni rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig nyid du dmigs pa yin te ;üîΩdes na de lta bur gyur pa nyid du dran pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul ni rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig nyid du dmigs pa yin te ; des na de lta bur gyur pa nyid du dran pa yin gyi /
translated: The object is observed simultaneously with consciousness.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is just that which is remembered, not a pot, etc.

original: de yang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar / gnyis dag lhan cig bzung na ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gnyis dag lhan cig bzung na ni //
translated: If two are apprehended simultaneously,

original: lhan cig ces byar rigs 'gyur na //üîΩsngon po'i rnam pa las gzhan pa'i //
analyzed: lhan cig ces byar rigs 'gyur na // sngon po'i rnam pa las gzhan pa'i //
translated: it is reasonable to say they are simultaneous.

original: shes pa nges par rtogs pa med //
analyzed: shes pa nges par rtogs pa med //
translated: But consciousness is not ascertained

original: bde ba la sogs ngo bor na //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs ngo bor na //
translated: as different from the aspect of blue.

original: 'di nyid khyed la 'grub ba ma yin //
analyzed: 'di nyid khyed la 'grub ba ma yin //
translated: And it is not established for youüîΩthat it has the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya bar ni khyed la grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya bar ni khyed la grub pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not established for you that consciousness has the nature of pleasure, etc.,

original: bde ba la sogs pa dag ni yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dag ni yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because pleasure, etc., are objects.

original: ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa las tha dad par rnam par shes pa gzhan med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa las tha dad par rnam par shes pa gzhan med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as consciousness is not different from pleasure, etc.,

original: sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad par yang ngo //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad par yang ngo //
translated: so it is not different from blue, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi yul na gnas pa'i gzhal bya nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi yul na gnas pa'i gzhal bya nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that blue and so on are objects of knowledge that exist as external objects, that is not so,

original: bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol ma yin yang gzhal bya nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol ma yin yang gzhal bya nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that pleasure and so on are objects of knowledge even though they are not external.

original: gnyi ga myong ba las phyi dang nang zhes bya bar ni don dam bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga myong ba las phyi dang nang zhes bya bar ni don dam bar mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable in an ultimate sense to say that external and internal are so called from the experience of both.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Pleasure and so on do not apprehend blue and so on,

original: de med kyang de bzhin nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang de bzhin nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they appear as they are even when the latter are absent.

original: gang zhig gang med par yang 'gyur pa de ni des byas ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang med par yang 'gyur pa de ni des byas ba ma yin no //
translated: That which occurs even when something else is absent is not produced by the latter.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa med kyang 'dzin par 'gyur pa yin no ;
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa med kyang 'dzin par 'gyur pa yin no ;
translated: Blue and so on are apprehended even when pleasure and so on are absent.

original: ; des na sngon po la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gyis byas pa nyid de /
analyzed: ; des na sngon po la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gyis byas pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore the apprehension of blue and so on is produced by the specific nature of the object,

original: de med par yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de med par yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because it exists even when the former are absent.

original: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa lkog tu ma gyur pa med par ni sngon po la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa ma gtogs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa lkog tu ma gyur pa med par ni sngon po la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa ma gtogs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, since the apprehension of blue and so on does not occur without the non-obstructed blue and so on,

original: nyams su myong ba dang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pas rnam pa gnyis pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pas rnam pa gnyis pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: it is established that there are two aspects: the experience and the aspect of blue and so on.

original: gzhan yang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa de lta na yang /üîΩnges par blo dang lhan cig te //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa de lta na yang / nges par blo dang lhan cig te //
translated: Moreover, even if the aspect of the apprehender transforms,üîΩbecause it is definitely experienced simultaneously

original: cig car du ni myong gyur phyir //üîΩyul ni de las gzhan nyid du //
analyzed: cig car du ni myong gyur phyir // yul ni de las gzhan nyid du //
translated: with the cognition,

original: rnam gang gis na grub par 'gyur //üîΩsngon po la @75a * //
analyzed: rnam gang gis na grub par 'gyur // sngon po la @75a * //
translated: how could the object be established as being different from that?

original: sogs pa'i yul ni blo dang lhan cig dus gcig nyid du myong ba yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i yul ni blo dang lhan cig dus gcig nyid du myong ba yin te /
translated: The object, such as blue, is experienced simultaneously with the cognition.

original: blo dang lhan cig yin gyi so sor ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo dang lhan cig yin gyi so sor ni ma yin no //
translated: It is together with the cognition, not separately.

original: des na rig pa las blo gzhan yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar de lta bur gyur pa nyid myong ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na rig pa las blo gzhan yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar de lta bur gyur pa nyid myong ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could it be established that the cognition is different from the awareness, that it is just that which experiences it in that way?

original: rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because it is impossible to divide it.

original: tha dad par snang ba yin no zhe na /üîΩrnam shes 'khrul pas zla ba gnyis //
analyzed: tha dad par snang ba yin no zhe na / rnam shes 'khrul pas zla ba gnyis //
translated: If you say that it appears to be different,üîΩthen just as the two moons are seen

original: med par tha dad mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: med par tha dad mthong ba bzhin //
translated: due to the error of consciousness,

original: dper na zla ba gnyis mthong bas zla ba gcig nyid las tha dad par mthong ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid la yang gal te yul gcig la yang tha dad par mthong bar rigs te /
analyzed: dper na zla ba gnyis mthong bas zla ba gcig nyid las tha dad par mthong ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid la yang gal te yul gcig la yang tha dad par mthong bar rigs te /
translated: so too, if the difference of the object is seen in the case of a single moon, then it is reasonable that the difference of the object would be seen in the case of consciousness itself.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aspects of consciousness are different.

original: de bdag nyid la go ji ltar //
analyzed: de bdag nyid la go ji ltar //
translated: How can it be in itself?

original: de nyid ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It does not become different.

original: ji ltar rang gi ngo bo de nyid kyis gzhan gyi ngo bo rtogs te /
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi ngo bo de nyid kyis gzhan gyi ngo bo rtogs te /
translated: How can it be that the very nature of something is understood as the nature of something else?

original: de ma rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ma rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it follows that it is not understood.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.üîΩBecause it is like this:

original: 'di ltar gal te rang gi ngo bo ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rang gi ngo bo ni //
