translated: If the nature of something

original: gzhan du rtogs par nus min na //
analyzed: gzhan du rtogs par nus min na //
translated: cannot be understood as different,

original: de lta na ni gzhan gyi ni //
analyzed: de lta na ni gzhan gyi ni //
translated: then in that case, the nature of something else

original: ngo bo shin tu nus ma yin //
analyzed: ngo bo shin tu nus ma yin //
translated: It is not possible to know the essence of something else.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo gzhan du rtogs par mi nus na /üîΩgzhan gyi ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du yang rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo gzhan du rtogs par mi nus na / gzhan gyi ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du yang rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is not possible to know the essence of something else,üîΩthen it is not possible to know the essence of something else as its own essence.

original: rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gzhan gyi ngo bo yang mi nus pa nyid do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gzhan gyi ngo bo yang mi nus pa nyid do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as it is not possible to know its own essence, it is not possible to know the essence of something else.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: shes pa rang rig yin na rang gi ngo bor tha dad par rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa rang rig yin na rang gi ngo bor tha dad par rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If consciousness were reflexive awareness, it would not be possible to know it as distinct from its own essence.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa gcig nyid rnam par sna tshogs pa yin par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa gcig nyid rnam par sna tshogs pa yin par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If a single consciousness were to become a variety,

original: rang rig pas rtogs par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pas rtogs par nus pa yin te /
translated: then it would be possible to know it through reflexive awareness,

original: gzhan du mi 'thad ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be tenable in any other way.

original: des na zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yang gal te gcig nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: des na zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yang gal te gcig nyid ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, in the case of seeing two moons, if they are not one,

original: de rtogs par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de rtogs par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not possible to know them,

original: rang dang gzhan dag gis rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan dag gis rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: because it is not possible to know them through themselves or something else.

original: de'i phyir de'i dus phyis byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las zla ba gnyis tha dad par btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dus phyis byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las zla ba gnyis tha dad par btags pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the designation of the two moons as different is due to the subsequent occurrence of conceptualization, which is in conformity with the appearance of the two moons and the non-appearance of the two moons.

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the two moons are not perceived by direct perception.üîΩThis is the point of the following

original: de na 'di nyid ni /üîΩrnam shes 'khrul pas zla ba gnyis //
analyzed: de na 'di nyid ni / rnam shes 'khrul pas zla ba gnyis //
translated: verse:

original: med par tha dad mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: med par tha dad mthong ba bzhin //
translated: Just as the two moons are seen as different by the confused consciousness,

original: zhes bya bas ba stan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ba stan pa yin no //
translated: so the non-existent is seen as different.

original: zla ba gnyis su mngon par 'dod pa nyid gnyis med pa yin te /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su mngon par 'dod pa nyid gnyis med pa yin te /
translated: The two moons that are accepted as being manifest are not two,

original: rnam par shes pa gcig @75b gi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig @75b gi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included within a single consciousness.

original: de lta na 'o na lhan cig mthong ba'i sngon po dang ser po dag kyang sna tshogs kyi rnam pa gcig tu khas blang bar bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na lhan cig mthong ba'i sngon po dang ser po dag kyang sna tshogs kyi rnam pa gcig tu khas blang bar bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the blue and the yellow that are seen together would have to be accepted as a single variety.

original: de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin te /
translated: That is so,

original: myong ba'i rang bzhin rnam pa sna tshogs pa can ni der yang gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myong ba'i rang bzhin rnam pa sna tshogs pa can ni der yang gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the various natures of experience are one there.

original: gal te tha dad par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te tha dad par 'dod na ni /
translated: If you accept that they are different,üîΩthen you must accept that the two moons are different.

original: de'i tshe 'di ltar khas blang bar bya ste /üîΩsngo ser tha dad dag la ni //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di ltar khas blang bar bya ste / sngo ser tha dad dag la ni //
translated: At that time, one should accept the following:üîΩThere is no certainty of experience

original: myong ba nges pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: myong ba nges pa yod ma yin //
translated: With respect to different blue and yellow.

original: tha dad pa'i rgyu ni 'di kho na ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rgyu ni 'di kho na ste /
translated: The cause of the difference is just this,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: the difference of establishment and pleasure.üîΩBut in the appearance of two moons, there is no difference of establishment and pleasure, and so there is only one.

original: zla ba gnyis snang ba la ni grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa nyid med pa'i phyir na gcig kho na'o /üîΩgal te 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir ji ltar gcig nyid yin /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis snang ba la ni grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa nyid med pa'i phyir na gcig kho na'o / gal te 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir ji ltar gcig nyid yin /
translated: If you say that it is not one because of the presence of contradictory properties,üîΩthen this very difference is called the presence of contradictory properties.

original: tha dad pa ni 'di nyid na 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni 'di nyid na 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: And here, contradiction is the characteristic of the presence of mutual exclusion.üîΩBut that is not so,üîΩbecause there is no contradictionüîΩBetween permanence and impermanence.üîΩBecause of the presence of the contradictory properties of permanence and impermanence, there is no contradiction between the two.üîΩBut that is not so, becauseüîΩcontradiction of that kind

original: 'di la 'gal ba yang phan tshun spangs te /
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba yang phan tshun spangs te /
translated: is between permanence and impermanence.üîΩBecause of the presence of the contradictory properties of permanence and impermanence, there is no contradiction between the two.üîΩBut that is not so, becauseüîΩcontradiction of that kind

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: is between permanence and impermanence.üîΩBecause of the presence of the contradictory properties of permanence and impermanence, there is no contradiction between the two.üîΩBut that is not so, because

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩrnam pa de lta'i 'gal ba ni //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / rnam pa de lta'i 'gal ba ni //
translated: contradiction of that kindüîΩis between permanence and impermanence.üîΩBecause of the presence of the contradictory properties of permanence and impermanence, there is no contradiction between the two.üîΩBut that is not so, becauseüîΩcontradiction of that kindüîΩis between permanence and impermanence.

original: rtag pa dang ni cig shos nyid //üîΩrtogs pas rjes su zhugs pas na //
analyzed: rtag pa dang ni cig shos nyid // rtogs pas rjes su zhugs pas na //
translated: Because of the presence of the contradictory properties of permanence and impermanence, there is no contradiction between the two.üîΩBut that is not so, becauseüîΩcontradiction of that kindüîΩis between permanence and impermanence.üîΩBecause of the presence of the contradictory properties of permanence and impermanence, there is no contradiction between the two.üîΩBut that is not so, becauseüîΩcontradiction of that kindüîΩis between permanence and impermanence.üîΩBecause of the presence of the contradictory properties of permanence and impermanence, there is no contradiction between the two.üîΩBut that is not so, becauseüîΩcontradiction of that kindüîΩis between permanence and impermanence.

original: gnyis pa 'gal ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'gal ba yod ma yin //
translated: Because of the presence of the contradictory properties of permanence and impermanence, there is no contradiction between the two.üîΩBut that is not so, becauseüîΩcontradiction of that kindüîΩis between permanence and imperman

original: de dag ni rtogs pa rjes su zhugs pa nyid kyi 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rtogs pa rjes su zhugs pa nyid kyi 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: But this is not a contradiction, since the realization is subsequent to the object.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni 'di kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni 'di kho na ste /
translated: This is the very nature of the object.

original: rnam pa dbye ba med pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dbye ba med pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnondifferentiation of aspects.‚Äù

original: de nyid de dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: de nyid de dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no ;
translated: It is not contradictory to itself.

original: ; des na gcig po de nyid rnam pa gnyis so zhes rtogs pas rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ; des na gcig po de nyid rnam pa gnyis so zhes rtogs pas rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is understood that the one object is twofold, and so it is said to be concomitant with and to reverse the object.

original: rjes su 'gro ldog gi dngos po de nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin zhes ston pa ni /üîΩmyong ba med par don 'ga' 'am //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ldog gi dngos po de nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin zhes ston pa ni / myong ba med par don 'ga' 'am //
translated: The fact that the object of concomitance and reversal does not exist ultimately is shown by the following:üîΩNo experience of an object is seen,

original: don med pa yi myong ba 'am //
analyzed: don med pa yi myong ba 'am //
translated: nor is there experience without an object.

original: myong bar 'gyur ba ma mthong ba //
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur ba ma mthong ba //
translated: Since experience is not seen,

original: des na de dag tha dad min //
analyzed: des na de dag tha dad min //
translated: they are not different.

original: rjes su 'gro ldog med pa'i phyir sngon po dang myong ba gcig nyid yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ldog med pa'i phyir sngon po dang myong ba gcig nyid yin te /
translated: Since there is no concomitance or reversal, the blue and the experience are one.

original: phan tshun ldog pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ldog pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they are not seen to be mutually exclusive,

original: 'di ltar / don med pa yi myong ba dang // myong ba med pa'i don mthong med //
analyzed: 'di ltar / don med pa yi myong ba dang // myong ba med pa'i don mthong med //
translated: There is no experience of a nonexistent object, and there is no seeing of an object without experience.

original: des na rtag tu mi 'bral phyir //
analyzed: des na rtag tu mi 'bral phyir //
translated: Therefore, because they are never separate,

original: don myong de ni gcig pa nyid //
analyzed: don myong de ni gcig pa nyid //
translated: the experience of the object is the same.

original: tha dad par ni nyer sbyor phyir //
analyzed: tha dad par ni nyer sbyor phyir //
translated: Because they are connected as different,

original: tha dad rig pa tha dad 'dod //
analyzed: tha dad rig pa tha dad 'dod //
translated: the cognition of difference is asserted to be different.

original: gal te de med de yi phyir //
analyzed: gal te de med de yi phyir //
translated: If it does not exist, because of that,

original: tha dad mi dad dbyer ci yod //
analyzed: tha dad mi dad dbyer ci yod //
translated: what difference is there between difference and nondifference?

original: des na 'dir pha rol pos tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i ming tsam zhig gdags par bya ba yin pas gzhan la chad pa cung zad kyang med do //üîΩgal te la la blang bya dang dor bya'i @76a * //
analyzed: des na 'dir pha rol pos tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i ming tsam zhig gdags par bya ba yin pas gzhan la chad pa cung zad kyang med do // gal te la la blang bya dang dor bya'i @76a * //
translated: Therefore, here the opponent only imputes the mere name ‚Äúdifferent.‚Äù There is no difference at all in the other.

original: rnam par dbye ba med na 'di 'dra ba'i tha dad pas ci bya /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba med na 'di 'dra ba'i tha dad pas ci bya /
translated: If there is no distinction of what is to be taken up and what is to be rejected, what is the use of such a difference?

original: 'o na ji ltar sngon po 'on cig ces bya bas ser po khyer te 'ong bar mi byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sngon po 'on cig ces bya bas ser po khyer te 'ong bar mi byed ce na /
translated: Well then, if someone says ‚ÄúBring the blue,‚Äù why does it not cause the bringing of the yellow?

original: de'i tshe ser po de mi snang ba nyid de des na khyer te 'ong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ser po de mi snang ba nyid de des na khyer te 'ong ba ma yin no //
translated: At that time the yellow does not appear, and therefore it is not brought.

original: 'bras ba med pa'i sngon po gang yin pa de ni ma brjod pa kho na'o /
analyzed: 'bras ba med pa'i sngon po gang yin pa de ni ma brjod pa kho na'o /
translated: But the blue that is without effect is not mentioned at all.

original: mi 'bral ba nyid ni shes pa las gnas pa yin pas de ni gzhan du khyer te 'od bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'bral ba nyid ni shes pa las gnas pa yin pas de ni gzhan du khyer te 'od bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And since non-separation is the persistence of the cognition, it cannot be carried over to something else.

original: tha dad pa'i tha snyad ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las yin pas na de kho na nyid las gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i tha snyad ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las yin pas na de kho na nyid las gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: And since the convention of difference is based on positive and negative concomitance, it is not based on reality.

original: de'i phyir shes dus snang ba yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes dus snang ba yin //
translated: Therefore, the appearance is at the time of cognition.

original: don ni shes las gzhan min pa ;
analyzed: don ni shes las gzhan min pa ;
translated: The object is not different from the cognition,

original: / bzlog par rab tu dka' ba nyid //
analyzed: / bzlog par rab tu dka' ba nyid //
translated: and it is very difficult to reverse that.

original: grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir don shes pa dang gcig nyid ni bzlog par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir don shes pa dang gcig nyid ni bzlog par dka' ba yin no //
translated: Because existence and happiness are not different, it is difficult to reverse the oneness of the object and cognition.

original: bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir na shes pa rnam pa dang bcad pa zhes bya bar thub po //
analyzed: bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir na shes pa rnam pa dang bcad pa zhes bya bar thub po //
translated: And because it cannot be reversed, the Sage has said that cognition is with aspects.

original: de ltan na ni shes pa 'ba' zhig snang ba yin gyi don ma yin no ;
analyzed: de ltan na ni shes pa 'ba' zhig snang ba yin gyi don ma yin no ;
translated: In that case, only cognition appears, not the object.

original: / de mthong na yang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis myong ba yin la /
analyzed: / de mthong na yang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis myong ba yin la /
translated: And when it is seen, the two aspects of blue, etc. are experienced.

original: de yang shes pa'i dus su snang pas yang don mthong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang shes pa'i dus su snang pas yang don mthong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is not the seeing of the object, because it appears at the time of consciousness.

original: rnam pa gzhan 'jog par 'gyur bas thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir na 'tshol bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan 'jog par 'gyur bas thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir na 'tshol bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And since another aspect would be posited, there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'di la lan du tha dad rgyu ni rjes dpag 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di la lan du tha dad rgyu ni rjes dpag 'gyur //
translated: The reply to that is: The cause of difference is inference.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa mthong ba dang ldan pa dag 'di la rgyu 'ga' yod par 'gyur ro zhes de dang mthun pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin gyi dngos su 'di rtogs pa'i yul du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa mthong ba dang ldan pa dag 'di la rgyu 'ga' yod par 'gyur ro zhes de dang mthun pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin gyi dngos su 'di rtogs pa'i yul du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Those who possess the seeing of the aspect of blue, etc. will have some cause for that. It is an inference that accords with that, but it is not the direct object of understanding.

original: sngar brjod pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the previously stated error would exist.

original: gtan mthong ba med pa ni ji ltar rjes su dpog ce na ;
analyzed: gtan mthong ba med pa ni ji ltar rjes su dpog ce na ;
translated: How can there be an inference of something that is never seen?

original: de la bshad pa /
analyzed: de la bshad pa /
translated: The reply to that is:

original: rgyu gzhan dag ni yod na yang //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan dag ni yod na yang //
translated: Even though other causes exist,

original: dbang po'i blo rnams med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo rnams med pa'i phyir //
translated: the cognitions of the sense faculties do not exist.

original: phyir mthong ba yi rjes dpag ni //
analyzed: phyir mthong ba yi rjes dpag ni //
translated: Therefore, the inference of seeing

original: ldog pa tsam las 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: ldog pa tsam las 'jug pa yin //
translated: The eye consciousness arises from the mere presence of the eye, form, light, space, and attention.

original: 'di ltar mig dang rna ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa yod kyang ka bas stong bar 'dod pa'i phyogs su ka bar snang ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa mi 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig dang rna ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa yod kyang ka bas stong bar 'dod pa'i phyogs su ka bar snang ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa mi 'byung la /
translated: For example, even though the eye, form, light, space, and attention are present, the eye consciousness that perceives a pillar does not arise in a place that is devoid of pillars.

original: gzhan du ni mod nyid la 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni mod nyid la 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But it does arise immediately in another place.

original: des na 'dir gang zhig ma tshang bas gzhan dug dang mi 'byung ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar shes pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dir gang zhig ma tshang bas gzhan dug dang mi 'byung ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that there is some factor that is absent in the first place and present in the second place, which prevents the arising of the eye consciousness.

original: phyi rol gyi gzhal bya de lta bur gyur ba'i don de ni mthong ba'i khyad @76b par dang bral ba'i don nyid du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzhal bya de lta bur gyur ba'i don de ni mthong ba'i khyad @76b par dang bral ba'i don nyid du shes pa yin no //
translated: The object that is perceived in this way is understood to be an external object that is devoid of the special features of perception.

original: 'o na de ji ltar mngon sum gyi yul yin zhe na /üîΩde'i rnam pa mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar mngon sum gyi yul yin zhe na / de'i rnam pa mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then how can it be the object of direct perception?üîΩBecause its image is the object of direct perception.

original: rten gzhan mi slu ba'i phyir nye bar brtags nas yul du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rten gzhan mi slu ba'i phyir nye bar brtags nas yul du gyur pa yin no //
translated: The object is designated as the object of direct perception because it is the basis of a nondeceptive direct perception.

original: de lta na'o na ni phyi'i don nyid dang gzhal bya yin gyi rig pa tsam ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na'o na ni phyi'i don nyid dang gzhal bya yin gyi rig pa tsam ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then external objects are the objects of perception, not mere awareness.

original: 'dir gnas pa'i phyogs ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir gnas pa'i phyogs ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The position that is not tenable is as follows.

original: gal te mtshungs pa de ma thag / rkyen las nges par mi sgra na'o //üîΩci rnam pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pa'i don gzhan brtag par bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mtshungs pa de ma thag / rkyen las nges par mi sgra na'o // ci rnam pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pa'i don gzhan brtag par bya ba yin nam /
translated: If you say that the form of the object is not ascertained from the condition of the immediately preceding similar object,

original: 'on te mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on te mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig yin /
translated: is it that the difference in the form is due to a different object, or is it due to a difference in the condition of the immediately preceding similar object?

original: de la gtan mthong ba med pa'i don rtogs pa ni legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gtan mthong ba med pa'i don rtogs pa ni legs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not good to posit an object that is never seen.

original: rten gzhan med par de ltar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rten gzhan med par de ltar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: It is not tenable to posit an object that is never seen.

original: gang gi tshe sngon du snang ba sngon gyis mthong ba'i mthu nyid las rnam pa 'di skyes pa de'i tshe ni gzhan du rtogs pa don med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon du snang ba sngon gyis mthong ba'i mthu nyid las rnam pa 'di skyes pa de'i tshe ni gzhan du rtogs pa don med do //
translated: If the form arises from the power of seeing the form of the object previously, then it is pointless to posit another object.

original: rtogs pa yang mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas ;
analyzed: rtogs pa yang mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas ;
translated: Also, the ascertainment of the object follows the seeing of the object.

original: 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te ma mthong ba ni brtag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te ma mthong ba ni brtag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is a transformation, not something else, for what is not seen cannot be imagined.

original: rtogs pa ni mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang bar snang bas gzhan du brtag par mi nus so //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang bar snang bas gzhan du brtag par mi nus so //
translated: And since the understanding appears to follow the seeing, it cannot be imagined to be something else.

original: gal te phyi'i don yang skyed par byed pa nyid du mthong ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te phyi'i don yang skyed par byed pa nyid du mthong ba ma yin na /
translated: If the external object is not seen to be the producer,

original: dper na gong bu'i rnam pa shing gi rnam pa nyid shing med par mi 'byung ba bzhin no zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: dper na gong bu'i rnam pa shing gi rnam pa nyid shing med par mi 'byung ba bzhin no zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: then just as the form of a mass is not seen without the form of the tree,üîΩso the form of the tree is not seen without the form of the mass.

original: de yang shing skyed par byed pa yin no zhes sus mthong //
analyzed: de yang shing skyed par byed pa yin no zhes sus mthong //
translated: No, for who sees that the tree produces the mass?

original: de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: Not by itself,

original: de ni shes pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni shes pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the form of consciousness.

original: mi gzhan gyis mthong zhe na /
analyzed: mi gzhan gyis mthong zhe na /
translated: If by another person,

original: 'di la dpyad zin to //üîΩde nyid kyis na phyir mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la dpyad zin to // de nyid kyis na phyir mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: this has already been examined.üîΩIf by itself,

original: gal te des phyis mthong du chug kyang /
analyzed: gal te des phyis mthong du chug kyang /
translated: then even if it is seen later,

original: sngar yod do zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: sngar yod do zhes bya ba las /
translated: it is not that it was seen earlier,

original: phyis mthong ba nyid las so zhe na /
analyzed: phyis mthong ba nyid las so zhe na /
translated: but that it is seen later.

original: gal te phyis dmigs su chug kyang /
analyzed: gal te phyis dmigs su chug kyang /
translated: Even if you do perceive it later,

original: phyir nyid 'gyur mod /
analyzed: phyir nyid 'gyur mod /
translated: it would be the same as before.

original: dmigs pa de snga ma la med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa de snga ma la med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the object of perception did not exist earlier.

original: dmigs pa de 'ang shes pa'i rnam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa de 'ang shes pa'i rnam pa yin gyi /
translated: That object of perception is a feature of consciousness,

original: don gyi rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not a feature of the object.

original: des na de yang don yod do zhes bya ba phyis dmigs par nges pa yin la de yang phyis yin pa'i phyir mthar thug pa med pas na mi rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na de yang don yod do zhes bya ba phyis dmigs par nges pa yin la de yang phyis yin pa'i phyir mthar thug pa med pas na mi rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the object exists later when it is perceived, but because it exists later, there is an infinite regress, and so it is not perceived.üîΩTherefore, because the object is not seen, and because the connection with latent potentialities has already been established, the pacification of analysis is accepted.

original: de'i phyir don mthong ba med pa'i phyir dang / bag chags dang 'brel ba nyid kyang sngar nyid bsgrubs pa'i phyir dpyad pa zhi ba mos bzod pas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis nus pa nyid nges pa @77a * //üîΩrgyur brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don mthong ba med pa'i phyir dang / bag chags dang 'brel ba nyid kyang sngar nyid bsgrubs pa'i phyir dpyad pa zhi ba mos bzod pas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis nus pa nyid nges pa @77a * // rgyur brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: The capacity of the immediately preceding condition must be considered the cause.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig rtogs pa ma yin na de la rgyu tha dad pa rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol gzhal bya yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig rtogs pa ma yin na de la rgyu tha dad pa rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol gzhal bya yin no //
translated: If something is not perceived, then the difference in cause can be inferred, and the object is external.

original: gal te phyi rol don med na ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang shes bya shes byed kyi dngos por 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol don med na ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang shes bya shes byed kyi dngos por 'gyur /
translated: If external objects do not exist, how could there be the relationship of cause and effect and the relationship of object known and knower?üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / phyi rol med na rgyu dang ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / phyi rol med na rgyu dang ni //
translated: If external objects do not exist,

original: 'bras nyid shes pa yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras nyid shes pa yin par 'gyur //
translated: consciousness would have no object.

original: de dag las yang nges med phyir //
analyzed: de dag las yang nges med phyir //
translated: Since they are not ascertained from those,

original: 'bras bu med cing rgyu yang med //
analyzed: 'bras bu med cing rgyu yang med //
translated: there would be no effect and no cause.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / sngon por snang las ser por snang //üîΩde la sngon po snang ldan pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sngon por snang las ser por snang // de la sngon po snang ldan pa //
translated: From the appearance of blue, the appearance of yellowüîΩdoes not exist.

original: de ltar phan tshun rgyu yin pas //
analyzed: de ltar phan tshun rgyu yin pas //
translated: Since they are mutually causes,

original: ji ltar rgyu 'bras dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu 'bras dag tu 'gyur //
translated: how could they be cause and effect?

original: gang gi tshe sngon por snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i de ma thag pa nyid du ser por snang ba'i shes pa 'byung ba de'i tshe ser por snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i ser po bas ser por snang ba nyid de'i rgyu yin par 'gyur gyi /üîΩser po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon por snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i de ma thag pa nyid du ser por snang ba'i shes pa 'byung ba de'i tshe ser por snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i ser po bas ser por snang ba nyid de'i rgyu yin par 'gyur gyi / ser po ni ma yin no //
translated: When the consciousness appearing as yellow arises immediately after the consciousness appearing as blue, at that time the cause of the consciousness appearing as yellow would be the consciousness appearing as blue, but not yellow, because the appearance of yellow does not exist apart from the appearance of blue.üîΩYellow does not exist in the appearance of blue.

original: de la yang ser por yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang ser por yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It also does not exist in the appearance of yellow.

original: ser por snang pa de las kyang sngon por snang ba yin pa'i phyir phan tshun rgyu nyid du 'gyur bas rigs pa dang 'gal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ser por snang pa de las kyang sngon por snang ba yin pa'i phyir phan tshun rgyu nyid du 'gyur bas rigs pa dang 'gal par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because the appearance as blue is the cause of the appearance as yellow, they would be mutually causal, and that contradicts reasoning.

original: ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun rgyu yin /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun rgyu yin /
translated: How could cause and effect be mutually causal?

original: phyi'i don yod na ni sngon po nyid der rgyu yin la /
analyzed: phyi'i don yod na ni sngon po nyid der rgyu yin la /
translated: If external objects exist, blue is the cause of the appearance of blue,üîΩand the appearance as yellow is the immediately preceding condition.

original: ser por snang ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid do// mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang lhan cig byed pa don tha dad pas tha dad pa na gang gis nges pa med par 'gyur ba gcig nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ser por snang ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid do// mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang lhan cig byed pa don tha dad pas tha dad pa na gang gis nges pa med par 'gyur ba gcig nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is not the same as the cooperative condition, which is different in meaning.

original: yang na rtogs pa'i rang bzhin la ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na rtogs pa'i rang bzhin la ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pa yin la /
translated: Or, the immediately preceding condition is the cause of the nature of the cognition,

original: rnam pa la ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid yin pas de la nges pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: rnam pa la ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid yin pas de la nges pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: and the aspect is blue and so on. Therefore there is no fault because it is ascertained.

original: gal te rtogs pa'i rad bzhin las rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid dang sngon po las gzhan las kyang de'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa'i rad bzhin las rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid dang sngon po las gzhan las kyang de'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: If the aspect were the nature of the cognition, then the aspect would be the nature of the cognition itself, and not different from blue.

original: nges pa med par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nges pa med par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: There would be no certainty.

original: gal te dung dkar po las kyang ser po'i rnam pa nyid dmigs la /
analyzed: gal te dung dkar po las kyang ser po'i rnam pa nyid dmigs la /
translated: If a white conch were perceived as the aspect of yellow,

original: chung ngu las kyang chen po'i rnam pa nyid dmigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: chung ngu las kyang chen po'i rnam pa nyid dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: and a small object were perceived as the aspect of a large object,

original: des na 'di la yang nges pa med pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'di la yang nges pa med pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: then there would be no certainty in this case either.

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar / rgyu ni 'khrul par 'gyur ba'o phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyu ni 'khrul par 'gyur ba'o phyir //
translated: Because the cause is mistaken,

original: der ni 'chol ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der ni 'chol ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: there would be confusion in that case.

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i snang ba la //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i snang ba la //
translated: In the appearance without error,

original: nges par rtogs pa gzhan yod min //
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa gzhan yod min //
translated: there is no other ascertainment.

original: 'khrul pa la 'chol par mthong ba gang yin pa de ni tshad ma can nyid @77b ma yin pa'i phyir na des 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa la 'chol par mthong ba gang yin pa de ni tshad ma can nyid @77b ma yin pa'i phyir na des 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: What is seen as confused in error is not valid cognition, so it does not cause error.

original: de bzhin du sa bon las myu gu skye bar 'dod kyi bzlog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bon las myu gu skye bar 'dod kyi bzlog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, a sprout is accepted as arising from a seed, not the reverse.

original: rnam par shes pa smra ba la ni mas bon la sogs pa snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i sa bon la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smra ba la ni mas bon la sogs pa snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i sa bon la sogs pa med do //
translated: For the Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdin, there is no seed, etc., apart from the appearance of the seed, etc.

original: des na sa bon du snang ba las myu gur snang ba de las kyang sa bon du snang ba yin pa'i phyir na nges pa med do //
analyzed: des na sa bon du snang ba las myu gur snang ba de las kyang sa bon du snang ba yin pa'i phyir na nges pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since the appearance of the sprout is from the appearance of the seed, and the appearance of the seed is from the appearance of the sprout, there is no certainty.

original: de ltar na yang tha snyad chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang tha snyad chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, convention would be cut off.

original: shes bya shes byed kyi dngos po yang ring du spangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes bya shes byed kyi dngos po yang ring du spangs pa nyid do //
translated: The state of object known and knower would be utterly abandoned.

original: du ba las me yod do zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: du ba las me yod do zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The existence of fire from smoke is what is to be established.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la lkog tu gyur pa yin na phyi rol gyi me ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la lkog tu gyur pa yin na phyi rol gyi me ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the object inferred is hidden, then external fire does not exist.

original: snang ba yang shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir na lkog tu gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: snang ba yang shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir na lkog tu gyur pa nyid do //
translated: And since the appearance is also of the nature of cognition, it is hidden.

original: gzhan gyi snang ba yang bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi snang ba yang bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: The appearance of another is also what is to be established.

original: de la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of error regarding that.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang gi snang ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang gi snang ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the appearance itself that will arise is what is to be established,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then no.

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no certainty.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, you may say that external objects themselves are what is to be established.

original: 'di la bshad par /
analyzed: 'di la bshad par /
translated: In response to this, we say:üîΩFrom a seed, a sprout is produced;

original: sa bon las ni myug bskyed dang // du ba las me grub pa zhes //
analyzed: sa bon las ni myug bskyed dang // du ba las me grub pa zhes //
translated: from smoke, fire is inferred.

original: de 'dra phyi rol don brten can //
analyzed: de 'dra phyi rol don brten can //
translated: Such is the case for external objects.

original: byed po shes byed gnas pa gang //üîΩde yang gal te de ngo bor //
analyzed: byed po shes byed gnas pa gang // de yang gal te de ngo bor //
translated: If the agent, object, and locationüîΩare of that nature,

original: snang ba de ltar nges 'brel pa'i //
analyzed: snang ba de ltar nges 'brel pa'i //
translated: then the appearance is related to it in that way.

original: blo la brten pas rtogs byed na //
analyzed: blo la brten pas rtogs byed na //
translated: If you say that it is understood through dependence on the mind,

original: 'gal ba dag ni ci zhig yod //
analyzed: 'gal ba dag ni ci zhig yod //
translated: then what is the contradiction?

original: 'dir snang ba nyid dgos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir snang ba nyid dgos pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, the appearance itself is the purpose.

original: don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don ni ma yin te /
translated: The object is not,

original: mi snang ba ni yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi snang ba ni yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it does not appear, it is no different from not existing.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa nyid yod par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa nyid yod par brjod pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the object of apprehension itself is said to exist.

original: phyi yi don ni med na yang //
analyzed: phyi yi don ni med na yang //
translated: Even though external objects do not exist,

original: snang ba la ni nges yod min //
analyzed: snang ba la ni nges yod min //
translated: the appearance is definitely not nonexistent.

original: snang ba med na phyi rol ni //
analyzed: snang ba med na phyi rol ni //
translated: If there is no appearance, then

original: gti mug pha rol nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gti mug pha rol nyid du 'gyur //
translated: external things would be utterly nonexistent.

original: snang ba ni phyir rol med kyang 'gyur ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: snang ba ni phyir rol med kyang 'gyur ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that even without external things, there can be an appearance of them.

original: snang ba med na ni phyi rol med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: snang ba med na ni phyi rol med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no appearance, then external things would be utterly nonexistent,

original: ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not perceived.

original: des na sa bon du snang ba las myu gur snang ba yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu yin pa las 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: des na sa bon du snang ba las myu gur snang ba yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu yin pa las 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: Therefore, since the appearance of a sprout arises from the appearance of a seed, how can there be a contradiction between their being cause and effect?

original: 'o na myu gu 'ba' zhig snang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: 'o na myu gu 'ba' zhig snang bar mi nus te /
translated: But if the appearance of a sprout cannot occur,

original: 'ba' zhig snang na sa bon du snang ba med pa yod pas rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig snang na sa bon du snang ba med pa yod pas rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then since the appearance of a seed would exist without the appearance of a sprout, it would be causeless.

original: phyi'i don yod par smra ba rnams kyi ltar na ni rgyu med pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i don yod par smra ba rnams kyi ltar na ni rgyu med pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: For those who assert the existence of external things, it is not causeless,

original: mi snang bar sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi snang bar sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the seed exists without appearing.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol mi snang ba yin yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol mi snang ba yin yang /
translated: In this way, even though the external thing does not appear,

original: phyi rol nyid las nyams pa med //üîΩgang @78a * //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid las nyams pa med // gang @78a * //
translated: it is not the case that the external thing is lost.

original: tshe snang ba med 'gyur na //
analyzed: tshe snang ba med 'gyur na //
translated: When there is no appearance,

original: rnam shes nyid ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: rnam shes nyid ni yod ma yin //
translated: consciousness itself does not exist.

original: 'on te de ni gzhan gyi snang ba yod pa des na rgyu med pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni gzhan gyi snang ba yod pa des na rgyu med pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not without a cause, because the appearance of the other exists,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then no,

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no certainty.

original: gzhan gyi snang ba las ni rang gi snang ba skye ba yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi snang ba las ni rang gi snang ba skye ba yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And the appearance of the self is not produced from the appearance of the other.

original: de yang mtshungs pa ma yin te ;üîΩ'di ltar / gal te don de su la yang //
analyzed: de yang mtshungs pa ma yin te ; 'di ltar / gal te don de su la yang //
translated: That is not the same,

original: snang ba med par 'gyur ba na //
analyzed: snang ba med par 'gyur ba na //
translated: because if that object were to be without appearance for anyone,

original: gang gis myu gu de rgyu can //
analyzed: gang gis myu gu de rgyu can //
translated: then by what would the sprout be its cause?

original: 'gyur ba de yod tshad ma gang //
analyzed: 'gyur ba de yod tshad ma gang //
translated: What is the valid cognition of that?

original: nus ba nye bar brjod pas brjod pa thams cad bral ba ni nye bar brjod pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: nus ba nye bar brjod pas brjod pa thams cad bral ba ni nye bar brjod pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The definition of the absence of expression is the complete absence of all expressions by the assertion of potentiality.

original: phyis mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyis mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because it is seen later,

original: lan btab zin to //
analyzed: lan btab zin to //
translated: the answer has already been given.

original: 'bras bu las yod do zhes shes so zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu las yod do zhes shes so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it exists from the effect,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ni //
translated: then if the nature of cause and effect

original: grub na de yi yong par rtogs //
analyzed: grub na de yi yong par rtogs //
translated: were established, its existence would be understood.

original: de dngos nyid du rtogs na yang //
analyzed: de dngos nyid du rtogs na yang //
translated: But if its nature were understood,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur //
translated: then it would be the nature of cause and effect.

original: des na phan tshun rten pa'i nyes pas mi 'grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na phan tshun rten pa'i nyes pas mi 'grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, it is not established because of the fault of mutual dependence.

original: gal te gcig nyid du sgro btags pa 'di yang mthong ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gcig nyid du sgro btags pa 'di yang mthong ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that this superimposition of oneness is also seen,

original: 'o na rnam par shes pa la yang sgro btags pas sus bzlog / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar sgro 'dogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes pa la yang sgro btags pas sus bzlog / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar sgro 'dogs she na /
translated: then who can stop the superimposition of consciousness? If it is asked how there is superimposition because of the nonexistence of consciousness,

original: 'di ni phyir rol la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni phyir rol la yang mtshungs so //
translated: this is the same for external things.

original: phyir rol la yang sgro btags pa nyid las yod do zhes tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir rol la yang sgro btags pa nyid las yod do zhes tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: It is said that external things exist due to the superimposition of existence.

original: de lta yin yang snang ba yang kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta yin yang snang ba yang kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid do //
translated: Even though that is so, appearance also exists conventionally.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus su ni phyi rol sgro btags ba las gzhan pa'i yod pa nyid ni med do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus su ni phyi rol sgro btags ba las gzhan pa'i yod pa nyid ni med do //
translated: At the time of inference, there is no existence other than the superimposition of external things.

original: sgro 'dogs pa de ni gal te 'di lta bu 'ba' zhig 'dir 'gyur na /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa de ni gal te 'di lta bu 'ba' zhig 'dir 'gyur na /
translated: If that superimposition were only this,

original: mthong ba la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: it would also be seen.

original: gal te 'di lta bu 'ba' zhig 'dir 'gyur na snang bar 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: gal te 'di lta bu 'ba' zhig 'dir 'gyur na snang bar 'gyur zhes so //
translated: If it were only this, it would appear.

original: snang ba de gzhan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba de gzhan yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the appearance is one thing and the object another,

original: don yang gzhan yin pas na 'di ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: don yang gzhan yin pas na 'di ni mtshungs so //
translated: then the object is also another, so this is not the same.

original: der yang don dam par ni gcig nyid rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der yang don dam par ni gcig nyid rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: And in that case, ultimately there is no cognition of unity.

original: rnam par shes pa smra ba la yang rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba gnyis mthong ba bzhin du gzhan la yang tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smra ba la yang rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba gnyis mthong ba bzhin du gzhan la yang tha snyad byed do //
translated: And in the case of the Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdin, just as two people with cataracts see two moons, so too is the case of the other.

original: des na rnam par shes pa smra ba la yang gal te de'i ngo bor nges par snang ba dang 'brel ba'i cha la brten nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin la 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa smra ba la yang gal te de'i ngo bor nges par snang ba dang 'brel ba'i cha la brten nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin la 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: So, in the case of the Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdin, if the nature of the object is ascertained in dependence on the aspect that is related to the appearance, then what is the contradiction in positing a causal relation between them?

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la ni 'gal ba yod do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la ni 'gal ba yod do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: But in the case of the external realist, there is a contradiction, as has already been explained.

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gal te phyi rol rtogs 'gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te phyi rol rtogs 'gyur na //
translated: If external objects were cognized,

original: phyi nas nyid ni @78b rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas nyid ni @78b rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: then external objects would be cognized later.

original: sngar rtogs pa na ni thams cad kyi //
analyzed: sngar rtogs pa na ni thams cad kyi //
translated: When cognized earlier,

original: rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa ni //
translated: all aspects would be cognized.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi me la sogs pa rtag pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi me la sogs pa rtag pa nyid yin na /
translated: If external fire, etc. are permanent,

original: de'i rnam pa gcig nyid du sngar nyid rtogs zin pas na rjes su dpag pa las ci'i don du 'jug //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa gcig nyid du sngar nyid rtogs zin pas na rjes su dpag pa las ci'i don du 'jug //
translated: then since their form is already known as just one, for what purpose is there engagement in inference?

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa nyid na de lta yin na ji ltar 'di yod par rtogs /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa nyid na de lta yin na ji ltar 'di yod par rtogs /
translated: But if the intrinsic reality of that is not known by inference, then how is it known to exist?

original: gzhan gyi ngo bor rtogs na ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin la yang mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bor rtogs na ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin la yang mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: If it is known as another‚Äôs intrinsic reality, then it is the same for the nature of consciousness.

original: 'on te rtogs pas snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa dag der sgro 'dogs par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pas snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa dag der sgro 'dogs par byed do zhe na /
translated: But if it is known by inference, and then engagement is made by taking the appearance and the object of investigation as one, then it is superimposition.

original: sgro brtags pa des ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: sgro brtags pa des ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the use of that superimposition?

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not like that.

original: de med na phyis kyis don rnam par chad pa skyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de med na phyis kyis don rnam par chad pa skyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it does not exist, then later the object is produced as a conceptual distinction.

original: de min pa'ang rnam par chad pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de min pa'ang rnam par chad pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But if it is not like that, how can there be a conceptual distinction?

original: gal te rnam par mchad par rtogs pas dngos po yin na bag chags bar du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par mchad par rtogs pas dngos po yin na bag chags bar du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If you say that a thing is not interrupted because it is understood to be interrupted, then it is not a latent impression.

original: de lta na yang mi 'chad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na yang mi 'chad pa nyid do //
translated: Even so, it is not interrupted.

original: goms pa la de'i rang bzhin nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: goms pa la de'i rang bzhin nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not the nature of a thing to be cultivated,

original: de ltar khas len pa na don la yang de'i rang bzhin nyid med do //
analyzed: de ltar khas len pa na don la yang de'i rang bzhin nyid med do //
translated: then it is not the nature of an object to be accepted.

original: mthong ba ni ma mthong ba dang mtshungs par rtogs nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba ni ma mthong ba dang mtshungs par rtogs nus pa ma yin no //
translated: A thing that is seen cannot be understood to be unseen.

original: 'on kyang sgro btags pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad la /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgro btags pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad la /
translated: But it is only a superimposition.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa smra ba la yang mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa smra ba la yang mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: This is the same for the proponents of consciousness.

original: gal te rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dag nyid bag chags par du zhugs pa dag ji ltar das de rnam par ma chang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dag nyid bag chags par du zhugs pa dag ji ltar das de rnam par ma chang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the causes of consciousnesses of different types are latent impressions, how can they be interrupted?

original: dper na rgya skyes kyis bskus pa //
analyzed: dper na rgya skyes kyis bskus pa //
translated: For example, a seed of the pomegranate

original: bar du rigs mi mthun skye la //
analyzed: bar du rigs mi mthun skye la //
translated: produces an intermediate fruit of a different type,

original: 'jig rten rgya skyegs 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgya skyegs 'bras bu yin //
translated: but the fruit is still called a pomegranate.

original: rnam chad med par de 'dod bzhin//üîΩbar du rigs mi mthun pa yi //
analyzed: rnam chad med par de 'dod bzhin// bar du rigs mi mthun pa yi //
translated: It is asserted that the subsequent consciousnesses arise without interruption.üîΩIn the interval, the collection of consciousnesses of dissimilar type

original: rnam shes tshogs ni 'byung 'gyur pa //
analyzed: rnam shes tshogs ni 'byung 'gyur pa //
translated: arises.

original: de yi ba ga chags rjes 'brel pa //
analyzed: de yi ba ga chags rjes 'brel pa //
translated: The subsequent consciousnesses are connected to the preceding ones

original: nyid las rnam chad med par 'gyur //
analyzed: nyid las rnam chad med par 'gyur //
translated: and arise without interruption.

original: dper na rgya skyegs kyi khu bas byugs pa /
analyzed: dper na rgya skyegs kyi khu bas byugs pa /
translated: For example, when a seed of sesame oil plant is planted in a field

original: mar du 'byung ba'i sa bon dang myu gu dang / 'dab ma dang / sngon bu la sogs pa dag la 'bras bu las rjes su dpag pa'i nus pa'i khyad par 'jog pas na /
analyzed: mar du 'byung ba'i sa bon dang myu gu dang / 'dab ma dang / sngon bu la sogs pa dag la 'bras bu las rjes su dpag pa'i nus pa'i khyad par 'jog pas na /
translated: that has been smeared with sesame oil, the oil of the seed and the oil of the plant are inferred from the effect.

original: 'jig rten dag rnam par ma chad par skyed do zhes pa skyed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'jig rten dag rnam par ma chad par skyed do zhes pa skyed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Thus, the world asserts that the effect arises without interruption.

original: sngar gyi mer snang ba'i yang phyis mi snang bar du 'byung ba rigs mi mthun pa'i snang ba dag la der gnas pa bzhin du rang gi nus pa 'dzin par byed pas na /üîΩ'bras bu rnam par @79a * //
analyzed: sngar gyi mer snang ba'i yang phyis mi snang bar du 'byung ba rigs mi mthun pa'i snang ba dag la der gnas pa bzhin du rang gi nus pa 'dzin par byed pas na / 'bras bu rnam par @79a * //
translated: In the same way, the subsequent appearances of dissimilar type arise without interruption from the previous appearances of fire, because the subsequent ones hold the potential of the previous ones.

original: ma chad pa kho nar skyed par byed do zhes brjod pa 'am nges pa yin no //
analyzed: ma chad pa kho nar skyed par byed do zhes brjod pa 'am nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the effect arises without interruption.

original: des na sngar gyi snang ba de nyid mer snang ba de skyed par byed pa yin gyi du bar snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sngar gyi snang ba de nyid mer snang ba de skyed par byed pa yin gyi du bar snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of fire is produced by the appearance of smoke, but not by the appearance of smoke.

original: de la ji ltar phyi'i don smra ba dag gi ltar phyis kyi mer snang ba las sngar me byung bar gyur to zhes rtogs par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa smra ba'i ltar na yang bag chags yong par 'gyur ro zhes rtogs pas 'di gnyis
analyzed: de la ji ltar phyi'i don smra ba dag gi ltar phyis kyi mer snang ba las sngar me byung bar gyur to zhes rtogs par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa smra ba'i ltar na yang bag chags yong par 'gyur ro zhes rtogs pas 'di gnyis
translated: Just as the proponents of external objects understand that fire existed previously because of the later appearance of fire, in the same way, the proponents of consciousness understand that the latent impression exists because of the appearance of smoke.

original: la khyad par med do //
analyzed: la khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference between these two.

original: du bar snang ba las kyang du ba'i bag chags rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: du bar snang ba las kyang du ba'i bag chags rtogs pa yin no //
translated: And from the appearance of smoke, the latent impression of smoke is understood.

original: bag chags rgyu yin pa nyid du ni bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: bag chags rgyu yin pa nyid du ni bsgrubs zin to //
translated: It has already been established that the latent impression is the cause.

original: phyi rol gyi rgyu'i dngos po nyid du 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rgyu'i dngos po nyid du 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that external things are the cause.

original: 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: du ba me skyed 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: du ba me skyed 'gyur ma yin //
translated: Smoke does not produce fire.

original: de phyir 'bras bu rgyu rtogs min //
analyzed: de phyir 'bras bu rgyu rtogs min //
translated: Therefore, the effect is not understood from the cause.

original: de rgyu dag ni yin na yang //
analyzed: de rgyu dag ni yin na yang //
translated: Even if those are the causes,

original: gang las nges par rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang las nges par rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: from what is it definitely understood?

original: gal te du ba'i bag chags nyid du ba yin la de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te du ba'i bag chags nyid du ba yin la de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin gyi /
translated: If the mere latent impression of smoke were smoke, and that were the entity of cause and effect,

original: me las du ba ma yin te /
analyzed: me las du ba ma yin te /
translated: smoke would not arise from fire,

original: de'i tshe med pa'i phyir dang / rang gi bag chags dang 'brel pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe med pa'i phyir dang / rang gi bag chags dang 'brel pa'i phyir /
translated: because it would not exist at that time and because it would be related to its own latent impression.

original: gal te mer snang ba yang de'i bag chags sad pa de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis du bar snang ba'i rgyu yin pas rgyu nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te mer snang ba yang de'i bag chags sad pa de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis du bar snang ba'i rgyu yin pas rgyu nyid yin na /
translated: If the appearance as fire is the cause of the appearance as smoke because it is the mere activation of its latent impression and it is concordant with it,

original: de ltar yin na du ba yang me'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yin na du ba yang me'i rgyu yin no //
translated: then smoke would be the cause of fire.

original: rgyu nyid yin na yang nges par rtogs par ga las yod de /
analyzed: rgyu nyid yin na yang nges par rtogs par ga las yod de /
translated: But if it were the cause, how could it be ascertained?

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is mistaken.

original: 'di la bshad pa /üîΩde la'ang du bar snang ba'i blos //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa / de la'ang du bar snang ba'i blos //
translated: The response to that is:üîΩThe cognition that appears as smoke

original: bag chags gsal bar sad ba can //
analyzed: bag chags gsal bar sad ba can //
translated: has the latent impression activated.

original: mer snang ba yin blo nyid ni //
analyzed: mer snang ba yin blo nyid ni //
translated: The appearance as fire is the cognition itself,

original: rtogs 'gyur me nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs 'gyur me nyid ma yin no //
translated: but it is not ascertained as fire.

original: 'di ltar du bar snang ba'i blo ni bag chad dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar du bar snang ba'i blo ni bag chad dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Thus the cognition that appears as smoke is related to its latent impression.

original: de las ni bag chags de rjes su dpog go //üîΩbag chags de yang sad pa la mngon du phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de las ni bag chags de rjes su dpog go // bag chags de yang sad pa la mngon du phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: The latent potentialities are inferred from that.üîΩAnd since those latent potentialities are directed toward the arising of the appearance of fire,

original: mer snang ba bskyed pas na mer snang ba thob pas tshang ma yin no //
analyzed: mer snang ba bskyed pas na mer snang ba thob pas tshang ma yin no //
translated: the appearance of fire is produced by the cause of the latent potentialities.

original: dper na phyi'i don smra ba rnams kyi ltar na /üîΩme rjes su dpag pa las mer snang ba'am me gzhan yin pa des na /
analyzed: dper na phyi'i don smra ba rnams kyi ltar na / me rjes su dpag pa las mer snang ba'am me gzhan yin pa des na /
translated: For example, according to the proponents of external objects,üîΩthe appearance of fire is inferred from smoke, and since the appearance of fire is different from the smoke,

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas me mthong ba de bzhin du du ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i me snang ba gnyis bag chags dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas me mthong ba de bzhin du du ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i me snang ba gnyis bag chags dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: the appearance of fire and the smoke are related by a single causal process.

original: gal te lkog tu gyur pa dang ma gyur pa'i me gcig nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lkog tu gyur pa dang ma gyur pa'i me gcig nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the hidden and unhidden fires are identical,

original: ma yin te tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then there would be no valid cognition.

original: bag chags kyi dbang gis gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir na bag chags rang @79b nyid don dam par gcig yin gyi /
analyzed: bag chags kyi dbang gis gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir na bag chags rang @79b nyid don dam par gcig yin gyi /
translated: Since they are identical due to the power of latent potentialities, the latent potentialities themselves are ultimately identical,

original: dngos po ni ma yin no zhes 'di yang bstan zin to //
analyzed: dngos po ni ma yin no zhes 'di yang bstan zin to //
translated: but the entities are not. This has already been explained.

original: phyi'i don la yang me nyid rje su dpog pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyi'i don la yang me nyid rje su dpog pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: In the case of external objects, it is not fire itself that is inferred,

original: 'on kyang 'byung ba'i snang ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'byung ba'i snang ba nyid yin te /
translated: but rather the appearance of fire,

original: srog chags rnams de don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog chags rnams de don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because living beings seek that.

original: me mi snang ba'i mes ni su la yang dgos pa med do//
analyzed: me mi snang ba'i mes ni su la yang dgos pa med do//
translated: No one needs fire that does not appear.

original: snang ba don du gnyer ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i snang ba rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: snang ba don du gnyer ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i snang ba rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur mod /
translated: If one seeks the appearance, one will infer the appearance of fire, but

original: me rjes su dpog pas ci bya /
analyzed: me rjes su dpog pas ci bya /
translated: what is the use of inferring fire?

original: ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba rjes su dpog ce na /üîΩde lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba rjes su dpog ce na / de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How can one infer the appearance of fire?üîΩBecause one sees it in that way.

original: mthong phyir de lta nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: mthong phyir de lta nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is so because it is seen,

original: 'di la mi rigs mthong ba med //
analyzed: 'di la mi rigs mthong ba med //
translated: there is no seeing of what is impossible.üîΩIn the case of external objects, there is no possibility of error

original: phyi don la ni mi slu dang // mthong ba'ang srid ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi don la ni mi slu dang // mthong ba'ang srid ba ma yin no //
translated: and also no possibility of seeing.

original: 'byung ba'i snang ba nyid kyis rjes su dpog pa la thams cad mi 'thad pa med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i snang ba nyid kyis rjes su dpog pa la thams cad mi 'thad pa med do //
translated: In the case of the inference of the appearance of fire, there is nothing that is not tenable.

original: phyi rol gyi rmi lam na yang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rmi lam na yang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: But in the case of external objects, there is no possibility of error.

original: 'di ltar / de bzhin 'byung 'gyur myong ba ni //üîΩrjes su dpag pas shin tu nges //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de bzhin 'byung 'gyur myong ba ni // rjes su dpag pas shin tu nges //
translated: Thus:

original: da ltar 'byung don rig na ni //
analyzed: da ltar 'byung don rig na ni //
translated: The cognition of the present object

original: yod pa min zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: yod pa min zhes bstan zin to //
translated: has been shown to be non-existent.

original: de lta ma yin na 'ga' yang 'byung ba'i don la ltos pas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'ga' yang 'byung ba'i don la ltos pas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then no one would engage in the object of origination.

original: 'on te da ltar dang 'byung bar 'gyur bdag la gcig tu zhes pas 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te da ltar dang 'byung bar 'gyur bdag la gcig tu zhes pas 'jug go zhe na /
translated: But if one engages in the present and the future, by saying ‚Äúone,‚Äù

original: de ltar yin na ni 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don rig pa nyid yin gyi da ltar ba rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don rig pa nyid yin gyi da ltar ba rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then it is the cognition of the object of origination that is, and not the cognition of the present.

original: rig pa ni thob pas rjes su dpog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rig pa ni thob pas rjes su dpog pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like inference through obtaining.

original: des na da ltar ba'i rang bzhin mi 'thob pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba ni bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ni 'byung ba'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: des na da ltar ba'i rang bzhin mi 'thob pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba ni bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ni 'byung ba'i yul can nyid do //
translated: Therefore, because the present is not obtained, and because origination is excluded, the valid cognition has the object of origination.

original: da ltar ba'i rnam pa ni yod kyang bden ba ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i rnam pa ni yod kyang bden ba ma yin no //
translated: The present aspect exists, but it is not real.

original: mngon sum yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid la tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid la tshad ma yin no //
translated: Direct perception is also a valid cognition with regard to origination.

original: de ltar yang bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar yang bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, it has been demonstrated.

original: des na ji skad du /
analyzed: des na ji skad du /
translated: Therefore, it is as stated:

original: don 'di ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin te shes pa dus na yod pa ma yin no zhes smras pa de bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: don 'di ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin te shes pa dus na yod pa ma yin no zhes smras pa de bsal ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis object will arise, but it does not exist at the time of cognition.‚Äù

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
translated: This is refuted because it is not the case that it does not arise.

original: phrad pa las kyes pa'i mngon sum de tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: phrad pa las kyes pa'i mngon sum de tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, perception that arises from contact is a valid cognition.

original: des na yod pa dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na yod pa dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang spangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the statement, ‚ÄúIt is not a reason because an existent is observed,‚Äù is also refuted.

original: des na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir na de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i dngos po la tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir na de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i dngos po la tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since perception and inference have objects that will arise, they are valid cognitions in regard to things that conform with them and reverse from them.

original: @80a * // don dam par ni thams cad rang gi ngo bo'i yul can nyid la tha snyad du ni 'byung ba'i don gyi yul can yin no //
analyzed: @80a * // don dam par ni thams cad rang gi ngo bo'i yul can nyid la tha snyad du ni 'byung ba'i don gyi yul can yin no //
translated: In the ultimate, they have the nature of their own entity as their object. Conventionally, they have the object of an arising entity.

original: 'byung ba'i don de yang thob pa'i yul yin pa de'i phyir na don bya ba byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i don de yang thob pa'i yul yin pa de'i phyir na don bya ba byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: And since that object is the object of attainment, it is the object of the function of the object.

original: gal te tha snyad khas len par byed na don gyi yul can nyid yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad khas len par byed na don gyi yul can nyid yin par 'gyur la /
translated: If one accepts the conventional, it is the object of the object.

original: don de yang dad ltar ba nyid yin pas 'byung ba'i yul tsam nyid du bsgrubs pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: don de yang dad ltar ba nyid yin pas 'byung ba'i yul tsam nyid du bsgrubs pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: And since that object is just as it appears, what is the use of establishing it as merely the object of the arising?

original: 'di la bshad pa /üîΩma rtogs cung zad rtogs stsogs kyi //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa / ma rtogs cung zad rtogs stsogs kyi //
translated: To explain this, the root text says:üîΩThe conventional is threefold:

original: dbye bas tha snyad de rnam gsum //üîΩde la brten nas 'du dag ni //
analyzed: dbye bas tha snyad de rnam gsum // de la brten nas 'du dag ni //
translated: That which is not understood, that which is partially understood, and so on.üîΩBased on that, all the assemblies

original: thams cad 'thad pa nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: thams cad 'thad pa nyid du rtogs //
translated: are understood to be tenable.

original: ma rtogs pa rnam skyi tha snyad ni mngon sum dang lta ba'i don gyi yul can yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa rnam skyi tha snyad ni mngon sum dang lta ba'i don gyi yul can yin no //
translated: The conventional of that which is not understood is the object of the direct perception of the object.

original: cung zad rtogs pa rnam skyi ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul can /
analyzed: cung zad rtogs pa rnam skyi ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul can /
translated: The conventional of that which is partially understood is the object of the arising.

original: shin tu rtogs pa rnams kyi ni snang ba tsam gyi yul can nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu rtogs pa rnams kyi ni snang ba tsam gyi yul can nyid do //
translated: The conventional of that which is completely understood is the object that is merely an appearance.

original: de na gal te ma rtogs pa'i shes pa la ltos te /
analyzed: de na gal te ma rtogs pa'i shes pa la ltos te /
translated: Therefore, if one relies on the consciousness of that which is not understood,

original: don gyi yul can yin la ;
analyzed: don gyi yul can yin la ;
translated: it is the object of the object.

original: don yang da lta ba'i yin na grub pa grub la sgrub pa de ni de lta bu kho nar kho bo cag 'dod do //
analyzed: don yang da lta ba'i yin na grub pa grub la sgrub pa de ni de lta bu kho nar kho bo cag 'dod do //
translated: If the object is present, then the establishment of the established is just what we maintain.

original: nges na du bar snang ba'i shes pas ni me'i bag chags nyid rtogs par byed la /
analyzed: nges na du bar snang ba'i shes pas ni me'i bag chags nyid rtogs par byed la /
translated: If it is not present, then the consciousness to which smoke appears causes the cognition of the potentiality of fire.

original: bag chags de yang 'byung ba'i snang bdag gcig tu rtogs pas de'i ngo bor snang ba la 'jug par byed pa yin pas na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i snang ba de nyid rtogs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bag chags de yang 'byung ba'i snang bdag gcig tu rtogs pas de'i ngo bor snang ba la 'jug par byed pa yin pas na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i snang ba de nyid rtogs par bya ba yin te /
translated: And since that potentiality is the cause of the appearance of the element, it causes the appearance in the form of that. Therefore, the appearance of the element that will arise is what is cognized.

original: phyi'i don 'dod pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i med bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi'i don 'dod pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i med bzhin no //
translated: It is like the case of the desire for an external object.

original: des na don dam par snang bar 'gyur ba'i yul yin no //
analyzed: des na don dam par snang bar 'gyur ba'i yul yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object that will appear is the ultimate object.

original: gal te phyir kyi 'khrul pa snang bar 'gyur ba yin na //
analyzed: gal te phyir kyi 'khrul pa snang bar 'gyur ba yin na //
translated: If the appearance of the external error is what is desired,

original: der don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur pa yin nam //
analyzed: der don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur pa yin nam //
translated: then why is the object not desired?

original: 'jig rten don nyid don du ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten don nyid don du ni //
translated: The world desires the object itself,

original: gnyer gyi snang ba don gnyer min //üîΩ'jig rten la 'ga' rmi lam gyi //
analyzed: gnyer gyi snang ba don gnyer min // 'jig rten la 'ga' rmi lam gyi //
translated: not the appearance that is desired.üîΩIn the world, no one is seen to desire

original: bde ba don gnyer mthong ba med //
analyzed: bde ba don gnyer mthong ba med //
translated: the pleasure of a dream.

original: de ni ma yin te 'di ltar /üîΩgal te bag chags brtan brten nas //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te 'di ltar / gal te bag chags brtan brten nas //
translated: That is not so.üîΩIf, due to the stability of latent impressions,

original: snang ba mtshams sbyor ldan na der //
analyzed: snang ba mtshams sbyor ldan na der //
translated: there is a connection with the appearance,

original: rmi lam bden min yin yang der //
analyzed: rmi lam bden min yin yang der //
translated: then, even though the dream is not real,

original: khyed la chad pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: khyed la chad pa ci zhig yod //
translated: what fault is there for you?

original: gang la bag chags kyi khyad par nyid las 'chugs pa med pa de ni rmi lam gyi bden pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la bag chags kyi khyad par nyid las 'chugs pa med pa de ni rmi lam gyi bden pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If there is no error due to the specific latent impressions, then the dream is not real.

original: rnam par shes pa smra ba rnams la yang bag chags kyi khyad par la rmi lam dang ci shos pa'i dbye ba ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smra ba rnams la yang bag chags kyi khyad par la rmi lam dang ci shos pa'i dbye ba ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: Even for the Proponents of Consciousness, there is a distinction between dreams and reality due to the specific latent impressions.

original: @80b dper na rmi lam nyid na rmi lam dang cig shos khyad par yod pa bzhin no //
